Actualmente anhela incrementar su negocio de venta de animales y productos de belleza, comprando alimento balanceado y más productos de belleza para posterior venta respectivamente.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa de 4000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her family in a home they own located in the community of La Raya in the district of Túcume,  a tourist area that belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  

Mary is a very hardworking woman. She works in various activities such as raising and selling small animals and selling chicken (butchered). She also owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle that has a cab attached to it used to transport cargo and passengers) and she sells basic necessity products. With the income she makes from these activities she pays for her own expenses and those of her families. Her husband is a farmer.

Right now she wants to grow her business selling animals and beauty products, buying balanced feed and more beauty products to sell. That is why she has decided to take out a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for cattle and beauty products.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 30, is married and has a 5-year-old son who is currently in school. She carries out her own economic activity to earn income to support her family. Amina sells used and new clothes like jeans, blouses, sandals and women’s underwear. She’s been in business one year and spends most of her time on it. 

Amina's requesting a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Yehu (her first loan) to buy more merchandise in order to have a variety of clothes. Her sales will increase with this investment and she’ll have more customers. Her goal is to set up her business in a fixed locale in a strategic spot. She dreams of her son attaining a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y vive en casa de su madre en el distrito de Cayalti, el lugar ha experimentado un incremento en su actividad comercial durante los últimos años. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Esther trabaja desde hace 10 años en la crianza y venta de animales. Esta actividad le sirve para adquirir ingresos adicionales con los cuales solventa sus gastos familiares. Ella cría animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona frecuentemente.  Su esposo se dedica a reparaciones de bicicletas

Esther desea comprar más animales para su crianza y posterior venta. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esther, 37, is married and lives in her mother's house in the Cayaltí district.  The area, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, has experienced commercial growth in recent years.

Esther has worked for 10 years raising and selling animals.  This job gives her additional income to pay for her family expenses.  She raises small animals in corrals located behind her home.  When the animals have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the buyers who regularly visit the area.  Her husband works repairing bicycles.

Esther wants to buy more animals to raise and then sell, so she has requested a loan for 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to deliver a better finished product.

loans.name: Crisóstomo

texts.es:
El señor Crisóstomo esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mercancía ya que no tiene suficiente productos a la venta y desea tener mas variedad como es fruta, verdura, carnes fría y productos de lácteos.  
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando la universidad, para el es muy importante que terminen sus estudio para que tengan un futuro emprendedor. 
El señor Crisóstomo y su esposa son los que atienden el negocio y entre los dos han salido adelante y han trabajado muy duro  para darles a sus hijos lo mejor.
Desea invertir en el negocio ya que sus clientes les están solicitando que tengan este tipo de mercancía para vender, y así su negocio tendrá más ganancias.
El señor Crisóstomo anteriormente a tenido créditos con KIVA y los a pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Crisóstomo is once again requesting a loan to invest in merchandise because he doesn't have enough products on sale.  He wants to have a greater variety, such as fruit, vegetables, cold meats, and dairy products.

This business is his source of income for his family.  He has two children who are in college.  It's very important for him that they finish their education so they have an enterprising future.

Crisóstomo and his wife take care of the business and between them they've gotten ahead and worked very hard to give their children the best.

He wants to invest in his business because his customers are requesting this type of merchandise.  This way his business will have more earnings.

Crisóstomo had had previous Kiva loans and he paid them back punctually.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Sa'eda

texts.en:
Sa'eda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sa'eda, 34, is the married mother of two sons and two daughters. She is a UN employee and her husband is also employed but both are earning low salaries that are not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

Sa'eda is therefore requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture for her children in order to improve their living conditions in the house. Taking this loan will offer to her children comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in the house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture for her children.

loans.name: Ytalo

texts.es:
Ytalo tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus 03 hijos. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío San Pedrillo del Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Ytalo, es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio. 
Complementariamente es empleado estable en un fundo agrícola, en donde está en planilla.  Con los ingresos que percibe cubre los gastos familiares.

Ytalo desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales y obtener una mejor producción que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ytalo es un hombre entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de sus seres queridos, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran como tranquilo y responsable.
texts.en:
Ytalo is 32 years old. He is in a common law marriage and is raising 3 children. He lives in a home he owns with his wife and three children. The house is located in the community of San Pedrillo of the District of Tambogrande. He lives in a rural part of the district and doesn't have basic utilities.

Ytalo's activity is raising small livestock (sheep and poultry). When they reach the ideal weight and size, he sells them in the local market. He has 6 years experience in the business. He also has a stable job at a large farm, where he is on staff. With the income he makes, he covers the family expenses.

Ytalo wants to acquire feed to improve the quality of the animals he raises and have better production to keep going in his business. That is why he has decided that it is necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to help him reeach his goal.

Ytalo is a man who is dedicated to his family and always looks out for the wellbeing and development of his loved ones. In the area he lives in, his neighbors and acquaintences consider to him to be peaceful and responsible man.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for livestock

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de boletos turisticos y la socia tambien vende refrigerios como sandwichs,pan con pollo,pan con salchicha entre otros refrigerios,ella lleva a diferentes instituciones,la socia ya lleva 8 años en este negocio de venta de refrigerios y en el negocio de venta de boletos turisticos tiene 9 años,por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los refrigerios.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollo,carne,salchichas y panes para que prepare los refrigerios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues her business of selling tourism tickets, but she also sells light snacks such as sandwiches, bread with chicken, bread with sausages, and other items to various institutions. She has been selling light snacks for eight years and managing her tourism ticket business for nine years. Through these businesses, she wants to move forward. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell snacks.

The member is requesting a loan in order to buy chicken, meat, sausages, and bread for preparing her snacks. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, sausages, and bread for preparing snacks.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia con su familia.  Su esposo trabaja en fundo estable percibiendo ingresos quincenales. La comunidad donde ella vive se encuentra ubicado a 30 minutos de Tambogrande perteneciente a Distrito de Las Lomas. La comunidad con deseos de superación. Aun no cuentan con servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla Martha es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas, etc.  Además cuenta con animales y aves de corral. El trabajo lo reparten entre ella y sus hijos, los cuales a tienden el negocio mientras ella no se encuentra o atiende a los animales. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas hace aproximadamente más de 6 años. Toda la familia contribuye en la manutención del hogar.  Son una familia unida y emprendedora.

Martha quiere incrementar sus negocios, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para compra de capital de trabajo para bodega y compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Cliente cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, 42, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own home with her family.  Her husband works on a large farm and receives stable income every two weeks.  The community where they live is 30 minutes from Tambogrande, in the district of Las Lomas.  The community wants to get ahead, but they still don't have basic services.

Martha's business is selling groceries, beverages, candy, etc.  She also has animals and poultry.  She divides the work with her children, who take care of the business while she's not there or taking care of the animals.  She has worked selling groceries and beverages for more than six years.  The whole family contributes to supporting the household.  They're a close and enterprising family.

Martha wants to expand her business, so she has requested a loan for 2500 nuevos soles [PEN] for working capital to buy for her store and to buy balanced animal feed.

She has a great desire for self-improvement and business growth.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities and balanced feed

loans.name: Mihrije

texts.en:
Mihrije is forty-two years old. She lives in Kosovo. She is married and has three children; one girl and two boys. Currently only one of the children attends school. Her husband works in a car wash. 

Mihrije is a very professional and hardworking woman. To earn a living, Mihrije operates a tailoring and handicraft business from her home. 

She has been operating this business for more than six years and had started to work as a seamstress. Mihrije is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and materials for her work. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. Mihrije’s goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money to use towards her children’s education. 

Mihrije really appreciates the support!

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials for her work

loans.name: Daysi Romelia

texts.es:
Deysi, continua con su negocio en la sastreria, actualmente confecciona uniformes escolares, necesita otro préstamo  para la compra de materiales de costureria Como hilo, telas, botones, ciper, alfiler, tijera, agujas, esponja para almohadillas etc, de estos materiales,el que consume mas de su prestamo es la compra de telas, ya que compra de varias clases y colores para ofrecer a los clientes el servicio completo.
Manifiesta que los créditos anteriores le han ayudado mucho, ya que con las ganancias del negocio compro una máquina y ha mantenido la produccion. La familia se mantiene y la situación del hogar se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
Daysi continues to manage her tailoring business. She is currently producing school uniforms, so she needs another loan to buy sewing materials such as thread, fabric, buttons, zippers, safety pins, needles, sponges to use as pin cushions, and other supplies. Most of the loan will be spent on fabrics since she must buy different types and colors so that she can offer a complete service to her customers.

Daysi says that her previous loans were a great help. With the earnings generated from her business, she was able to buy a sewing machine and maintain her production. As a result, she has been able to support her family and maintain her household.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, buttons, zippers, safety pins, needles, sponges, and other supplies.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos, dos estudian la primaria y una la secundaria. Esta solicitando un préstamo para hacer el cambio de la instalación eléctrica en toda la casa, ya que actualmente la que tiene esta en malas condiciones y le preocupa que les  pueda pasar algo a su familia. 
El señor Raúl trabaja en una fabrica en el aria de producción y su esposo Máyela en empleada como cocinara  en una restaurant de tacos mexicanos. Con el ingreso del señor Raúl será para pagar el crédito y con el sueldo de la señora Máyela será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de sus hijos y que estén en un lugar seguro para ellos.
texts.en:
Raúl is the father of three children, two in elementary school and one in high school.

He's requesting a loan to install electricity throughout the entire house.  Currently the electricity is in bad shape and he's worried that something could happen to his family.

Raúl works in a factory in the area of production, and his wife Máyela is employed as the cook in a restaurant that serves Mexican tacos.  Raúl's income will be to pay back the loan and Máyela's income will be for the family and school expenses.

He wants to improve his children's inheritance and he wants them to be in a safe place.

loans.use: to install electricity in his house

loans.name: Lincoln

texts.en: Lincoln is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be a good man. He operates a restaurant where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located within a busy environment, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 42,000 loan to purchase two water tanks for his household chores, which will be used by his four family members. His business goal is to run a big restaurant within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy two water tanks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the school fees for his children

loans.name: Kenia Jecenia

texts.es: Kenia de 28 años de edad, quien está casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la ciudad de Olanchito, Yoro. Ella realiza su propia actividad económica para generar ingresos para el hogar. Hace 3 años que se decidió por vender productos por catalogo de AVON, VOGUE y ARABELLA, vende cremas, lociones, champú, sandalias, ropa, desodorantes, tintes, esmaltes, productos de limpieza y todo lo que es cosmético. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante es decir entrega a domicilio según pedidos y en su casa. Ella lleva dos ciclos de préstamos con el actual y este es por 8,000 Lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de más productos que le han pedido sus clientes. Su meta es en un futuro tener su propio local y emprender varios puntos de venta, y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Kenia is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Olanchito, Yoro.

Kenia generates her own income through a business that she manages from home. Three years ago, she decided to sell products through catalogs such as Avon, Vogue, and Arabella. The products she sells include crèmes, lotions, shampoo, sandals, clothing, deodorants, dyes, cleaning products, and all other types of cosmetics. Her sales are conducted as a traveling merchant since she must deliver orders to her customers’ homes, as well as sell from her own house.

Kenia has completed two loan cycles and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL that she will invest in more products that her customers have ordered. Her goal for the future is to have her own shop and establish several sales points so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics through catalogs.

loans.name: Delmy Esperanza

texts.es: Delmy, nos ha solicitado otro crédito, por que necesita invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol de la temporada,realizara la inversion en la compra de abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de una manzana de maíz y frijol; El crédito anterior ha dado buenos resultados, ayudandole en la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo  y sacar adelante a su familia, todas las condiciones son las mismas ya que no ha tenido problemas y continuara cultivando el maíz y el frijol, ya que de las primera cosechas logra cancelar el prestamo.
texts.en:
Delmy is requesting another loan because she needs to invest in a seasonal crop of corn and beans. In order to make this investment, she needs to buy compost and herbicides for the plot of land on which she will plant the corn and beans.

Her previous loan ended with good results. It helped her to buy farming supplies for her crops so that her family could move forward. All of her conditions are the same and she has not had any problems with continuing to grow corn and beans. The first crops that she harvested enabled her to pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Eusebio Elias

texts.es: EL SR. EUSEBIO TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTA CASADO CON LA SRA CLAUDIA Y TIENEN 2 HIJOS. EL TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA TARIMERA DONDE REALIZA LABOR DE MANTENIMIENTO. SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA AL HOGAR Y CUIDAR DE SUS HIJOS, ELLA TAMBIEN AYUDA A UNA VECINA A CUIDAR DE SU HIJO Y GRACIAS A ESO RECIBE UN PEQUEÑO INGRESO SEMANAL CON EL CUAL CLAUDIA APOYA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DE SU CASA. EUSEBIO Y CLAUDIA TIENE EL DESEO DE MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA OFRECERLE A SUS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS UN PATRIMONIO DE CALIDAD. POR TAL MOTIVO HAN EMPEZADO A TRABAJAR EN SU CASA REALIZANDO LAS BARDAS PARA MANTENER SU PROPIEDAD EN BUEN ESTADO Y CON MAYOR SEGURIDAD. ACTUALMENTE ELLOS DESEAN PONER LA BARDA FRONTAL DE SU CASA. DEBIDO A ESTO SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO EL SEÑOR PARA LLEVAR ACABO ESTE PROYECTO.
texts.en:
Sr. Eusebio is 42 years old and married to Sra. Claudia. They have two children.

Eusebio works for a company that makes wooden pallets and is in charge of maintenance. His wife stays at a home and takes care of the children. She also earns a small amount of income each week by looking after a neighbor’s child. Thanks to both sources of income, Eusebio and Claudia are able to cover their household expenses.

They want to make improvements to their house so that they can provide a nice home for their young children. For this reason, work has started at their house to put walls around their property to keep it in good condition and provide better security. At the moment, they want to install a security wall in front of the house. Eusebio is requesting a loan in order to carry out this project.

loans.use: to build a security wall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está casado, tiene un hijo, administra una panadería, es un joven emprendedor quien después de aprender el trabajo como panadero, puso su propio negocio, hoy en día cuenta con un negocio crecido y  bien fundado, tiene a su cargo ocho empleados directos, trabaja todos los días las ocho horas,tiene un horno, por el momento no cuenta con sala de ventas, se caracteriza por ser un  distribuidor.
Nos ha solicitado un  préstamo por que necesita invertirlo en la compra de insumos para producir pan como harina, azucar, levadura y en la compra de moldes donde se  coloca el pan para que pase al horno de cocción. Este credito le ayudara a mejorar sus servicios y aumentar la clientela, lo que quiere es sacar ventaja de lo que ya tiene para mejorar.
Sus planes son aprovechar el negocio al máximo, administrarlo de la mejor manera, contribuyendo en el desarrollo de la panadería  y de su familia, su objetivo es crecer y un día contar con un equipo más especializado para la elaboración y producción del pan siendo reconocido por ello.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has a child. He is a young entrepreneur who manages a bakery. After he received on-the-job training as a baker, he wanted to start his own business. Today his business has grown and is well-established. He is in charge of eight employees and works eight hours each day. Juan owns an oven, but he does not have a shop where can conduct sales at the moment. Therefore, he is known for being a distributor.

Juan is requesting a loan because he needs to invest in the purchase of supplies for making bread such as flour, sugar, and yeast. He will also buy sheet pans so that the bread can be placed in the oven to bake. This loan will help him improve his service and increase his clientele. By taking advantage of this opportunity, he will be able to see these improvements.

Juan’s plans are to maximize his business, do a better job of managing it, and contribute to the development of his bakery and his family. His goal is to continue growing so that one day he will have more specialized equipment for making and producing bread that will bring him recognition.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and sheet pans.

loans.name: Aida Corina

texts.es:
Aida tiene 29 años convive con su pareja Erwin de su misma edad y que se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 2 hijos; Byron de 13 años y Dayana de 11 años. Ella es de Otavalo pero vive en la Parroquia de El Pacto ubicada en el cantón de San Miguel de Los Bancos un pueblo que es muy visitado por las cascadas y biodiversidad de especies que se pueden observar en el paso por sus paisajes. Un lugar dueño de una exquisita gastronomía en comida típica que es comercializada por varios de sus habitantes y que conjuntamente con hoteles, almacenes agropecuarios, y oferta de deportes extremos aportan al crecimiento económico de la ciudad. También en el sector rural hay hogares que se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería de donde también se destaca el procesamiento de leche y derivados como queso, manjar, etc. 
Aida heredó de sus padres la habilidad y el deleite en elaborar “panela” un alimento elaborado en base a caña de azúcar que aporta vitaminas y nutrientes al cuerpo humano con la que se realiza bebidas y también sirve como endulzante natural y energizante, tiene propiedades curativas y hasta cicatrizantes en el tratamiento de úlceras. Aida se dedica a la elaboración de este producto desde hace 6 años e invierte hasta 10 horas en el día en esta actividad paralelamente a la atención de su hogar. Ella necesita incrementar sus ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en el pago de la educación de sus hijos por lo que solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa para comprar más insumos para generar mayor producción y así conseguir su sueño de ver a sus hijos creciendo en excelentes condiciones de vida y además culminando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aida, 29, lives with her partner Erwin, who is a farmer of the same age.  They have two children: Byron, 13, and Dayana, 11.  Aida is from Otavalo, but she lives in the El Pacto parish, located in the canton of San Miguel de Lo Bancos.  This is a town that is visited by many people because of its waterfalls and the biodiversity of species that one can observe passing through the countryside.  This place has an exceptional gastronomy; it's known for its traditional dishes that are sold by many of its residents.  In addition to this, the local hotels, agricultural supply stores and offerings of extreme sports activities, support the economic growth of the city.  In the rural neighborhoods there are households who are devoted to farming and livestock activities, so this area also specializes in the processing of milk and its derivatives, such as cheese, sweet milk, and other dairy products.

Aida inherited her parents' talent for making "panela," a food that is made from a base of sugarcane which is full of vitamins and nutrients that are good for the human body.  She uses this to make drinks, and it also serves as a natural sweetener and energizer.   It has curative properties, from healing wounds to treating ulcers.  Aida has been making this product for 6 years, and she invests up to 10 hours a day in this business while also attending to her home.  She needs to increase her income to support her husband in paying for the education of their children.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from the Fundacion Alternativa to buy more supplies to increase her production.  This way, she will realize her dream of seeing her children grow up in excellent living conditions while finishing their education.

loans.use: to improve her crops and increase her production

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité “Unidas” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde febrero del 2010. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 10  señoras de la misma zona y se dedican a distintas actividades que les genera buenos ingresos. Las integrantes del comité son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, manifestaron que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente.
Aparicia es miembro del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de chipa, que es un alimento típico paraguayo muy consumido en cualquier momento del día. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que gracias a su trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de harina de maíz, almidón, queso, anís y demás insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus chipas.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas' Committee began working with the Fundacion Paraguaya in February 2010. Presently, the group is composed of 10 married women from the same zone who are dedicated to distinct activities that generate good incomes. The members of the committee are very united, responsible, and committed to the group. They demonstrate having a great desire to work and get ahead, as part of the committee and individually.

Aparicia is a member of the group. She sells 'chipa,' a typical Paraguayan bread readily consumed at any time of the day. She can count on a very good clientele and, thanks to her hard work, she provides her family with what they need. 

Aparicia is requesting a loan to purchase corn meal, manioc starch, cheese, anis, and the remainder of the ingredients needed to prepare 'chipas.'

loans.use: buy corn meal, manioc starch, cheese, anis, and other ingredients to make 'chipa,' a popular Paraguayan bread.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de empanadas,ella vende empanadas de carne,de pollo y de jamon,la socia vende en los diferentes colegios de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia tambien sigue vendiendo herramientas de jardineria como palas,regaderas entre otros,la socia se dedica a estos negocios 9 años y le va bien y por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las empanadas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para que prepare empanadas como harina,pollo,jamon,carne y mantequilla al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of selling empanadas. The empanadas she sells are filled with beef, chicken, or ham. She sells her products at different schools within the city of Cusco. The member also continues to sell gardening tools such as spades, watering cans, and other implements. She has managed her businesses for nine years and has done very well. Through her businesses, she wants to see her children finish their studies. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell empanadas.

The member is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing empanadas such as flour, chicken, ham, beef, and butter in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, ham, beef, and butter for making empanadas.

loans.name: General Diaz Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre General Díaz forma parte del programa de fundación paraguaya desde el 2011, y están trabajando arduamente en el tercer ciclo.
La Sra. Patricia quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, sabanas y bebidas  nos comenta que mediante el  la ayuda de su grupo y la fundación paraguaya  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. Ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, con lo cual podrá seguir dando a su clientela la variedad a las que están acostumbrados, además esto le ayudará a tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The General Díaz Women's Committee has been a part of the Fundación Paraguaya program since 2011, and they are working hard in their third cycle.

Patricia works selling food, linens, and drinks. She explains that through the help of her group, Fundación Paraguaya was able to really improve her business, her standard of living, and her economic income. She is a person with a strong desire to make a living and, through this work, give her family a decent living without deprivation.

She is requesting the loan to purchase drinks with which she will be able to continue giving her customers the variety they are used to; this will also help her to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Khorolsuren

texts.en: The borrower is a 44-year-old married man. He lives with his family in an outer ger district of the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He supports his family by doing construction work. Both of his sons are students, attending a local university and a high school. He is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugrik loan to do some housing work on his current small house which is very old and uncomfortable to live in. He will do interior and exterior section renovations.

loans.use: to do some housing work on his old house.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, es casado y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres  ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona El Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia. Con el crédito podrá comprar llantas y realizar la transformación a gas, para ahorrar un poco, pues el costo de gas vehicular s menor que el de la gasolina.
El sueño de Edgar es mejorar su s ingresos para adquirir un anticrético, pues aún no ha podido ahorrar lo suficiente, ya que desea dar más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edgar is married and has three children who are of school age. He lives at his parents’ house where he and his family occupy two rooms. The house is located in the District of El Tejar in the city of La Paz.

Edgar currently works as a taxi driver for more than 10 hours each day. He works until the late hours of the evening so that he can cover the cost of education, food, and basic services for his family. The loan he is requesting is for vehicle maintenance since his taxi is the only source of income that he has to support his family. With this loan, he will buy tires and pay for a natural gas conversion. This will save a little bit of money since the cost of natural gas is less than that of gasoline.

Edgar dreams of improving his income so that he can acquire an “anticrético” rental property, but his savings are insufficient at the moment. He wants his family to be more comfortable and have a better quality of life. This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for a natural gas conversion for his taxi.

loans.name: Teco Porave Recavo Group

texts.es:
Teco Porave Recavo traducido del guaraní significa "en busca de un mejor porvenir", y es justamente por ello que estas doce mujeres se han unido para poder procurar un mejor futuro para sus familias, ya que no quieren que tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, como ser ovejas, cerdos, gallinas y demás animales de corral, ellas desean poder salir adelante y de esa forma poder sentirse útiles y ayudar a sus familias con un porvenir distinto.
Teodora, una de las miembros, solicita el crédito para comprar comida para sus animales, ya que estos consumen muchos balanceados y quiere poder tener mas de reserva. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Teco Porave Recavo” means “in search of a better future” in the Guaraní language. This is exactly the reason why these 12 women have joined together. They want to secure a better future for their families, but they want to accomplish this goal without having to deprive them of anything. All of them raise and sell animals such as sheep, pigs, chickens, and other farm creatures. They want to move forward and feel useful so that they can help their families travel a different path in the future.

Teodora is one of the members. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her animals. The animals consume a large amount of balanced feed, so she wants to have more in reserve. Teodora and the other members are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they have received.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie operates a beauty salon in a competitive environment to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to buy hair braids and hair chemicals for her business. This helped her business to improve, and she used the additional income to support her family. 

Winnie dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 60,000 to buy hair braids and hair chemicals for her salon.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben is 44 years old and married, with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For 13 years he has been teaching.  He says that being a teacher has always been his dream, and he is happy having realised it.  With his salary he has been able to buy land and build a permanent residential house. His hardships are a low salary, price fluctuations, inflation and high transportation costs.  

Rauben wants money to pay school fees for his children.   His personal goals are educating his children and upgrading his studies as he wishes to become a school principal.  His business goal is buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jenny Margarita

texts.es:
Jenny, vive con su familia, vive con su esposo, tiene tres hijos de ocho, diez y doce años de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado; dicha actividad la realiza desde hace cuatro años, trabaja todos los días de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, a la fecha la cliente no presenta problema alguno.
Ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de ropa (blusas de diferentes estilos y colores) y sandalia formales y de vestir para la venta y con las ganancias espera ayudar a su familia con  la alimentación. 
El préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, y con los gastos económicos. Sus sueños y aspiraciones es sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Jenny lives with her family, which consists of her husband and three children (ages 8, 10, and 12). She does not have any relatives living abroad. Jenny sells clothing and shoes. She has been in business for four years. Jenny works every day from 6 A.M. to 4 P.M. As of this date, she has not experienced any problems.

Jenny is requesting a loan to buy clothing (blouses in different styles and colors) and formal dress sandals to sell. With her earnings, she hopes to help her family with the food costs. This loan will help to strengthen her business and offset her financial expenses. Her dreams and aspirations include seeing her children move forward with their studies.

loans.use: to buy blouses and sandals.

loans.name: Bridaine

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros,la socia vende motores,llantas y repuestos para carros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local donde vende los repuestos de carro.La socia solicita el credito para comprar motores y repuestos para los carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of selling auto supplies. She sells motors, tires, and auto parts. The member works from 8:00 A.M to 7:00 P.M. and has been in business for 10 years. Her dream is to expand the shop where she sells auto supplies.

The member is requesting a loan to buy motors and automobile spare parts. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy motors and automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia Maritza tiene 35 años de edad y tiene soltera y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien trabaja como representante en un aempresa de anis,la socia los cuyes los vende en los diferentes mercados,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y alimento para los cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old, single, and has two children.  She works raising guinea pigs.  She fattens them as they grow and later sells them at different markets.  She also works as a representative at a liquor store.  Maritza sells the guinea pigs at different markets.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell guinea pigs.  She is asking for this loan to purchase guinea pigs and feed for them.

She is happy with the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two water tanks for his home.

loans.name: Zedekiah

texts.en:
Zedekiah is a 32-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has operated a retail shop for four years, and he got his initial capital after selling coffee.  His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuations, and inflation.   His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car, while his business goal is diversifying business to include mechanized agriculture.

Zedekiah is asking for money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 50-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be a strong and determined man. 

He operates a restaurant  where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a busy environment, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of soft drinks.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more soft drinks for resale. His business goal is to run a prosperous restaurant within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava stems for planting.

loans.name: Orhhontamir

texts.en:
Orhontamir, who is 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a ger, in Arhangai province. His wife helps with his business, and his children go to kindergarten

Orhontamir was previously a driver at a local company, but three months ago he started producing many kinds of trinkets and accessories. During the new season, his business demand has increased, and his sales have been solid. Thus he wants to buy more products to increase his revenue as well as his profit. Therefore Orhontamir is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to purchase raw materials for his trinket products. 

He is a hard working man who says, ''I have a dream to have my own clothing store in the next five years''.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his trinket products

loans.name: David   Ndungu

texts.en: David is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. He runs a taxi transportation business to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years. Previously, he was employed in a different type of business. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management skills. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. David has requested a loan of 25,000 KES to buy tires.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio used the previous loan to buy pestcides and weed his garden. He is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for two years. His hardships are seasonal weather, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and diversifying his businesses. Zaverio intends to use the money to buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: To buy land for growing crops

loans.name: Domitillah

texts.en:
Domitillah is 33 years old and married, with two children who are in school. 

She operates a cafeteria in a favorable business environment to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for one year. Besides, she does livestock farming to supplement her income. Domitillah had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to improve her business. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy ingredients such as maize and wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize and wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 36-year-old married man with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He has a retail shop, and he has also operated a private school for 14 years. He is challenged by a lack of adequate facilities such as classrooms and furniture, since the enrollment is increasing every year.  

His personal goals are educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and building a permanent house for his family.  His business plan is buying land to grow crops, building more classrooms, and hiring more qualified personnel.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing the classrooms. We caught up with him in his retail shop.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing the classrooms at his school.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 31 años, tiene cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 5, 7, 9 y 12 años  se dedica  a la venta de cotillones para todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea bautizos matrimonios, fiestas de quince años, tiene su tienda donde ofrece estos productos en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz,  es una cliente antigua de la institución , con el dinero del crédito comprara  cotillones por mayor para surtir su tienda y así brindar variedad de cotillones a sus clientes , la Sra. Martha se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien sigue surtiendo su tienda y de esta manera genera más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Martha, 31, has 4 children aged 5, 7, 9, and 12.  She has a business selling party favors for all types of events, including baptisms, weddings and special 15th birthday celebrations.  She has a store where she offers her products, which is located in a very busy part of the city of La Paz.  Martha is a longtime client of this institution.  With the money from this loan, she will buy party favors at wholesale to stock her store.  This way, she can have a greater variety of party favors for her customers.  Martha is very grateful to be getting this opportunity to grow her business, because things went very well with the previous loan that she took.  She was able continue to stock her store, and in this way generate more income for her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy party favors at wholesale

loans.name: Hinton

texts.en:
To be a reliable ship technician is Hinton's ideal. He enrolled as a freshman at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. Hinton is the first child of two brothers. He has the opportunity to continue his studies, despite his parents' poor economic conditions. His parents tried hard to look for additional income, so that both children get a higher education. Hinton's father only works as a private employee. His monthly income is just enough for their daily needs. He did not provide a treasure to his children, but he will arm them with the science education that he can give them so that their future is better and happier. 

Hinton's parents are very aware of their condition of deprivation; therefore, Hinton asked to join the student loan program from Kiva. He hopes for a loan from Kiva investors to help finance his studies and to ease the burden on his parents.

loans.use: to pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Daniel   Ndegwa

texts.en:
Daniel, a 30-year-old married father of a 5-year-old, sells cosmetics in a busy environment to earn a living. Engaged in this business for three years and employing one person, he also runs a transport enterprise to generate more income.

Daniel received a previous loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business, and is now requesting a new one for 30,000 KES to buy hair braids, perfumes and hair oil. He dreams of expanding his business and acquiring a van for his transport operation in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, perfumes and hair oil.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 45 years old, and she is divorced. 

She has been engaging in making and selling mats at the market.  She has been in this business for the past six years. In addition, she sells fish from her home. 

She needs a loan to buy reeds for making mats. The loan will also be used to buy more fish for sale. This will help her increase her income and save some to improve her standard of living, make improvements to her house, and provide a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy reeds for making mats and fish for sale

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Fredy es un joven de 18 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear con su familia y sobre todo disfrutar en algunas ocasiones uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Freddy trabaja en una empresa de textiles como obrero, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al  día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Freddy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda, ya que podrá arreglar algunas tuberías de agua, así como también refaccionar las paredes ya que están muy agrietadas, entre otros. De esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia ya que actualmente es alquilada”
texts.en:
Fredey is 18 years old and lives with his partner in the city of Chincha.  The city is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  It is also the birthplace of great glories of Peruvian sports.  Additionally, the inhabitants are very happy people who have a gift for preparing the typical dishes of the area which are very delicious.  Chincha also has beautiful beaches and also develops agriculture and livestock.  When he has free time he likes to walk with his family and enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the rich ceviche.  Due to a lack of finances, he was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to attend university.  

Day by day, Freddy works at a textile factory as a laborer.  He works about ten hours a day and with the fruit of his labor, he is able to meet his household expenses.  He thinks his work is going well because he is responsible and wants to get ahead.  

Freddy is very thankful to the Kiva loaners since thanks their support he will be able to make repairs to his home.  He plans to repair some water pipes and refurbish the walls since they are very cracked.  In this way, he will continue working and fighting to make his ultimate dream come true: having his own home since right now he is renting.

loans.use: to make home repairs such as repairing water pipes and walls.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is a responsible and loving mother to her five children. She established a business selling nipa huts. With this kind of business, she earns about PHP 8,000 each month. She uses the income to pay allowances and tuition fees of her children and the rest to cover their daily needs. 

She would like to increase her income and stock more items to sell, but she has insufficient capital, so she is asking for a loan of  PHP 7,000 to buy more nipa.  

She hopes to save for future expenses for the college education of her children. With her continuous operation of the business, she hopes to further expand it to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more nipa.

loans.name: Kanume

texts.en:
Kanume, a 35-year-old married father of two living in Kasese, Uganda, has been operating a spare parts shop and mobile money business for eight years. His main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Kanume is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home, while in business he aspires to expand into new markets and diversify into farming.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Fadi appears in her Kiva profile photo, in the picture next to his taxi.  

Manal is a 30-year-old young woman, married to Fadi and mother of four sons.  For the past three years, Manal's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Manal is requesting a USD 1,500 youth loan from FATEN to help her husband buy a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Manal's husband to take additional internal and external requests.  That will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Frida Nurmi

texts.es:
La socia Frida Nurmi tiene 50 años de edad,es soltero y tiene 4 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio al negocio de venta de pernos,los pernos son herramientas que se usan para carpinteria,transporte y carpinteria metalica tiene varios usos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pernos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pernos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Frida Nurmi is 50 years old and is a single mother of 4 children. She works in the bolt sale business. Bolts are tools with various uses in carpentry, transportation, and carpentry with metals. 

Frida works from 8 am to 5:00 pm and has worked 8 years in this business.  Her dream is to grow her bolt business. Frida is asking for a loan to buy bolts wholesale.  She is happy for the loan and she promises to repay her payments.

loans.use: to purchase bolts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio Julio tiene 45 años de edad,es soltero,el socio se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes,el socio los hace engordar y crecer y leugo los vende en las diferentes mercados,el socio tambien se dedica a trabajar en el area de seguridad de una empresa,el socio ya tiene 7 años en el negocio de crianza de cuyes,el socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes.El socio solicita le credito para comprar cuyes al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julio is 45 years old and is single. He works as a guinea pig breeder.  He makes the guinea pigs gain weight and grow. He then sells them in the different markets. He also works in security for a company. 

Juilo has been breeding guinea pig for 7 years.  He wants to have a store where he can sell the guinea pigs. He is asking for a loan to purchase guinea pigs wholesale. 

He is happy for the loan and he promises to repay his payments.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale guinea pigs

loans.name: Adela Maritza

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 37 años, es casada, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión para relajarse y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como son los deliciosos Tallarines Rojos; Adela siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora que ha trabajado desde muy joven, ella culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Gracias a su entusiasmo y al apoyo de su Padres, quien le cedió una parte de su terreno agrícola para que lo trabaje, Adela puso en marcha su negocio de cultivo de tuna, el trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diariamente, ella se siente muy a gusto con su negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo y el trabajo que se realiza en él. 
Adela se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la infesta de cochinilla, cubrir gastos de riesgo y compra de herbicidas para todo su cultivo de tuna, de esta manera podrá aprovechar la estación y obtendrá abundante cría de cochinilla, así cuando la cosecha de su cultivo terminé, podrá obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas realizadas, favoreciendo de esta manera a que poco a poco a que Adela pueda cumplir su gran sueño de brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, para verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Adela is a 37-year-old woman.  She is married and lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and two young children who she loves very much and who are her main focus in life.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, puts all her efforts into providing for her family.  In her free time she enjoys watching television to unwind and she often prepares one of her favorite dishes: delicious 'tallarines rojos' (similar to spaghetti).  Adela has always been a very entrepreneurial woman who has worked since she was very young.  She managed to complete her high school studies but, unfortunately, owing to a lack of financial means, she wasn't able to study to become a nurse though she would very much liked to have done so.

Thanks to her own enthusiasm and the support of her parents who gave her some of their farmland to work, Adela started a business growing prickly pear cacti.  She works approximately 10 hours a day.  She is very happy with her business.  She has always enjoyed living and working in the countryside.

Adela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to breed cochineal bugs, cover her irrigation fees, and buy the herbicides that she needs for her prickly pear crops.  This will allow her to make the most of the season and breed a lot of cochineal bugs.  When her crops are grown, she will be able to make good profits from her sales.  This will help Adela to gradually achieve her biggest dream of providing her children with a good education so that she can see them become professionals and upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to breed cochineal bugs, cover her irrigation costs and buy herbicides

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece la banco comunal DURABANK,el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamente de Cusco.

El socio Walter tiene 44 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de transporte local,el socio lleva años en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank DURABANK. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member Walter is 44 years old, has two children and has a partner. 

The member alternates his daily activities with providing local transportation services. The member has been doing this work for several years, and he is doing well thanks to the effort he puts every day in his business. The member works from Monday to Saturday from 6am to 9pm approximately. The member is a responsible and hard-working person, that's how he gets his family ahead.

The member requests the loan to buy tires for his car. The member is grateful for the granted credit and is committed to fulfill all his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un joven de 24 años, está casado con Ana de 21, ellos alcanzaron el nivel primario de estudios. Tienen 2 hijos que están en la edad de 2 años y el más pequeño tiene 4 meses. Viven en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador. En los últimos años Latacunga se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. En esta ciudad muchas de las fiestas conservan un profundo arraigo y pureza muy cercanos a los orígenes históricos o de la tradición ancestral. 
 Juan Carlos aprendió la actividad de elaboración de escobas de sus suegros y de sus padres y ahora le dedica entre 10 y 11 horas al día a este negocio desde hace 9 años, en los cuales ha adquirido experiencia para entregar un mejor producto terminado a sus clientes. Juan vende su producto en su ciudad y varios pueblos aledaños, inclusive en la región Costa y por los viajes prolongados, muchas veces sufre pérdidas porque le roban su mercadería. A pesar de estos obstáculos, solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa para incrementar la producción y seguir adelante con su negocio y un día poder cumplir su sueño de construir una casa en la que su familia  pueda vivir con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 24 years old. He is marred to Anna who is 21 years old. They reached primary level in school. They have 2 children, one is 2 years old and the youngest is 4 months. 

They live in Latacunga, the capital of the province of Cotopaxi. Cotopaxi is one of the provinces that form part of the Sierra Region of Ecuador.  In recent years Latacunga has developed in such a way that is respected as one of the most important parts of the province. This is due to the flower-growing industry, mining, engineering, agribusiness, agriculture, and cattle farming. Additionally, businesses exist that generate interesting income, which commercialize the city and create several opportunities to do well. In this city many of the festivals conserve the purity of the historic origins or the ancient traditions. 

Juan Carlos learned production of brooms from his in-laws and his parents. Now he works between 10 to 11 hours a day for this business. For the last 9 years he has gained experience to deliver an improved finished product to his clients. Juan sells his product in the city and adjacent towns, including the coastal region. Due to the long trips he suffers losses because people steal his merchandise. In spite of these obstacles, he is requesting a loan through “Fundación Alternativa” (Foundation Alternative) to grow the production and continue ahead in his business. One day his dream is to construct a house for his family to live in peace.

loans.use: to grow the production of brooms and improve his quality of life

loans.name: Erdenekhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Erdenekhuyag, 38, is a carpenter privately. Usually he makes furniture and appliances at his house. Since 2000, he has been running his business, and he has had many regular customers in the past years. He owns an old double-floor house which is located in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, of Kherlen, an eastern boundary city in Mongolia. He uses the first floor for his business as a workshop. But his house has some problems, such as heat loss and damage to its roof, inside walls, etc. So he is planning to make repairs and add insulation to them with rock wool, cement and foam. As he thinks, his home will be warmer after the wall and roof insulation and a new smart furnace. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas. The loan he is taking will used to buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.use: To buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.For eight years he has been selling clothes. He began with one million and now has eight million shillings as working capital. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home, while his business goal is to hire employees to help expand the business. Eric is requesting money to buy clothes to sell as the Christmas season is fast approaching.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell as the Christmas season is fast approaching.

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: Mr. Enkhtuvshin, 26, operates a grocery store in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his child in the ger district, an area of nomadic Mongolian traditional yurts and houses. His family owns an old and small house which was built many years ago. Since it was built, there has not been any big repair or renovation to it. First of all, he wants to repair the walls inside and outside, because there is heat loss though the wall in winter. He uses coal in a large amount to heat his home. We know that using the coal is harmful and emits too much toxic smoke to the air. Air pollution has been one of the critical issues in Mongolia for years. Enkhtuvshin will use his loan to buy wall-insulation materials to repair his bad house.

loans.use: To buy wall-insulation materials to repair his bad house.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, aged 37, is married to Omar, and together they have three children -- two sons and one daughter. Alice has always been selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband is also a businessman, and together they strive to see that they cater for the household expenses.

She would like to see her children study and complete their higher education. Therefore, she applies for this loan to invest in her business and buy large quantities of fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, kale, etc, so as to get a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, onions, kale, etc.

loans.name: Bengadi Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Bengadi” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is 29 years old. she was born in neighboring Guinea but she is currently residing in Koidu city with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. For seven years now, Kadiatu has been selling foodstuffs like margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, and palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With this loan, she will buy these items in bulk to add to her current stock.

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy margi, pepper, palm oil, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is 22 years old and married with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For three and half years he has been in the phone accessories business. He started the business with 500,000 shillings, but now his business is worth 5,000,000 shillings. Price fluctuation and theft are great threats to his business. His dreams are to build a permanent home, diversify his business to include farming, and educating his children. Malik intends to use the loan to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 26 years old and married with two children, aged 7 and 3 years. She has been a farmer for the past four years, earning 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) monthly.

This is Lily's first loan with KADET LTD., and she plans to use it on purchasing a dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 

She hopes to start a zero-grazing farm.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a 45-year-old mother of four children who is married to Nassoro, a businessman.

She is a hardworking woman and a fighter. For over ten years, she has been engaged in the sale of fruits and vegetables from her stall that is outside her house. Mariamu learned this business from her mother long before she was even married. This is all thanks to her mother, who taught her to earn a decent living. 

She gets her merchandise from the municipal market. Mariamu is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy bananas, potatoes, kale, passionfruit, and other fruits and vegetables. She is seeing that her business is profitable and the revenue helps cover expenses for her household and her children.

She is thinking about making improvements to her home to have a better quality of life for her family, and so that her children have the opportunity to continue their studies and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, kale, passionfruit, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rita Gisèle

texts.fr: Agé de 49 ans, Rita Gisèle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont cinq sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 25 ans et 10 ans. Elle vend des régimes de banane et des divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'élargir son commerce et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, Rita Gisèle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Le surplus généré par ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Rita Gisèle, age 49, is married and the mother of six children, five of whom go to school.  Her oldest and youngest children are respectively 25 and 10 years old.

Rita Gisèle has been selling banana bunches and various other goods for a few years.  She stocks up at a market located in Benin.  In order to expand her business and to meet her customers' expectations,  Rita Gisèle has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev.

The extra earnings she will make thanks to this loan will allow her to contribute to her children's schooling fees and to meet her own needs.

loans.use: to buy one box of spaghetti, one carton of milk, two dozen packets of powdered milk, two dozen packs of butter, one box of Omo and five banana bunches.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 40 year old man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and has seven children who are all of school-going age. He has a bar which he has been running for six years. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land. Wilson is mainly challenged with price fluctuations, seasonal weather changes and inadequate capital to purchase enough drinks for his customers. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home for the family. His business goals are to hire employees to help expand the business, to move the business to a more permanent location and to expand into new market areas. The purpose of this loan is to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en: Amarbayasgalan is 48 years old and lives with her two children, who are college students, in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a university student and her daughter goes to school. Amarbayasgalan has many years of experience in her own sewing business. The local residents appreciate her as a hardworking and honest woman. She has many regular customers to sustain her business, which generates a monthly income of 1,200,000 MNT. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy goods for her business and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 31, is married to Nelius and they are blessed with one child. He has been running a beauty salon as a primary business and mixed crop farming as a secondary business for the past four years with the monthly income of 8,500 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to buy seedlings and cosmetics for his salon.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for his salon and seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Wardeh

texts.en:
Wardeh, who appears in the picture, is a 27 year old single young woman. She is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover her cost of living.

For the past two years, Wardeh has been doing embroideries which she sells to customers and local stores. This has been a profitable project but also needs more support to cover its cost.

Wardeh is requesting a 2,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing fabrics and threads for doing embroideries. This will increase demand from her customers to request a new collection of embroideries, which will increase her income and offer her better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for doing embroideries.

loans.name: Twikebuke Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuelline fait partie du groupe Twikebuke  et  habite à Ruyigi. Elle a  29 ans et est mariée à  Pascal, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique(haricot, riz,sel,...) depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles (haricot, riz,sel,...) de sa boutique, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Emmanuelline is a member of the Twikebuke group and she lives in Ruyigi.  She is 29 years old and married to Pascal, a seller.  They have four children together, two of whom attend school.

Emmanuelline has been selling grocery items (beans, rice, salt..) for five years.

This is her fourth loan with Turame.  With the loan that she is receiving from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy many goods (beans, rice, salt...) that she will resell in her shop, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many goods (beans, rice, salt..) for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora sells fish in her village. She is able to earn 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) daily if her husband catches an abundance of fish. In addition to this income, she wants to add another source of income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair the fish net and purchase pigs for her new business. She hopes to maintain the business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well to gain a higher income and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair the fish net and purchase pigs for her new business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married woman with six family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. 

Fatima is requesting a 400 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She will use her loan to buy new furniture. In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Tseveen-Ochir

texts.en: Tseveen-Ochir, 35, is a taxi driver and he has been running his business for three years. His wife works as a cook in a cafeteria in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He lives with his wife and three sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their house is located in the Ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. In winter, most Mongolian households use coal-fired stoves to stay warm at home because using wood or chemical fuels is not accepted in Mongolia due to the lack of wood sources. Making the wall insulation is a good way to reduce coal usage in Mongolia. As we know it worsens air pollution and people’s health. Thus Tseveen-Ochir decided to buy some building materials, such as foam and cement, to make the wall insulation for his family's house.

loans.use: To buy some building materials, such as foam and cement, to make the wall insulation for his family's house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 51-year-old dairy farmer from Mariakani. He is a married father with three children. James also keeps poultry and runs a posho mill to supplement his income. He has been a dairy farmer for the past twelve years.
