James is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD to purchase more feed for his dairy cattle and to buy more chicks as well as chicken feed for his poultry. He will use the proceeds from his loan to further expand his business and to repay his loan. In the future, James hopes to educate his children, all of whom are pursuing a college education.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his dairy cattle and poultry and to buy chicks

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga, 34, lives in a suburban neighborhood in the coastal region of Kenya with her husband and three children. For the past year she’s been working on her own fruit and vegetables sales business; she sells from a small stall in her home. The business is profitable, and she uses her profits to cover her family's expenses. She sells things like bringles, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, etc. All the fruit and vegetables are fresh, which is why customers prefer her.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to keep her business well-stocked and with a variety so that her sales will increase. Mariga's goal is to always be growing in her business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Enkhchimegmaa

texts.en: Enkhchimegmaa, 32, is a very neat and hard-working woman. She is a seamstress and has been operating a tailoring business for four years in her home in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband runs a taxi using his old car and earns about 300USD in a month. Currently her business is the main income source of her family. In the past she has had many permanent customers and most of them say, “She makes the best clothes and always tries to do her best.” Now Enkhchimegmaa needs some funding support to buy knitting-cotton to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy knitting-cotton to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg, 45, works in a Mongolian army section as a telegrapher. She has been doing her job for 15 years nonstop. Erdenechimeg is a widow who lives with her three children in an old house which she recently bought. Her house loses heat through the walls and other areas. In winter it is very cold, and Erdenechimeg and her family feel very cold and must use a coal-fired stove to stay warm. 

Erdenechimeg is requesting a loan to buy insulation materials such as foam, cement, and other materials to insulate her home. She hopes to insulate her home and repair it before winter. As Erdenechimeg says, "it will be very beneficial to reduce my cost to the coal purchasing. Yet, it will not be healthful to the environment unless I could reduce the coal usage in winter."

loans.use: to buy insulation materials, such as foam and cement, to insulate her home

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a hardworking married man who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He never got the chance to go to college because his parents could not afford the school fees. For the past  year, Robert has operated a transportation business. His biggest business challenges include the high cost of fuel and mechanical breakdowns that result in financial losses.

Robert is requesting a loan to buy land for farming. He wishes to branch out into farming since agricultural products have a ready-made market in and out of the country. Robert's personal goal is to educate his children through university.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 32-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all their costs. Sabreen is requesting a $1,500 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of painting her house in order to offer suitable home conditions to her family. Taking out this loan will improve the family's living conditions, so they can enjoy living in their house.

Sabreen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

loans.use: to cover the cost of painting the house

loans.name: Suraj

texts.en:
Suraj is 20 years old. He is a hotel (a small restaurant) owner in Mombasa. He is single. He supports his mother and his little sister. Suraj ventured into this business two years ago. In his hotel, he prepares dishes, especially seafood.

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD. to finance his business. He plans to purchase a variety of seafood like prawns, starfish and sardines.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also in the expansion of his business. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seafood like prawns, starfish and sardines for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 38-year-old man who is married and a father with one son and two daughters. He is a worker who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover his family's needs. Khaled has been photographed in his house.

Khaled is requesting a loan from FATEN to help improve his house's condition and cover the cost of painting and installing new windows and doors. His loan will improve his family's living conditions and will provide his family with suitable conditions to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to paint his house and install new windows and doors

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has worked as a tailor since 1993; she works hard to help her husband in making their living and providing her children with most of their needs.

Nada has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four loan cycles. Her previous loans helped her a lot in improving her living conditions and expanding her business.

Nada applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new sewing machine and to pay for her children's tuition fees. Her old sewing machine is not working, and this affects her business a lot; that's why she has to get this loan and buy a new one to reply to customers' needs quickly.

Her previous loans helped a lot in that she moved her house to a better one on the main road.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es: Grimaldina de 22 años de edad, convive con Mario de 26 años y viven en su propia casa, fruto de esa relación concibieron a su pequeño hijos Jeremías de 05 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor prosperidad. Grimaldina, desde muy pequeña se dedica a la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de sus padres obtuvo su propio terreno agrícola con plantas de cacao, café y Hojas de coca. Hoy sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su Distrito y se siente contenta por lo que viene atravesando y no se arrepiente por haber apostado por esta actividad, además asegura que hace un bien al medio ambiente, ya que sus productos son netamente orgánicos y esta asesorada por los Ingenieros Agrónomos. En tiempos de cosecha necesariamente tiene que contratar jornaleros para agilizar con las extracciones de los frutos. Grimaldina con el crédito obtenido realizará la compra de abono orgánico para la buena obtención de sus plantas. Este es su crédito número 05, por el cual  esta llana a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, debido a la transparencia que transmiten los socios. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Grimaldina, 22 years old, lives with her partner, Mario, 26 years old, and they live in their own home. Their young child, Jeremías, aged 5, is the fruit of this relationship and they want to give him a life of greater financial security. 

Since very young, Grimaldina has been farming and thanks to support from her parents, she obtained her own farm land with cacao, coffee and coca leaf plants. Today, she sells these products at the collection centers in her district and she is pleased at what she is experiencing and does not regret having bet on this business. In addition, she assures that she is having a good impact on the environment because her crops are clearly organic as advised by the agricultural engineers.

At harvest time Grimaldina has to rely on day laborers to expedite picking her crops. She will use the loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to obtain a good yield from her plants. This is loan number 5 and she resolves to comply with her payment obligations. She is also comfortable with her communal bank, due to the transparency of the members. With the S/. 1,000, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Diane Essevode

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Diane Essevode est mariée et mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins a 03 ans. Elle distribue du savon, d'Omo, de bougie puis vend des régimes de banane depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de participer à l'éducation de ses enfants avec le bénéfice qui résultera de son commerce, Diane Essevode a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de FINADEV. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d'éviter les ruptures de marchandises qui constitue un manque à gagner pour son activité.
texts.en:
Diane Essevode, age 38, is married and the mother of three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 15 years old and her youngest is 3.

She sells soap, Omo, candles, and has also been selling banana bunches for the past few years.  She buys her supplies from a market located in Benin.

Diane Essevode has requested and received a loan from FINADEV, which will allow her to buy larger quantities of goods and, with the generated profits, to take part in her children's education.  

This loan will also help her to strengthen her activity in order to avoid stockouts which lead to a loss of income.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of soap, five boxes of Omo, one box of candles and eight banana bunches.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 38-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 16 years she has been running a retail shop. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,200,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardships are seasonal weather changes, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home, while her business goal is to expand the business into new markets. Joice wants money to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and also cares for her late sister's children. For the past three years, Sauda has sold charcoal from her home. She works seven days a week and also sells tap water to earn additional income. Sauda lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her main business challenges are transportation and thieves and her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family. 

Sauda is requesting an 800,000 UGX loan to more sacks of charcoal. Her business goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a delivery van to improve her transportation.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with six children, all of whom are in school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. For the past ten years, Hadjah has sold tomatoes, onions, groundnuts, sweet potatoes, and dried fish on a retail basis at the market. She works six days a week and her major business challenges are transportation and the perishability of her products. Hadjah lives in a rental house and her family has access to running water but not electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and medication.

Hadjah is requesting an 1,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, and sacks of onions, groundnuts, and sweet potatoes. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business, buy land, and build a residential house for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, and sacks of onions, groundnuts, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
El socio Serapio tiene 51 años de edad ,el socio se dedica al ngeocio de venta de repuestos,el socio vende repuestos para motos,carros y bicicletas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de respuestos.El socio solicita le credito para comprar repuestos para carros,motos y bicicletas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Serapio, is 51 years of age. He has a business selling spare parts. The member sells parts for motorcycles, cars and bicycles. The member works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. The member has run this business for six years and he dreams of expanding his business selling spare parts.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase parts for cars, motorcycles and bicycles. The member is happy about the loan and promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase parts for cars, motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She has worked as a tailor for 22 years. Fatima rents and tailors women's dresses and her business is expanding upon customer's requests.

Fatima is a hard worker who puts so much effort into improving her business, which is affected by the lack of electricity, and that's why she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a power generator and a new updated sewing machine.

Both items will increase her business and improve her income. Most of Fatima's customers are neighbors, friends, and relatives. Fatima is planning to develop her business into a big clothing factory.

loans.use: To buy a power generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Spencer

texts.en: Spencer is 43 years old with three children living in Masindi-Uganda. For 20 years he has been operating a photo studio and with the profits he has been able to hire business premises in town and pay school fees for his children. Inadequate capital to meet the current digital migration is his major challenge, and his desire is to have one of the most modern studios in town. Spencer is requesting a loan to buy digital cameras for the studio.

loans.use: to buy digital cameras for the studio.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old young man who is married with three sons and two daughters. He is employed and earns a low salary that is not enough to cover his family's cost of living. For the past three years, Rami has also been also driving a taxi and this has been a profitable project that provides a second source of income for his family. He is photographed here next to his taxi.

Rami is requesting a loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. His loan will increase his taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable him to take on additional service requests which will improve his family's income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 40-year-old married woman with three family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. Due to cultural reasons, Amal prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet and her husband is in this photo. 

Amal is requesting a 400 JOD loan to pay for home improvements. She  would like to buy new furniture and do maintenance on her home. In the future, Amal hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: God Bless -Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Saffief.  Saffief is age 31; she was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. But she is currently residing in Koidu, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending primary school. 

For five years now, Saffief has been selling cloth: gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), Bamako cloth (cloth dyed in Mali), etc. With this loan, Saffief will buy gara and Bamako cloths at wholesale to add to her business.

(Also included on the right in the photo is loan officer, Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy gara and Bamako cloth at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a forty-year-old married man living in Fort Portal,Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence.

For twenty-five years he has been a farmer. He bought land with the money earned from local brew, a business he was initially involved in. Like most farmers, he has hardships of price fluctuation, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital to venture into mechanized agriculture. 

He has a vision of hiring employees to help expand the business, using modern farming methods and expanding his business to new markets. Robert needs a loan to buy beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves, and a range of hair straightening products.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are in school. She has additional family members (grandchildren).  

Victo sells secondhand clothes. She runs her business on a retail basis from her home. Victo has been in this business for the last six years. She also has other sources of livelihood. She sells water and does tailoring. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes for sale. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes.  

Victo’s aspiration is to make much more profits and build rental rooms, and also to start importing used clothes. Victo lives in her own house and her family members have access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Akpomè

texts.fr: Agée 49 ans, Akpomè est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 25 ans et 02 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des fournitures scolaires depuis des années, elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire favorablement la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akpomè, age 49, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 25 and 2 years old respectively.

Akpomè has specialized in the sale of school supplies many years ago, and she buys her supplies from markets located in Benin and elsewhere.

In order to boost her turnover and to adequately satisfy the demand from her customers, she has requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev.  Her goal is to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's schooling fees.

loans.use: to buy 12 boxes of notebooks, 3 boxes of "bic" pens, and 8 boxes of various books.

loans.name: Anna   Muwetwa

texts.en: Anna is 44 years old and married with four children. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for five years. Besides this, she does farming to supplement her income. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Anna is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking married woman with four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of building a permanent house for residence and educating her children. 

She has a business of selling shoes that she started with capital of 1,000,000 shillings, and her current working capital is 1,500,000 shillings. Her main hardships are finding more customers, price fluctuation, and inflation. Besides that, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops. 

Christine needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar vive en la casa de sus suegros ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día y también cuenta con una tienda de repuestos de automotores y aceites,que tambien es una ferretería, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para comprar más mercadería como aceites para motor, para frenos, para transmisión, y otros repuestos para su tienda de repuestos, para de esta manera ofrecer mucha variedad y  mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Betty, es adquirir una casa en anticrético para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la décimo cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la septima vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Betty is single and has a son who is school-aged.  She lives with her in-laws, occupying two rooms.  The home is located in the Llojeta neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

She currently works for a private company for more than 8 hours a day, and she also has a hardware store where she also sells automotive parts and motor oil.  This way she can cover her expenses for food, education and basic services for her family.

She needs a loan to increase her capital so that she can buy merchandise such as: motor oil, brakes, transmission parts and other automotive parts for her store.  This way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products and increase her income.

Betty's dream is to acquire a house through an "anticretico" (lease arrangement) so that she can have more comfort and improve her quality of life.

This is the 10th time that Betty has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the 7th time she has borrowed through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, brakes, transmission parts and other automotive parts for the automotive section of her hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband AbdelKareem appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured next to his taxi.

Yusra is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's cost of living.

For the past three years, Yusra's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income to the family.

Yusra is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of insuring and licensing  the taxi he drives. This will enable Yusra's husband to move freely from one area to another and take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing the taxi.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: Minerva is 58, married and has four grown-up children. Her husband manages their rice farming business, but his income is not sufficient for their daily needs. Therefore, Minerva engages herself in a hog-fattening business. She has had her business for almost five years and usually earns a profit of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month that she uses to acquire their basic necessities. She wants to earn more than her usual income, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccine. She believes that through hard work, she will improve the business and hopes that she will earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccine

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The man in the photo above is a client’s husband.  Samina and her husband live in a rented home in a rural area of Faisalabad with their children. 

They started their business three years ago for the betterment of their family.  Samina makes very good designs as she uses different threads with pearls and sequins for embellishment. Her husband assists her in doing this business. Their patterns are very much in demand in their community, and they have a good client list. 

With the loan of PKR.15000 provided to them by Kashf foundation, they plan to purchase raw materials such as fabric, threads, pearls and needles.  This will allow them to provide better customer service. They also hope that their business will give their children a better life and better education. Their goal is to construct their own home for their children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as fabric, threads, pearls and needles.

loans.name: Louai

texts.en:
Louai is a young Palestinian man who is married and a father to two sons. He is employed, but his low salary isn't enough to cover the family's needs. 

For the past three years, Louai has also had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs. 

Louai is requesting a $1,500 loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stocks of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, dairy products and canned food. This will increase sales and increase Louai's income, which will enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. 

Louai is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase needed stocks of basic groceries for sale

loans.name: Betza

texts.es:
Betza de 22 años es madre soltera, vive en su propia casa que sus padres le dieron por herencia, junto a su querida hija Mariluz de 04 años, quien le brinda todos sus esfuerzos. Betza, se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, café y piña; esta labor lo trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.; en los tiempos de cosecha y desyerbo siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes le ayudan a que su trabajo se termine de manera rápida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo la brindan la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su parcela hasta los centros de acopio situado a 30 minutos de su chacra.
Con el crédito obtenido comprará, fertilizantes orgánicos para la buena obtención de sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 02, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y responsable.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles hará la compra de sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Betza, 22, is a single mother who lives in her own home which she inherited from her parents, along with her dear daughter Mariluz who is four years old and for whom she makes all her efforts. Betza earns a living working the earth to cultivate cocoa, coffee and pineapple plants. She does this work with a great deal of effort and sacrifice. At harvest and clearing times she always counts on the help of day laborers who help her finish the work quickly. What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land, since she then feels that the months of arduous labor reward her with the quality of her crops. She been in the business for 15 years and believes the most difficult part is transporting her crops from her plot to the storage centers located 30 minutes from her farm. 

With the proceeds from the loan she will purchase organic fertilizer for maximizing her crops. This is her second loan and she knows she is responsible for making all her payments on time and is willing to do it. In her communal bank she is an active and responsible member. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles she will make the purchase of bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Abelardo  tiene 47 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de mecánica, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja con  autos que necesitan mantenimiento, reparaciones  entre otros, el trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 08:00am hasta las 07:00pm aproximadamente, él socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de algunos repuestos para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Durabank" located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member Abelardo is 47 years old, has two children and is married. He alternates his daily activities with his auto repair business which he has had for a number of years. It is going well for him thanks to the daily effort he puts into his work. The member works with automobiles that require maintenance and repairs among other things, and works from Monday to Saturday from approximately 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. The member is a responsible person and so he gets his family ahead. 

The member is grateful for the loan he has been given and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts for his automotive business.

loans.name: Ameer

texts.en:
Ms Ameer is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a milk-selling business with her husband for five years. She has one buffalo whose milk she sells in her community, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Ammer looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from it. Her husband sells it in various locales on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

Ameer has three daughters and two sons, two of whom are school-going. She needs to earn more to cover their education expenses and to meet the everyday expenditures of the family. In order to do so, Ameer has requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy one more buffalo to increase her milk production and sales which will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with five children. One of the children is in school. She also has additional family members (grandchildren).  

She is a tailor. She buys materials and makes children's and women's wear. She sells her products in a shop on a retail basis. She works six days a week and has been in this business for 10 years.  

Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials. Her major challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her aspirations are to expand her business and make more profits so that she can own a tailoring school.  

Harriet lives in her own house. The family can access electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: Mary is 30 years old and lives in Air port, she is married and has two children ages 4 and 7, they both live with her and attends school, for the past ten years Mary has been selling frozen chicken and  spare ribs,she started this business with 2000 Liberian dollars which was given to her by her mother, she is requesting a loan to purchase a cartoon of frozen chicken and spare ribs for her business. She hopes to go back to school and improve her living conditions.
texts.en: Mary is 30 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and has two children, four and seven years of age. Both children live with Mary and attend school. For the past ten years Mary has been selling frozen chicken and  spare ribs. She started this business with 2000 Liberian dollars, which was given to her by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase a carton of frozen chicken and spare ribs for her business. She hopes to go back to school and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a carton of frozen chicken and spare ribs for her business.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Ms. Iqbal is a 35-year-old widow. Life is hard for her as her husband died many years ago. She came to her parents with three children and didn't want to create trouble for them. She is a courageous lady and didn’t lose hope. She started her business by purchasing a buffalo. She now has two cows and runs a good business in milk sales. She counts on a good client list as most of her clients are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Ms. Iqbal is in her fifth loan cycle and requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees to buy one more cow to meet increasing demand efficiently. She wants to spend a portion of her profit on the betterment of her family and on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Mirzali

texts.en: Mirzali is 50 years old and married to a wonderful woman that helps him in their business. They have one child, a son. The family is involved in an agricultural business. They sell wheat and barley. With this loan of 800 Azerbaijani manats, he intends to buy building materials for repairing the house to solve their housing problem.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing the house to solve their housing problem.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 2  hijos aun pequeños,  que aún están cursando el colegio secundario. María se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas en su domicilio ubicado en el barrio ciudad nueva de ciudad del este.
Gracias al trabajo que está realizando educa a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Siempre tuvo muy buen comportamiento de pago. Con la fundación paraguaya es el séptimo  préstamo solicitado el cual desea poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas para poder surtirse y darle mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. María has two children who are in high school. She sells used clothing from her home in the Ciudad Nueva neighborhood of Ciudad del Este.

Thanks to her work, she has been able to provide her children an education and buy everything she needs for her home. María has always demonstrated a good payment history. This is the seventh loan she has requested from Fundación Paraguaya. She wants to buy clothing so that she can restock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, who is 22 years old, lives together with her friend and two children, aged 4 and 7, at Kakata. She stopped her education in the 9th grade.  Her husband is a business man.  One of the children attends school.  

She has a table in the market where she has sold palm oil, rice, cooking oil, peppers, onions, and tomatoes for the past five years. She learned to sell from her sister, and her friend helped her out in this business, She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods to improve the business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, onions, cooking oil, rice, peppers, and other items for her business.  Her future plan is to buy land  and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, onions, cooking oil, rice, peppers, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Sanyah

texts.en:
Sanyah is 32 years old and lives in the Air Port area. She is single and has two children, aged 4 and 8, who are in school and live at home. For the past 16 years, she has been selling palm oil in the market. She learned this way of selling from her mother and enjoys the profit she makes from her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en:
Rahib lives with his wife and three children. He is a 29-year-old young businessman. Together with his father, he is engaged in animal husbandry. This type of activity is the income for their family. Rahib is also selling clover, and he has been involved in this kind of work for six years. At the current time, he has one dairy cow which provides the family with milk and dairy products.

Rahib is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN manat to purchase one cow. He plans to increase his business to make home repairs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Sicap Mbao Groupe 1

texts.fr: AL OUMA SICAP MBAO GROUPE 1 est un sous  groupement mixte  de 10 personnes qui adhèrent tous  dans la meme association et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus séparées. Ils  sont représentés par madame Koudy Bousso (personne qui a levé sa main sur la photo).C’est une femme mariée très active qui a une double activité commerciale. Elle s’adonne a la vente de tissus et a la restauration et capitalise une expérience de 15 ans dans son activité de commerce. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de soutenir sa famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un prêt prévu pour  l’achat de tissus destinés  a la vente  a l’occasion de la fête de tabaski qui se prépare au Sénégal. Elle s’adonne à son activité journalière ment a partir de 8 heures le matin  jusqu'à 16 heures dans l’après midi. Son objectif est de diversifier  avec l’aide de son financement les produits qu’elle commercialise et aussi d’accroitre les  bénéfices que lui génère son activité. Son projet futur est le développer de son activité de restauration  et ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en: Al Ouma Sicap Mbao Group 1 is a subgroup of 10 men and women belonging to the same association and working in different businesses. They are represented by Mrs. Koudy Bousso (the one raising her hand in the photo). She is a married woman running two types of commercial activities. She sells fabric and cooks food for sale. She has 15 years of experience in business. Her revenues allow her to provide for everyday family expenses. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is seeking a loan in order to buy fabric to be sold at the occasion of the Tabaski holiday [the Muslim holiday of Eid] that people in Senegal are preparing for. She works every day, from 8 AM to 4 PM. Her goal is to diversify her stock thanks to her financing and also increase the revenues brought in by her business. Her future project is to grow her food business and to open a large eatery.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Husain

texts.en:
Husain, who appears in the picture, is a 55-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and four daughters; all of them are above 18 years old. His elder son is employed and the other is a worker.

Husain has been a carpenter since 15 years ago. He has a workshop for making furniture upon customers' and furniture stores' request, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Husain is requesting a $3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new amounts of wood to produce more furniture. This will increase demand from his customers and improve his income and offer to him better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the workshop.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Florentina, casada y con 2 hijos estuantes universitarios, la socia se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad, Florentina realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le proporciona los medios económicos para continuar pagando los estudios superiores a sus hijos. Florentina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, granos y arroz, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad y por permitirle dar una mejor educación a sus hijos, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Florentina pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Florentina is married and has two children who are university students. She prepares and sells food at one of the busiest markets in the city. Florentina has been working for many years and this business has enabled her family to move forward. Now she sets aside part of her income so that her children can continue with their higher education.

Florentina is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy supplies such as meat, vegetables, grains, and rice. For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva for helping her maintain her business. As a result, she will be able to provide a better education for her children. Florentina promises to complete her payments on time. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”, which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, grains, and rice.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо 31 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 11 летнюю дочь. Она окончила Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности бухгалтера в 2004 году. Она очень упорно работает в двух местах для того, чтобы обеспечить дочь со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Ее родня помогают ей по хозяйству и деньгами. Мархабо хочет, чтобы ее дочь выросла  в достатке и не почувствовала, что она растет без отца. Мархабо не в состоянии оплатить за учебы дочери в школе. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебы дочери. Мархабо и ее умная девочка ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Marhabo is 31 years old. She is divorced and raising an 11-year old daughter. She has graduated from the Tajik State University with a degree in accounting in 2004. She works very hard and holds two jobs in order to be able to support her daughter. Her relatives help her out with household duties as well as financially. Marhabo would like her daughter to grow up in comfortable conditions and experience no hardships in spite of growing up in a single-parent household. Marhabo is unable to pay for her daughter’s school fees. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 USD in order to pay for her daughter’s education. Marhabo and her bright daughter are counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Danayaa-Ii Group

texts.en:
Magret is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Magret was born in Sowa Chiefdom, in Eastern Sierra Leone. The 27-year-old is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary schools. Magret sells biscuits, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc,. and has been doing this business for 7 years now.

With the help of this loan, Magret and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Magret will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 
 
(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 46-year-old food stall owner in Mombasa. She is the married mother of four children. She has been selling food for the past five years. This marks her fourth business loan from KADET Ltd to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, plates and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also for the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, plates and serving dishes

loans.name: Mother Group

texts.en:
Mother Group is made up of two women called Lydia and Dei. Their ages are 46 and 50 years respectively and they live in the southern part of Teshie. They sell vegetables and fish.

Lydia has been a vegetable seller for 8 years. She is married to a 50-year-old fisherman and they have one child. She sells vegetables by hawking to customers in Teshie. She now has a small kiosk, which will be used for selling vegetables and fish. She was given 500 Ghana cedis in her 2nd loan cycle and now she needs 900 Ghana cedis to buy more tomatoes, pepper, okra, onion, cabbage, carrot and fish. She reinvested her last profit into her business. She hopes to be a vegetable distributor two years from now.

They need a total amount of 900 Ghana cedis to be able to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, pepper, okra, onion, cabbage, carrot and fish.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 to 12 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the shortage of meat for selling. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy eight goats for selling. Her business goal is to run another butcher shop within 5 years. Eunice also has a motorcycle, which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy eight goats for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old businessman in Mombasa. He sells tomatoes on a wholesale basis. He is a married father with two children. He has been selling tomatoes for the past 14 years successfully. 

This is James’ second business loan from KADET LTD. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more tomatoes to supply to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. 

He hopes to have his own permanent residential house and lead a happy life together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes.

loans.name: Evanross

texts.en:
Evanross is a hard-working mother who sells a variety of groceries in the village. She has operated this business for more than two years. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-age children. 

Evanross and her husband want their children to finish their education so that they will be in employment someday. But because of financial constraint, Evanross wants to improve her business in order to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (P) to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, cooking oil and spices. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can improve her business and achieve her objectives soon.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, candies, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 23 years old, and owns a retail shop in Mombasa. She is a married, and has one child. Joyce has been successfully running her shop business for the last three years.
 
This will be Joyce’s first business loan from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves for resale. She is planning to use her profits to repay her loan, and to reinvest in the business. 

Joyce hopes to have a well-known business, and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma used her previous loan to pay school fees and to buy products for her store.  Now, she is asking for a new loan to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. This would allow her to have a stock of inventory, to get discounts for quick payment, and to offer enough stock to her customers who like buying her products every day.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He is involved with breeding lambs and small livestock animals. He would like to buy more lambs, to make more profit from the meat and milk products sales. 

Anar is planning to use his income to help his parents, and to help him get married. Anar is excited about the expansion of his farm, which will give him an income and allow him to invest in starting other agricultural activities in the future.

loans.use: To purchase lambs.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 37-year-old retail shop owner in Mombasa. He is married, and has four children aged 11, 10, 9 and 3 years old. He has been running his shop business for the past four years with great success. 

This is Geoffrey’s first business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. 

He will use the resulting profits to reinvest in the business, and repay his loan. He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane sells soft drinks to earn a living. She has previously taken a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to buy soft drinks. This helped her business to grow, and she was able to support her family with the additional income. 

Jane would like to expand her business further in the future. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 39-year-old married, vigorous lady. She has been running a general store for the last 5 years. She has faced many problems during her married life, as her husband not in good enough physical shape to be employed.  

Ms Nasreen took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf foundation, and made a small general store near her house.  She has five daughters and one son, and wants to provide them with food and good health. To help her to continue her business, she has asked for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy rice and flour to meet her customers’ demands.  She wants to use part of her profits for her husband’s treatment.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice and flour.

loans.name: Sindy Esther

texts.es:
Sindy es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeña hija de 6 años, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella es padre y madre para su pequeña, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Sindy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 2 años Sindy puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria, sale a recorrer las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de clientes, Sindy puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Sindy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como prendas de vestir para niños, como polos, buzos, compas, entre otros, de esta manera Sindy tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para junto con su pequeña pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sindy is a 23 year old woman. She lives in the city of Pisco with her young 6 year old daughter. Unfortunately, for various reasons, she has been separated for some years from her partner. Since then, she has been both mother and father to her little one. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who dedicates all her efforts to getting her family ahead. Due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Sindy wasn’t able to study for a professional career, but she would have very much liked to do so. 

With much determination and dedication, 2 years ago Sindy started her small business selling clothing. Every day in the early morning hours she starts working. She makes her sales in an ambulatory way; she goes out to work the various streets in the city in search of customers. Sindy can work around 10 hours, and she feels that it’s going well because of her dedication and the kind treatment she offers her customers. 

Sindy is very grateful for the Kiva borrowers, because thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to carry out her purchases of merchandise like children’s clothing, such as polo shirts, sweatshirts, and sweaters, among others. In this way, Sindy will have a more well-stocked business;  she will continue working and making a good effort so that together with her little daughter, she can move ahead.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as children’s clothing like polo shirts, sweatshirts, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 31 year old married man. He has a daughter, who is 1 year old. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. 

Stephen operates a retail stall, where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years, and employs one member of staff. His business is located in a busy town, and his main customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He plans to use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more shoes for resale. His business goal is to start a new boutique business and employ more employees within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives with her husband and four children at Kakata. She is 45, and her children are between the ages of 4 and 29. Two of the children still live with her at home, while the other two are independent. 

Esther has been selling rubber dishes, plates, spoons and glasses for the past ten years.  Her husband helps her out in this business.  She likes this business as she generates a profit that she can use to help with the home, and to reinvest in the business. She has requested a loan to buy more rubber dishes, glasses, plates and spoons to increase her sales.  Her plan is to build good foundation for her grand children.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes, glasses, plates and spoons to increase her sales.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 34 years married with two children. He has been in the cereals business for the last five years earning approximately 5,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) monthly. 

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying his previous loans. He would like to borrow 15,000 KES which he plans to use to buy dry beans and maize for resale. 

Samwel plans to reinvest the profits into his cereals business. He hopes to manage his business well to increase its profits.

loans.use: To buy dry beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married with three children. He has had a business selling mobile phones, accessories and sim cards for more than four years. In addition, he is engaged in reselling outerwear. His personal goals are to open his own shop, to be the biggest supplier of men and woman's outerwear and to educate his children. Today, Ismayil needs the loan to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Haeelet  Modani

texts.en:
Haeelet is 32 years old and married. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living.  She runs her business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. She has been running her business for three years. 

Since Haeelet became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management skills. Haeelet dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy hair braids and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair oil

loans.name: Jane   Kitondo

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her grow her business. She has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management skills. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en:
Yalchin is a 32-year-old married young man. He has a newborn son.  For the past year and six months, he has been operating a wheel repairing shop located in a good traffic area. This is the only source of income for his family.

Yalchin is requesting an AZN 1,200 loan from VF AzerCredit. It will help him cover the costs of his home repairs. This will help him to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: La Sra.  Norma tiene 57 años es casada con cuatro hijos ya todos mayores,   ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de MosojLLajta donde vive,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución es cliente antigua, la Sra. Norma va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una cortadora industrial para la elaboración de sus platillos mas rapidamente y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Norma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Norma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Norma is 57 years old, she is married, and she has four grown children. She works selling prepared foods from her store which is located in the area of Mosoj Llajta where she lives. This loan will be her third sequential loan with this institution: she is an established client. Norma will use this loan to purchase an industrial food slicer for preparing her dishes more efficiently, and in doing so bring a greater variety of dishes to her customers. Her goal in seeking this loan is to continue improving her business. Norma will use her funds to purchase more supplies and thereby increase her revenues. She hopes to turn her small business into a full restaurant and to be able to provide better service to her customers. Norma is a very hardworking person and she is overjoyed by the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial food slicer.

loans.name: Fundi

texts.en: Fundi does tailoring to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy a sewing machine for his business. This helped his business to improve. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 58 years old and married with eight children. He is a fishmonger, and he has been in operation for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of 20,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his fourth loan of KES 50,000 with KADET LTD., after successfully servicing his previous loans. He is going to use it to purchase fish for resale. 

He plans to save the anticipated profit and pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into wholesale fish selling.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 43, is married and lives in Kakata with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 2 and 25 years old. Only three of the children attend school. She has a cook shop (restaurant) where she has been selling food for the past 11 years. She sells six days a week and prepares different kinds of dish every day, including cassava leaves, palaver sauce, palm butter, fufu and soup to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business so she can render good services to her customers. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Faith  Heta

texts.en: Faith is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. In addition, she does farming to supplement her income. She testifies that through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management skills. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Faith has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy soft drinks and bread.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and bread

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables in Malindi town. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business. 

Gladys was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for her second loan of KES 50,000 to buy additional stock of tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions, and cabbages to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand the business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she can help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions, and cabbages

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a 40-year-old married woman. She has two children who are between 15 and 20 years old. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located along a busy road at a viable market  and her primary customers are passengers, passersby and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She plans to use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp, which she will use in her business during the evening hours. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Kennedy   Munene

texts.en: Kennedy is 27 years old and married. He operates a retail shop in a favorable environment to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for more than two years and has employed one person. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management skills. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Kennedy has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour, detergents and soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, detergents and soft drinks

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Kuña Aty están en el 2do Ciclo con 12  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsables. Ven en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias.
Maria, la presidenta, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, etc. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y cansador, ya que está pendiente las 24 hs. De sus animales. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, gracias a lo que podrá seguir trabajando como siempre lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Kuña Aty” is in its second loan cycle with 12 members. This group is known in the neighborhood for being unified, supportive, and responsible. They view the Program of Women Entrepreneurs as a great opportunity for themselves and their families.

Maria, the group president, raises and sells farm animals such as chickens, pigs, and other creatures. She says that her work is exhausting and requires great sacrifice since her animals need nonstop attention 24 hours a day. Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy balanced feed for her animals. As a result, she will be able to continue working as she has always done.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Nizomiddin

texts.ru: Низомиддин 1986 года рождения. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Он имеет высшее образование и по специальности он является экономистом и более 2 года занимается бизнесом. Он занимается купля продажей сим – карт, с 2010 года является официальным дилером компании Мегафон. Бизнес клиента налажен хорошо, имеет много постоянных клиентов. Он всегда в курсе всех изменениях в торговле и старается во время реагировать на эти изменения и приобретает товар, который имеет большой спрос. В бизнесе Низомиддину помогают братья. Кроме сим – карт они занимаются продажей мобильных телефонов, панелей мобильных телефонов и их аксессуаров. Рабочее время  Низомиддина начинается с 08:00 до 20:00 вечера, количество рабочих дней 28 дней в месяце. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки сим-карт и телефонов для расширения ассортимента товара. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nizomiddin was born in 1986. He is married but has no children. Nizomiddin has post-secondary education, is an economist by profession, and has been an entrepreneur for 2 years. He sells SIM cards for mobile phones, and has been an authorized dealer of Megafon since 2010. Nizomiddin's business is going well and has attracted many regular customers. Nizomiddin always stays up-to-date on all developments in the marketplace and stocks products that are in demand. His brothers help him with the business. In addition to SIM cards, they also sell mobile phones, phone faceplates and other accessories. Nizomiddin works from 8:00am to 8:00pm 28 days per month.

Nizomiddin is requesting a loan of US$3000 to purchase SIM cards and mobile phones to expand the variety of his merchandise. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and SIM cards in order to expand the assortment of his products

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.ru: Тошпулоту 58 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Его жена Рафоат домохозяйка. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами более 3 года он занимается скотоводством. У него большой огород, где он выращивает корм для скота. Он продает скот на рынке и имеет много клиентов. Он хочет развевать свой бизнес дальше и поэтому запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Toshpulot is 58 years old. He is married but has no children. His wife Rafoat takes care of the household. In order to provide his family with all necessities of life, Toshpulot has been raising livestock for over 3 years. He has a large plot of land where he grows food for his animals. Toshpulot sells his livestock at the market, where he has many clients.

Toshpulot would like to continue developing his business, and to this end he is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase livestock. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Pilar Olenka

texts.es:
La socia Pilar Olenka tiene 25 años de edad,es soltera y teine 2 hijos,al socia se dedica al negocio de venta de cerveza al por mayor,la socia tambien trabaja en un empresa como cajera,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m en su trabajo y en las noches trabaja en su negocio de venta de cerveza desde las 6:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio y trabajo la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cerveza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cajas de cerveza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Pilar Olenka is 25 years old, single, and has two children. She manages a business of selling beer at wholesale, but she also works for a company as a cashier. Pilar works at her job from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. and then operates her business of selling beer in the evenings from 6:00 P.M. to 11:00 P.M. Through her business and her job, she is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to expand her business of selling beer.

Pilar is requesting a loan to buy cases of beer in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer in bulk.

loans.name: Bello Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comite Bello Horizonte se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo.La señora Teresa es un  ejemplo de perseverancia y del empeño que pone para progresar es por eso que el grupo ah decidido nombrarle directora general desde este ciclo, ella tiene una despensa y es por medio de este trabajo que da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para los gastos del día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, enlatados y demás productos para poder surtir su local y seguir creciendo con su negocio como lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Bello Horizonte” (Beautiful Horizon) is known for its unity and its desire to make progress as a group.

Sra. Teresa is an example of perseverance and the effort required to make progress. It was for this reason that she was elected to be the General Director for this loan cycle. Teresa manages a store. Through her work, she is able to provide her family with everything they need and cover the daily expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and other items so that she can restock her store and continue growing her business just as she has done previously.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Sophia    Wandiri

texts.en: Sophia is 50 years old and married with five children. She describes herself as a hardworking business lady. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She operates her business in a favorable environment and has engaged in this business for eight years. Besides this, she does farming to supplement her income. She dreams of operating a wholesale business and buying a piece of land in the future. Sophia is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie, aged 30, is single with three children aged between 6 and 15. They live at Kakata and are currently in school. She stopped her education in the 7th grade.

Amie has been selling used clothes in the market for the past nine years to meet the needs of her children. She sell ladies blouses and ladies skirts. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies blouses and skirts to improve her business.  Her future plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies blouses and skirts to improve her business

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 23 years old and married with two children. He is in the kerosene and diesel business and has been in operation for the last four years earning 16,000 KES monthly. 

This is his first loan of 15,000 KES. He will use it to purchase fuel for resale. He plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business and some in loan repayment. 

His hope is to expand the business to wholesale in future.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 32 years old, lives in the Airport community, is married, and has three children between 5 to 15 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling rice, oil, and pepper in the market. She enjoys profit making in the business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms. Rehana is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two daughters. She is a very hardworking lady. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she is in the business of sewing clothing for the last four years. When she started this business her income was very low but with the passage of time, demand for her clothes increased in her community. Her husband is a driver and his monthly income is very low to support his family alone.

She has one machine and now she wants to purchase one more sewing machine for one of her daughters to increase their sewing capacity, so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR so that her family's income will be increased and they will be able to manage their household efficiently. Her loan has been approved by Kashf Foundation. Her husband is very happy to see the increasing growth of her business. Now she is saving a healthy amount of income for their better future. She wants to give a better education to her children and also desires to build a separate room for a kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He wants to use the loan for buying more seeds and to pay for the labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to buy another plot for maize in order to get more output in the future.The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation and he says that the last season went well.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue,and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay labor costs

loans.name: Focus Group

texts.en:
This group is called Focus and is made up of 4 women. They are always reminded by their group name to stay in focus all the time. They sell the following items: provisions, palm oil, ice chests, saucepans, rice, maize and snails. They took their first loan in 2010.

Esther is a 49-year-old foodstuff seller married to a 53-year-old security guard who works with one of the security companies in the country. They have no children. She specifically sells maize, rice and meat from the forest. She sells from morning to evening and Monday to Saturday.

She was given 850 Ghanian cedis in her 4th loan cycle which she used to buy two bags of maize (corn), one bag of rice and two baskets of snails. She now needs 1,100 Ghanian cedis to buy four bags of maize (corn), two bags of rice, 4 baskets of snails and smoked grasscutter. She has been reinvesting her profit into her business.

This group needs a total of 3,300 Ghanian cedis to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy four bags of maize (corn), two bags of rice, 4 basket of snails and smoked grasscutter

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Faten prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. Faten is a 36-year-old married woman who supports four family members from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy children's clothes from Aqaba to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. 

In the future, she would like to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ton Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Ton Antonio tiene 31 años de edad,es soltero y tiene 2 hijos,el socio se dedica al negocio de distribuidora de cerveza,el socio distribuye cerveza al por maoyor a las diferentes tiendas de barrotes,el socio tiene 6 años en este negocio,el socio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos por medio de su negocio ya que el socio quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de distribuidora de cervezas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ton Antonio is 31 years old, single, and has 2 children.  He dedicates himself to the business of distributing beer at wholesale to the different liquor stores.  He has been in this business for 6 years.  He wants to help his children get ahead by means of his business, as he wants them to become professionals.  His dream is to expand his beer distributorship.  The member requests the loan to buy beer at wholesale.

He is happy for the loan, and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Jack Jherson
