texts.es:
El socio es el señor Jack, casado y con 2 hijos en edad escolar, él se dedica a la industrialización  y venta de cereales andinos como quinua, quiwicha, harina de habas etc. y, los distribuye en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.  Jack está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  la materia prima como quinua, habas, y kiwicha etc. que le permita elaborar sus productos.
Jack quiere dejar esta industria a sus hijos, por lo que está  trabajando mucho para fortalecer  y hacerla crecer, para que en algún momento pasará a ser de sus hijos.
Jack está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Jack.  He is married and has two school-aged children.  His business is producing and selling Andean cereals such as quinoa, amaranth, broad (fava) bean flour, etc.  He distributes his goods in different markets in the city.  Jack is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as quinoa, broad beans, amaranth etc. which will allow him to make his products.

Jack would like to leave this business to his children and he is working hard to strengthen it and grow it so that he can one day pass it on to them.

Jack is very grateful to Kiva for helping him with his business.  He belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy raw supplies such as quinoa, broad beans and amaranth

loans.name: Ester Rosaura

texts.es: La socia es la señora Ester, Casada y con 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la reparación y comercialización accesorios para vehículos, principalmente de Cámaras para llantas, Ester realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y con la educación de sus 2 hijos, uno de ellos en edad escolar y el otro estudiante universitario. Ester en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar cámaras de caucho de diferentes medidas para los vehículos que repara, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ester pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member is Ester, who is married and has 2 children.  She dedicates herself to fixing and selling vehicle accessories, primarily inner tubes for tires.  Ester has been doing this work for many years, and it is this activity that has allowed her to get her family ahead and to provide an education for her 2 children, one of whom is in school and the other a university student.  At this time, Ester is requesting a loan to buy rubber inner tubes in different sizes for the vehicles she repairs.  She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to continue with her activity.  She promises to make her payments on time.

Ester belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” cooperative bank of the city of Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to buy rubber inner tubes for vehicle tires.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Exaltación tiene 60 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de vidrios, él socio lleva años en  este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio cuenta con un pequeño taller el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa, él socio trabaja a pedido de acuerdo que le soliciten sus clientes, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de vidrios al por mayor.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the DURABANK cooperative bank, located in Cusco.

The member is named Exaltación.  He is 60 years old, has 3 children and is married.  He alternates his daily activities with his business of selling glass.  He has been doing this work for years, and things have gone well thanks to the daily effort he puts into his enterprise.  He has a small workshop that is located in his house, and he works by the order based on customer requests.  He is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how he helps his family get ahead.

The member requests a loan to buy glass at wholesale.

The member feels thankful to the loan granted, and commits to fulfilling the established payments.

loans.use: to buy glass at wholesale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Pacuare Group

texts.es:
Fátima es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Pacuare,  con  37 años de edad, es madre soltera, jefa de hogar, tiene 2 hijos adolescentes que estudian en la secundaria, esta señora tan trabajadora, se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, lencería y perfumería, y además trabaja medio tiempo en una escuela como miscelánea. Todo esto para poder darle el estudio a sus hijos, y mantener su hogar. 
Doña Fátima y su grupo tienen mucha trayectoria en la Fundación, con más de 6 préstamos aprobados, ella sabe que el crédito es una excelente herramienta para su negocio, y es lo que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer. 
Junto a Fátima están 6 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Fátima is the president of the Banco Mujer Pacuare cooperative bank.  She is 37 years old, a single mother, head of household, and has 2 teenage children who study in secondary school.  This very hard-working woman dedicates herself to commerce, selling all types of clothing, costume jewelry and perfumes.  In addition, she does miscellaneous part-time work in a school.  She does all this to provide an education for her children and to maintain the household.

Fátima and her group have a long history in the Foundation, with more than 6 approved loans.  She knows that the credits are an excellent tool for her business, and they are what have allowed her to invest in and grow her business.

Together with Fátima, there are 6 more members who are going to invest in commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de preparacion y venta de tortas,la socia prepara tortas,galletas y bocaditos,ella trabaja a pedido,al socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio,antes la socia tenia un restaurnat pero no le fue muy bien entonces dedicio por preparar tortas ya que le gusta la reposteria,la socia en el futuro le gustaria tener un local para que pueda vender las tortas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,mantequilla,azucar y leche para que prepare las tortas,galletas y bocaditos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teodora continues to work in the preparation and sale of pastries, cookies and snacks, working to order. She has now been working in this business for 3 years. Before this, she had a restaurant but it wasn't very successful so she decided to cook pastries as she likes baking. In the future Teodora would like to have a shop where she can sell the pastries. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar and milk to prepare her pastries, cookies and snacks. 

She is happy about the loan and she is committed to meeting her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, butter, sugar and milk to prepare her pastries, cookies and snacks.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Lucila tiene 65 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de escuela de choferes, la socia tiene años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia se encarga de administrar este su negocio el que se encarga de enseñar a manejar  a quienes desean sacar su licencia de conducir, la socia a la vez es contadora de profesión siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante y aun puede apoyar a sus hijos.

La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de uno de sus carros que tiene en su escuela de choferes.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Durabank community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Lucila is 65 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her driving school business.  She has been in this business for years and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  Lucila manages her business which teaches those who want to obtain their driver's license how to drive.  She is also an accountant by profession and this is how she makes progress and supports her children.

Lucila is requesting this loan to service one of the cars in her driving school.  She is grateful for the loan she has been given and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to service one of the cars she uses in her driving school

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Gabina tiene 44 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en limpieza y cocina en diferentes casas, la socia lleva buen tiempo  trabajando en este rubro el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia trabaja por horas y días en este su trabajo de forma que no se le cruza su horario, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que ella saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar víveres para su casa como arroz ,azucar y para pagar una pequeña deuda que tiene.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the DURABANK cooperative bank, located in Cusco.

Gabina is 44 years old, has 4 children and is married.  She alternates her daily activities cleaning and cooking in different households.  She has been doing this type of work for a long time, and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts forth on a daily basis.  The member works by the hour and by the day, so that her schedules do not conflict.  She is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she helps her family get ahead.

The member requests the loan in order to buy supplies for her home such as rice and sugar, and to pay off a small loan that she has.

The member feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her home such as rice and sugar, and to pay off a small loan that she has.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Benito, él continúa con su actividad de renovadora de calzados, trabajo que realiza en su puesto de un centro comercial de la ciudad y que le ha permitida criar y educar a sus 4 hijos ahora profesionales. Benito está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  materiales como cuero, pegamento y caucho para la reparación de los calzados.
Benito está  ahorrando para adquirir una tienda, que le proporcione más comodidad y que también le permita vender calzado nuevo, esto para ampliar y mejorar su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos.
Benito está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Benito continues working as a cobbler.  He works from a stall in a shopping mall in the city and, through his work, he has been able to raise and educate his four children who are now professionals.  Benito is requesting this loan to buy materials such as leather, adhesive and rubber for repairing shoes.

Benito is saving up to buy a store which would give him more comfort and also allow him to sell new shoes.  This would help him expand and improve his business and improve his income.

Benito is very grateful to Kiva for helping him in his business.  He belongs to the 'Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, adhesive and rubber

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
El Sra. Wilma está casada con el Sr. Claudio hace varios años, tienen 1  hija mayor que está cursando la carrera de contabilidad primer año.
Wilma tiene un negocio propio que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo. Comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la cual todos los días trabaja y mediante esto ayuda a su familia. Gracias al trabajo que ella y su marido están realizando educan a su hija, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos,  carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en: Wilma has been married to Claudio for many years. They have one older daughter who is in her first year of pursuing the major of accounting. Wilma has her own business that she has acquired with a lot of effort. She told us that she has a well-stocked grocery store that she works in every day and through this she helps her family. Thanks to the work that her and her husband are doing they are educating their daughter and they buy all of the necessities for their home. She seeks this loan to buy drinks, dairy, meat and additional supplies to be able to continue working and meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy, meat and additional supplies.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven mujer de 22 años es soltera, cursó la secundaria y tiene un hijo de apenas 7 meses, con quien vive en Guamaní un sector ubicado en el sur de la ciudad de Quito, capital de la República del Ecuador. Es uno de los barrios más poblados de la ciudad, por lo que se ha convertido en un lugar altamente comercial con negocios de todo tipo al alcance de todos sus habitantes. En los últimos años el sector privado ha aprovechado este crecimiento para ampliar la inversión y construir centros comerciales, conjuntos residenciales, etc. Sin embargo Guamaní tiene algunos problemas de seguridad por varios centros nocturnos que han sido abiertos en los últimos años, pero a pesar de esto su gente no pierde la esperanza y siempre se encuentran emprendiendo con ideas de negocio que beneficien a todos, pues piensan que se puede aprovechar el lugar por haber sido una morada de “los incas” en la historia.
Cristina vende prendas de vestir y cosméticos desde hace 3 años. Invierte 5 horas cada día a esta actividad paralelamente al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. A pesar de que la competencia es abundante en el sector, ella piensa seguir adelante en el cumplimiento de su sueño de tener su propio local de venta de ropa, para lo cual solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa, que le ayudará a comprar ropa y cosméticos en una variedad que satisfaga la demanda de sus clientes. Cristina agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda que le brinda y sobre todo la asesoría con la cual puede ofrecer a sus clientes un valor agregado en atención y calidad en precio y producto.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young woman of 22.  She is single, has a high school level of education, and has a son who is barely 7 months old.  She lives with her son in Guamaní, a neighborhood in the south of the city of Quito, capital of the Republic of Ecuador.   Guamaní is one of the most densely-populated neighborhoods in the city and so it has attracted a lot of businesses which are used by all its residents.  In recent years, the private sector has taken advantage of this growth, expanding investment and building shopping malls, residential developments, etc.  Guamaní now experiences some security problems owing to several night clubs which have been opened in recent years.  However, in spite of this, the locals do not lose hope and they are always coming up with new business ideas that benefit everybody.  They believe that they can make the most of the fact that the area was historically inhabited by the Inca.

Cristina has been selling clothing and cosmetics for three years.  She works five hours a day in this business whilst also caring for her young son.  In spite of the strong competition that exists in her neighborhood, she plans to make progress in fulfilling her dream of owning her own business premises from which she can sell her clothing.  She has requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa so that she can buy a range of clothing and cosmetics to meet her customer demand.  Cristina is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the help they give her and, above all, the business advice she receives which enables her to offer her customers added value both in terms of customer service and the quality of her prices and products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics in order to increase her stock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La socia es la señora Rosa, Casada y con 2 hijos, ella continua dedicándose a la comercialización de productos para el hogar, principalmente de productos de limpieza e higiene los cuales comercializa en los diferentes comercios y mercados de la ciudad, Rosa realiza este trabajo hace algunos  años y esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y con la educación de sus 2 hijos. Rosa en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como detergentes, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Rosa. She is married with two children. She continues selling household products, mainly house cleaning and hygienic products that she sells in different shops and markets in the city. Rosa has done this work for several years, and it has allowed her to get her family ahead and provide an education for her two children. 

Rosa on this occasion is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as detergents. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her support herself with this activity. She commits to making her loan payments punctually. Rosa belongs to the communal bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” from the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: purchase detergent

loans.name: Mujeres De Xecaxjoj Group

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa esta unida a su esposo, tiene 37 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijos el cual no estudia, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio este negocio, criando gallina ponedoras, y hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la comercialización de todo tipo de ropa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de animales, ganado, cerdos y ovejas para crianza y venderlos después, espera en el futuro aproximo vender una granja y vender a empresas grandes. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la crianza de animales, y la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 37 and married. She never had the chance to attend school. She has a son who is not in school. She raises domestic livestock, a business she began by raising  laying hens, and now has 10 years of experience. Her husband, who also sells many kinds of clothing, helps her.

She created a communal bank to apply for a loan that will be used to buy livestock, such as cattle, pigs, and sheep, to raise and then sell. She expects to sell to a farm and sell to large businesses soon. The other members raise livestock and sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise.

loans.name: María Aidee

texts.es:
La señora María Aidee vive en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, es casada y con cuatro hijos, ya tiene tres años dedicándose al comercio de venta de ropa, y su esposo cuanta con un pequeño negocio de elaboración de ventanas y puertas de aluminio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y sus clientes le están solicitando que ya tenga ropa de temporada de invierno. 
La señora María Aidee planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el crédito, ya que con el ingreso que se obtiene del negocio de su esposo será para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder realizarse como una buena comerciante y lograr tener un negocio más estable con un local.
texts.en:
María Aidee lives in the city of Nuevo Laredo. She is married and has four children. For three years, she has sold clothes. Her husband has a small business making windos and doors from aluminum.

She is asking for the loan to invest in her business, since she needs a wider variety of merchandise and her customers are asking her to have winter clothing. María Aidee plans to pay off the loan with the earnings she makes from her business.The income from her husband's business will be used to pay for the family's expenses and her children's education. 

She wants to improve her family's quality of life and become a good merchant and have a more stable business with a locale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Stephani

texts.es:
Stephani es una joven de 23 años de edad, Stephan vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Sthepani es muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. 

Día a día Stephani trabaja en su pequeño negocio de impresiones, escaneos, tipeos, entre otros; ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque su negocio se ubica en una zona donde hay varios colegios.

Stephani está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora para su negocio de tipeos, asimismo comprara algunos escritorios para poder ofrecer mejor comodidad a sus clientes, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos ya que tendrá los materiales necesarios y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran negocio y ser una gran microempresaria”.
texts.en:
Stephani is a 23 year old woman who lives in the city of Chincha. This city is characterized by its warm and pleasing climate. It is also the cradle of the glories of Peruvian sports and its people are cheerful and possess a gift for preparing delicious traditional dishes. Chincha also has beautiful beaches, farming and cattle. Stephani is very hardworking, but when she has a little free time, she likes to listen to music and enjoy one of her favorite dishes, which is the delicious “carapulcra con sopa seca”. 

Stephani works day to day in her small business offering printing, scanning, typing, and more. She works around 9 hours a day and can serve up to 30 customers daily. She believes it is going well for her at her business because she is very friendly to the customera and because her business is located in an area where there are a lot of high schools.

Stephani is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to buy a computer for her business. She also will buy some desks to be able to offer her customers more comfort. In this way, she will improve her income, since she will have the materials she needs and will keep working to make her biggest dream come true: " to have a great business and be a great micro-businesswoman."

loans.use: to a computer and desks.

loans.name: Florencia (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se conforma de tres personas quien  cada una se dedica a su actividad y viven en una comunidad pueblo llamado ocotepec  en la que celebran la fiesta de san marcos el 25 de abril que es la fiesta grande del pueblo.

  La señora Esperanza es quien se le tomo  la entrevista  quien vive en unión libre con el señor José Eusebio  y con quien a su responsabilidad tiene dos hijos y están pequeños en la que hablan la lengua zoque.

  Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos de granja por reja en donde nos comenta que para realizar su actividad se le venta muy temprano  para venir a hervir y limpiar la carne para que sus clientes  tengan sus pedidos a muy temprano en donde lleva trabajando un año y cinco meses en la que le va bien  ya que ha visto un mejor resultado  en sus ingresos.
 
   Inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a su  esposo con  los ingresos de la casa como también independizarse por sí misma para que no solo su esposo se vea presionado  con los gastos que se generan  en su hogar.

   Su sueño más grande es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda  seguir trabajando  y con el préstamo que le han estado otorgando logre comprar pollos suficientes  para que sus clientes de  tenga una mejor atención.
 
  Quienes integran en el grupo son: Enrique  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollo para venderlo destazado y la señora Rosalinda invertirá en la compra de ingredientes – como son: carne-tortilla-aceite-repollo- entre otros para la elaboración de tacos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, each has an activity and lives in the town of Ocotepec. There they celebrate the feast of San Marcos on April 25. It is the towns biggest festival. 

Esperanza was the on ewho was interviewed. She is in a common law marriage with José Eusebio and is raising two children. They are small and their parents speak to them in the Zoque language.

She asked for the loan to buy chicken by the crate. She tells us that she gets up very early to do her sales, boiling and cleaning the meat so that her customers will have their orders very early. She has been doing this for a year and five months and it is going very well for her. She has seen an improvement in her income.
 
She started this activity to help her husband with the household income as well as become independent for her self. This way, her husband isn;t the only person under pressure from the household expenses. Her biggest dream is that with this little business she can keep working and with the loan theu are giving her buy enough chicken to give her customers a better service. 

The members of the group are: Enrique, who will invest the loan in buying chicken to sell it in pieces, and Rosalinda, who will invest in buying ingredients such as meat, tortillas, oil, cabbage and more to make tacos.

loans.use: to buy crates of chicken

loans.name: Luz Del Día Group

texts.es: Doña Audelia tiene 45 años y está casada con el señor Mario el cual es empleado, ellos tienen 4 hijos pero nada más la menor depende de ellos la cual estudia la preparatoria. Dice que entre otras cuatro personas formaron el grupo llamado “Luz del Día” y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque el crédito es una luz para ellas porque así poco a poco han mejorado sus negocios. Comenta que ella se dedica a la venta de bordados y tiene una tienda de mercería. Platica que ella emprendió su negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la educación de su hija y que su esposo le ayudo a  hacer un localito en el cual tiene su negocio. Dice que ella va a la ciudad de México a surtirse del material que vende como agujas, tela (cuadrille), aros, hilos de diferentes colores, estambres, ganchos, etc. Audelia está pidiendo un crédito para surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para asi apoyar a su esposo un poco mas con los gastos del hogar, dice doña Audelia que la meta que tiene en mente es meterle un poco de papelería ya que cerca de su no negocio no hay una y que esta agradecida por el préstamo que le hará Vision Fund. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Leónides, Josefina, Candelaria y Yolanda ella invertirán los créditos que les harán en sus negocios como en una tienda de abarrotes, en tienda de ropa para niños, en venta de artesanías y en la reparación y servicio de una combi de transporte público.
texts.en:
Audelia, 45, is married to Mario, a laborer. They have four children, only one of whom is still a dependent and attends high school. She says that there are four other members of the communal bank “Luz del Día” [Daylight] and that they chose this name because the loan is a light by which the women can slowly grow their businesses. She says that she sells embroidery and has a linen shop. She started the business to help her husband with her daughter's education. Her husband helped her build a little space for her shop. Audelia goes to Mexico City to stock the items she sells: needles, woven cloth, hoops, colored threads, worsted wool, hooks, and so forth. 

Audelia is requesting a loan to stock her business and increase her earnings so she can help her husband a little more with the household expenses. The goal she has in mind is to add some stationery, since there isn't a store nearby that offers it. She thanks Vision Fund for the loan. The other members are Leónides, Josefina, Candelaria, and Yolanda. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses: a grocery store, a children's clothing shop, handicraft sales, and servicing small public buses.

loans.use: to stock merchandise and buy needles, woven cloth, hoops, colored threads, worsted wool, hooks, and so forth.

loans.name: Ulpiano

texts.es:
Ulpiano es un hombre de 52 años que vive en Santo Domingo que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Ulpiano es padre de tres hijos, sin embargo únicamente vive con uno de ellos por ser menor de edad; los otros dos ya tienen su vida independiente. Para sobrevivir, Ulpiano se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años y se ha especializado en la siembra de "choclo" y "fréjol" que son los productos de mayor demanda en la región y en si en todo el Ecuador y esto hace que tenga aseguradas sus ventas en gran parte.

Este empresario desea invertir en su tierra comprando insumos agrícolas como mejores semillas y fertilizantes de tal manera que pueda incrementar su productividad y por ende más productos que al venderlos le van a generar mayores ingresos. Ulpiano da trabajo a varios campesinos que viven cerca lo cual beneficia a algunas familias del sector; su jornada es de sol a sol. Él comenta que quisiera ver a su comunidad crecer pero que no se pierdan las tradiciones.
texts.en:
Ulpiano is a 52 year old man who lives in Santo Domingo which is one of the youngest cities in Ecuador. Currently, it has become the focal point between the mountain region and the coast of the country. It is a privileged place, not only for its ethnic richness but also for the unusual landscapes that you can find as soon as you enter this beautiful city. Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs currently to the province of Santo Domingo of Tsachilas, recently created in 2007. The main holiday of Santo Domingo is celebrated with an intense influx of visitors, commercial  and cultural exchange. A large festival takes place in the facilities of the Rachers' Association. There the best examples of the different breeds and crosses that are raised in the ranches of the region are shown and compete.

Ulpiano is a father to three children. Nevertheless, he lives with only one of them who is still a child. The other two already have independent lives. To survive, Ulpiano has been dedicated to farming for twenty five years and has specialized in planting corn and beans which are the products in greatest deman in the region and also in all of Ecuador and this ensures in large part that his sales are assured.

This businessman wishes to invest in his land buying agricultural inputs like better seeds and fertilizers in such a way that he can increase his productivity and sell more products, which upon selling are going to generate better income. Ulpiano gives work to various farmers who live close which benefits some families in the area. His day is from sunrise to sunset. He comments that he would like to see his community grow but not lose its traditions.

loans.use: to buy farming products to expand production.

loans.name: Abdullobek

texts.en: Abdullobek is married and has three children. He is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. Abdullobek began his own business in animal husbandry four years ago. He requested a loan of $3000 US to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi, age 34, lives with her life partner and their two children. She sells fruit and vegetables at the market. Her business is located at a strategic place. Thanks to this, she has uncountable customers. 

The loan she is requesting from the Yehu is to buy more fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, fresh kales, cabbages, onions, etc. This way she will have enough fruit and vegetables available to offer her customers and to get better income.

This will allow her to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, fresh kales, cabbages, onions, etc.

loans.name: Kadenge

texts.en:
Kadenge is 34 years old, married and the father of three children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remaining amount to put up a fruit and vegetable grocery for his wife to run. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorbike and to put up a fruit and vegetable grocery.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27. She is married and has three children. 

Her husband works as a farmer. She has been in the maize farming for 14 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more seeds and support labor costs. With the profits from the business, she wants to a buy a tractor that can help in digging enough space for the future output.

The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation and she says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Ima Sumacc

texts.es: La socia es la señora Ima Sumacc, ella continua dedicándose a la comercialización de ropa, principalmente de trajes elegantes para damas y caballeros, Ima Sumacc realiza este trabajo hace algunos  años y esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ima Sumacc en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ternos y vestidos, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Ima Sumacc pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Ima Sumacc continues selling clothing, mainly elegant men's and women's suits. She has been in business for several years, and with the earnings she is able to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as boys' suits and dresses. 

She thanks KIVA for supporting her in her business. She promises to make her payments on time. Ima Sumacc is a member of the communal bank “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as boys' suits and dresses.

loans.name: Magdaleno De Jesus

texts.es: Magdaleno de Jesús  casado con  56 anos de edad, con un hijo menor de edad. El cual dependen económicamente de él, porque esta estudiando. Magdaleno habita en la localidad del malpaisillo municipio de León. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona artesanal y agrícola. Estos productos los compra en la zona y los vende en la ciudad de Managua tiene una rutina dos veces por semana que viaja, el resto de la semana la distribuye en malpaisillo y zona aledaña, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 5 anos. Magdalena ya ha trabajado con León 2000 el cual ha demostrado que es responsable, buena paga ya que cumple con sus pagos en tiempo y forma El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar y vender productos artesanales como: adornos elaborado con barros, muñecas de trapos, gigantonas, adornos de barro de cocina, comales, molinillos , jícaras, mascaras de adornos,  en la foto observamos al Sr. Magdaleno mostrandonos los adornos de barro que ofrece que son alguns cerdos de barros que sirven como alcansillas.  Magdaleno de Jesús agradece la oportunidad que le brindan los prestamista kiva a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en: Magdaleno de Jesús is married and 56 years old with a young son, who depends on him financially because he is a student. Magdaleno lives in the area of Malpaisillo in the town of Leon, a place known for being a crafts and farming area. He buys those products in the area and sells them in the city of Managua. He has a routine: two times a week he travels. The rest of the week he distributes in Malpaisillo and a nearby area. He has performed this activity for five years. Magdaleno has already worked with Leon 2000 where he demonstrated that he is responsible, and a good payer since he made his payments on time. He needs a loan to buy and sell craft products like ornaments made from mud, rag dolls, puppets, clay ornaments for the kitchen, griddles, grinders, cups, decoration masks. In the photo, we see Magdaleno showing us the clay ornaments that he offers that are some clay pigs that serve as piggy banks. Magdaleno de Jesus is thankful for the opportunity provided by Kiva to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of living.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of craft products like bowls, griddles, puppets, rag dolls, clay ornaments for the kitchen.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima, 21, is single with a child that is 7 years old. She lives in Kakata. She stopped her education in the 12th grade. Her child lives with her aunt and attends school. For the past ten years, Maima has been selling biscuits, candy, washing soap, bath soap, toothpaste and other items. She learned to sell from her mother. She likes her business because she makes profit and with the profit she buys goods to improve the business and improve her life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bath soap, candy, washing soap and toothpaste for the business. Her plan for the future is to further her education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, candy, washing soap and toothpaste for the business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old and a mother of three children. 

She has been selling milk for five years. She initiated her own business of milk sales through support of Kashf foundation. She bought a buffalo to provide milk in her community. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She is efficiently doing her business to support her family as her husband was the only bread earner before she began her business. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She intends to use part of her revenues to improve her house and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 42 years old and lives in Airport. She is married, and she has four children between 7 and 26 years old. All of them are currently in school and live at home.

For the past 15 years she has been selling fish in the local market. She enjoys the way customers responds to her business, She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 29 years old and lives in Airport. She is married. She stopped her education in seventh grade, and she has two children, 3 and 12 years old, who are currently in school and live at home.

Her husband is a businessman. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil, pepper, rice, and vita in the market on a table. 

Transporting her goods is the main challenge. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, and vita for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, and vita for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and married with six children. She has been in the hotel business for the last one year, earning approximately 30,000 KES monthly. 

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She borrowed 50,000 KES and plans to use it on purchasing maize flour, sugar, plastic chairs and tables for use in the cafeteria.

She plans to use the anticipated profits on repaying her loan and use the remaining amount in running her business. She hopes to take care of her children’s basic needs and give the children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, plastic chairs and tables for the cafeteria.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María es una persona alegre, que le gusta trabajar mucho para ayudar a su familia y tiene deseos de superarse con una actitud positiva frente a las adversidades. María vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

María se dedica a la confección de bordados en manteles, toallas, camisas y centros de mesa, este negocio ha permitido que María salga adelante con sus hijos, tiene buenos clientes y buenas ventas, es por eso que actualmente necesita un crédito el cual va a invertir en la compra de  rollos de tela, hilos de varios colores y lana para confeccionar bordados y seguir con su negocio.

María sueña que su negocio crezca constantemente y que sus ventas e ingresos sean mayores para darles una buena educación a sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
María is a happy person who loves helping her family by working. She has a great desire to get ahead and a positive attitude toward challenges. She lives with her husband and four children in the city of Ibarra. She embroiders blankets, towels, shirts, and centerpieces. 

Through her business, Maria has been able to provide for her children. She has a good client base and great sales. Now she needs a loan to buy rolls of fabric, colored thread, and wool for embroidery and to keep her business going. María dreams that her business will constantly grow and that her sales and income will increase so that she can give her children a good education and see them have good careers.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, colored thread, and wool for embroidery and to keep her business going.

loans.name: Serapio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Serapio  tiene 40 años es soltero, se dedica al servicio de internet en su café internet que tiene en la populosa zona de la Buenos Aires, de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su séptima secuencia dentro de la institución, el es cliente antiguo, el Sr. Serapio va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de escritorio y Cds blanco para poder quemar información ya que este es también uno de sus servicios,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de este material, el Sr. Serapio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varios café internet, pero el no se puede quejar ya que tiene clientela y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas equipos de computación para equipar mas su negocio, el Sr. Serapio estudia en la universidad, cuando su tiempo lo permite, el es una persona muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Serapio is 40 years old and is single. He is dedicated to internet service in his internet cafe that he has in the populous area of Buenos Aires, in the city of La Paz. This loan is his seventh with the institution. He is an old customer. Serapio is going to use this loan to buy desk material and blank CDs to be able to burn information since this is also one of his services. His reason for requesting this loan is he doesn't have enough money to buy this material. Serapio faces challenges in his business which are competition since there are various internet cafes in the area but he cannot complain since he has customers and he will utilize the benefits by buying more computer equipment to equip his business better. Serapio studies at university when time allows. He is a very hard working person. This is his only job. He feels happy and thankful for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy desk materials and cds.

loans.name: Silvio Rene

texts.es: El señor Silvio tiene 33 años, es soltero vive en la casa de sus padres y aporta con la educación de sus hermanos y sobrinos, es un cliente que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia dentro de la  institución y como actividad principal se dedica al arte del pintado y decoración de interiores  fachadas de paredes desde  muy joven  actualmente el es independiente y sus contratos los realiza en la cuidad de La Paz, Cochabamba y otros departamentos  el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de escaleras metálicas de mayor altura ya que con a las anteriores que compro le fue muy bien, es un joven muy responsable y trabajador se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Silvio is 33 years old. He is single. He lives in his parents' house and supports the education of his brothers and nephews. He is a customer who is in his second cycle with the institution. His principle activity, since he was young, is the art of painting walls and interior decorating. Currently, he is independent and he does contracts in the city of La Paz, Cochabamba and other areas. The loan that he requested is to buy taller metal ladders since with the previous ones he bought, he did well. He is a very responsible and hard working young man. He feels happy for this opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy taller metal ladders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food for cows

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 31 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have three children, all enrolled in schools. 

He has been a maize farmer for 17 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize plantation and he says that the last season went well. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 24-year-old married woman. She is an active lady and has two buffalo in milk. She started milk sales five years ago for the sake of her family. She has good number of customers, and they are increasing gradually. Her business is good enough to enable her to lead a decent life. 

Her husband is employed in a small general store as a sales person. She is the mother of three children; none of them is in school. She lives in a large, conventional family with her husband, her children, and other relatives. She needs to earn more to cover the everyday expenditures of her family.  

Now she is requesting a loan of  30,000 PKR. She will be using the loan to buy one more buffalo to drive up sales. She expects an increase in her business income. She intends to use the earned profits to provide a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Hafed

texts.en:
Hafed is a 41-year-old married man who supports four family members from Jarash, Jordan. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy food to resell in the same area. He would like in the future to expand his project to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy food to resell.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Hamza.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 13, 10, 6 and 5 months. In 2006, Hamza established his mobile phones and accessories business. He began his business because he wants to be self empowered and he learned it through an apprenticeship. 

Now, working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 520,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Hamza has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy mobile phones and accessories. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Hamza plans to complete the construction of his house, to improve on his stock level as he has rented the shop he intended to rent.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a las comercio de frutas, plantas, pinol y cajetas en el mercado municipal. Ella con el crédito comprara maíz, cacao, leña, dulce, leche, plátanos y manzanas.
Este es un crédito temporada, ella es integrante del grupo Poder de Dios.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to selling fruit, plants, ground corn and caramels in the town market. With the loan, she will buy maize, cocoa, wood, sweets, milk, bananas and apples. This is a seasonal loan. She is a member of the group, Poder de Dios (power of god).

loans.use: to buy cocoa, wood, sweets, bananas.

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Assiba est mère de six enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école. Le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins âgé a 18 ans. Elle vend des divers et de liqueur depuis des années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin selon l'écoulement de ses produits. En vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients qui augmentent sans cesse, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier. Ce concours financier lui permettra d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Assiba is 50 years old and mother of six children, two of whom are still in school. Her eldest child is 35 years old, and her youngest child is 18 years old.

She has been selling liquor and other various items for years. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin to replace the products that she sells.

She sought and obtained a loan in order to strengthen her sales and satisfy the needs of her ever-growing customer base. The loan will allow her to increase her profit and help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one box of spaghetti, one box of couscous, one 10-liter bottle of alcohol, and one carton of milk

loans.name: Tanweer

texts.en:
Ms. Tanweer is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is standing next to Tanweer in the photo. Five years ago she started a general store to support her family. She offers various goods for everyday use. She has a good client list and serves well in her community. Her husband is a salesperson at a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Both her children are going to school but her eldest son helps her in his free time.  

Ms. Tanweer wants to grow her business and she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to use part of her revenue to deal with her children’s education expenses and to increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives in a village of ‘Ellahabad’. Her husband is involved with agricultural activities and assists her in selling milk door-to-door. 

At one time, her husband was the only earner of the family. Therefore, Ms. Sughran decided to help her husband in managing the household. For this purpose she purchased a buffalo 10 years ago and started to sell the milk. Now she counts a good client list. She requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to serve more customers. She hopes to utilize part of the profits on her family's well-being and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 4 children, ages 16, 13, 10 and 7. 

In 1999, Mohamed established his textile business. He began his business just to enable him to adequately take care of his family and it is the only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 650,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy jeans, trousers and shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 330,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to complete the construction of his house and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jeans, trousers, and shirts

loans.name: Jean D'amour

texts.en:
Jean D'Amour is 31 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have two young children. 

Jean D'Amour has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Jean D'Amour says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 28 years old and she lives in Airport. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 5, who live with her and go to school. Her husband is a businessman. Barbara started her business seven years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for her business. She hopes to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 5 children, ages 25, 23, 20,18 and 14. Three of them are schooling and two are employed. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her as her sales assistant.  

In 2003, Fatmata established her provisions and soft drinks business. She began her business because she wants to provide help to her husband in the running of the home and that is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 640,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy eggs, soft drinks, pure water and Irish potatoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 210,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to raise a prominent amount for the construction of a home, to generate funds for a trip to the holy land of Mecca for a pilgrimage and to give the children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions and soft drinks.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: Milkah is a married woman. She has two children, ages 8 and 11 years old. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells scrap metal. Her business is located at a ready market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase scrap metal for restocking her business. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes to build rental houses to increase her business income in the future.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is married with four children. She tells us that she has operated a mat weaving business in her home for 1 year. It is well stocked. She is a very hardworking person, eager to succeed and help her family, as she knows that life is hard, and working is the only way to get ahead.

Sidi is applying for the loan in order to buy supplies that she wishes use to weave mats to supply her business with, and to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to weave mats to supply her business

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 24 years old. She is single. She has been a farmer for the past 4 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Marie Grace says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 48 años que vive en la parroquia de "Pastocalle" en el cantón "Latacunga" ubicado en la región Andina del Ecuador.  Latacunga se caracteriza por ser muy acogedora, que con su catedral y la Iglesia de San Francisco muestra la belleza del arte religioso, ambientadas con estrechas calles adoquinadas, resaltadas por los vivos colores de las típicas fachadas de sus viviendas y el polvoriento paisaje circundante. Latacunga viene de dos voces quichuas llacata kunka que significa Dios de las Lagunas. Cuando llega noviembre sus empedradas calles se llenan de alegría por la celebración de la fiesta en honor a la Virgen de las Mercedes, se trata de la ceremonia de la “Mama Negra” , que simboliza la fertilidad y la productividad de la tierra.

María está casada con Luis, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 8, 11, 12, y 18 años. Ella para aportar a la economía del hogar fabrica escobas, actividad que la aprendió de sus padres. Trabaja 8 horas al día y no recibe ayuda. María comenta que su gran obstáculo siempre ha sido no haber continuado con sus estudios ya que únicamente terminó la primaria y luego el no poder acceder fácilmente a fuentes de financiamiento haciendo que el crecer de su negocio sea muy complicado. María desea fortalecer su negocio por lo que requiere un préstamo con el cual comprará materia prima y podrá hacer un buen lote de su producto. Con esta inversión espera tener mejores ingresos con lo que podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Su gran sueño es ver a sus hijos con educación completa y con profesiones dignas que contribuyan al crecimiento del país, esta emprendedora se esfuerza cada día por lograrlo.
texts.en:
María is 48 and lives in Pastocalle parish, Latacunga canton, located in Ecuador's Andean region. Latacunga is a welcoming city. Its cathedral and the Church of San Francisco exemplify the beauty of religious art, and its cobblestone streets are lined with the brightly colored facades of traditional homes that stand out in the dusty environment. Latacunga comes from the Quichua words "llacata kunka" that mean "God of the Lakes". In November, the paved streets are filled with people celebrating the joyous feast honoring the Virgen de las Mercedes during the ceremony of Mama Negra, who symbolizes the fertility of the land. 

María is married to Luis, with whom she has 4 children, ages 8, 11, 12, and 18. To help support her household, she makes brooms, work she learned from her parents. She works 8 hours a day without help. She says her greatest obstacle has always been not being able to continue her education. She only finished elementary school. She has not had easy access to financing, which has complicated the growth of her business. María wants to strengthen her business, which requires receiving a loan to buy commodities to make a large batch of her product. She expects to generate better income with the investment and give her children a better life.

María's greatest dream is to see her children complete their education and have decent careers through which they will contribute to the country's growth. She works hard every day to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy commodities and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Unidas Para Vencer Group

texts.es: Doña Ada tiene 43 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Unidas para Vencer, es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es comerciante, ellos residen en la comunidad de San Nicolás, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Departamento de Olancho. Doña Ada se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y golosinas, desde hace algunos años se dedica a esta actividad y le ha resultado muy rentable, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm. La ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y el negocio le deja ganancias para cubrir sus gastos. El préstamo que doña Ada esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá tener mejor surtido su negocio. Su meta es lograr tener un negocio más grande, bien surtido y obtener un local más amplio. Doña Ada es cliente de FAMA desde hace 10 ciclos y hasta la actualidad ha sido puntual con sus cuotas de pagos.
texts.en: Ada is 43 years old. She is a member of the group "Solidario Unidas para Vencer" (United Together to Overcome). She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is in business. They live in the community of San Nicolás in the city of Juticalpa, department of Olancho. Ada works selling vegetables, fruits, and candies and she has been doing this for some years and it has turned out to be very profitable. She works alongside her husband. She works from 6:00am until 6:00pm. The advantage is that she has many customers and the business gives her a profit to cover her expenses. Ada needs the loan that she is requesting to buy fruits and vegetables. With the help of this loan, she will be able to better supply her business. Her goals is to have a bigger business that is well supplied and in a larger space. Ada has been a member of FAMA for 10 loan cycles and, to date, has been punctual in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in a business of manufacturing plastic bags and papers for four years. He is a hardworking man. Through his previous loan he increased his raw materials, which improved and developed his business a lot and increased his income, in addition to expanding his working zone.

Nader is applying again for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his wedding fees. He believes that Al Majmoua loans are worth applying for because they provide you with a good increase in income and business expansion. Nader is the only person in his region with such a business, and he is insistent upon being the leader. He is planning to expand it as much as he can.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding fees.

loans.name: Thacien

texts.en:
Thacien is age 27. He is married to a farmer and they have one child. Thacien has been a maize farmer for 8 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at his previous maize plantation and he says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 39-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. Evans operates a grocery store where he sells items such as onions, kale, tomatoes, carrots, bananas, etc.. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a potential business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Evans will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy clothes for starting a new business of selling clothes. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a land for his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for starting a new business of selling clothes

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a widow, age 44. She has been a farmer for the past 12 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation. Evelyne says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: The United Group

texts.en:
Amidu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Amidu was born in Tonkolili, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 36 years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has 1 child, attending primary school. For 19 years now, Amidu has been selling stationery.  

Amidu and his group members have applied for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group to enable them expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Amidu will use his share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to expand his business by buying a wide variety of stationery to add to his business. 
 
(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of stationery to add to his business

loans.name: Carmen Jeanette

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 33 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de una playa cercana a su hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Carmen puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su casa donde realiza sus ventas, Carmen puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kivas, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, menestras, bebidos, entre otros; de esta manera Carmen tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 33 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Camaná. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. In her free moments, she likes to to walk on the shore of a beach close to her home and sometimes to cook a delicious Arroz Chaufa de Pollo (Peruvian-Chinese fried rice) to share with her family. 
With much determination, enthusiasm, and and thanks to help from her parents, Carmen opened her little grocery store. Everyday, she starts work in the early hours. She has a small space in her house where she makes her sales. She works about 12 hours a day and believes that she is doing well because of her dedication and the kind way that she treats her customers.
Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy merchandise for her store such as: rice, sugar, oil, milk, legumes, drinks, and other things. In this way, Carmen will have a better supplied store which she hopes will increase her sales and her income which will help her to grow her store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling charcoal in Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of about KES 11,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for KES 20,000, to buy additional charcoal to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he may give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business so as to serve more customers, and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Haydalina

texts.es: Haydalina de 48 anos de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad de la localidad del sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la parte norte del país, Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, es una zona muy ganadera, la crianza de cerdos para venta y elaboración de comidas típicas del cerdo como: el chancho con yuca, adobado, frito. Ella tiene por actividad económica la crianza de cerdo, tiene  7 anos de tener dicha actividad. En la actualidad ha presentado desafíos y problemas, como es la venta bajas ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de centrados para cerdos, esto ha sido una limitante para tener mas crianza de cerdos. Por esta razón he recurrido a la modalidad del crédito para invertir en materia prima y  poder de dicha forma satisfacer la demanda de mis clientes y aumentar mis ingresos económicos. En la foto observamo a Haydalina con su pequena crianza de cerdos.  Haydalina agradece la oportunidad del crédito a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que le brindan a personas de países pobres y con  muchas carencias económica como lo es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Haydalina is 48 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She lives Sauce, a village in the northern part of the country. Sauce is known for its dairy production, cow and pig raising, and typical pork dishes such as pork with cassava, pork adobado (with a spicy sauce), and fried pork. Haydalina been making her living raising pigs for the past seven years. She has encountered a few challenges of late, including low sales because she does not have enough capital to purchase pig feed, which has limited the number of pigs she can raise. She has therefore applied for a loan to buy raw materials that will allow her to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her income. The photo shows Haydalina and her little herd of pigs. Haydalina is grateful for the loan opportunities that Kiva lenders offer people from poor countries with widespread economic deprivation such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in buying and selling pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a professional title.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is age 38. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12, and they all go to schools. She has been a farmer for the past 18 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation, and she says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.
