Landrie mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Landrie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Landrie sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON 7. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé
texts.en:
JESUGNON 7 is a group of four persons whose members belong to the same tontine group. The group's representative, Landrie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 33 years old and married to a man named Toussaint. Landrie is the mother of three children, all in school and in the couple's care. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Landrie had dropped out of primary school. For nearly twenty years, she has been running a business selling kitchen utensils and charcoal door to door. She operates this business to be able to meet the needs of her household. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Landrie is requesting, along with the other members of the group JESUGNON 7, a second loan, which will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils to sell door to door

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
"I'm Ali. My work is to polish floor tiles and to paint. I work with my uncle Yusuf. We asked the brothers at Al Majmoua for a loan to buy a new electricity generator. This one [pictured] has pretty much expired. We've been in this business for almost 18 years, and we have 22 employees. God willing, we will receive this loan, and we will be thankful. God bless."

Ali is taking out a loan to purchase a generator for his business. Power outages have become the norm this year in Lebanon, and residents of Saida typically only see 6-8 hours of electricity per day. Generators are an essential investment for businesses and families to weather power outages in Lebanon.

loans.use: to purchase an electricity generator for his business.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a married woman with five children. She is a business owner who works weaving mats for resale. She tells us that she has had this business for more than five years.
 
Her business is located in a strategic place in Tiribe, where she has a great number of customers. It is thanks to her work and her business that she has been able to help her family and give them all that they need for a dignified life.

She is requesting the loan to be able to stock her store with supplies to weave mats, as she has a lot of demand for this, and wants to have her products in stock to be able to offer them to her customers. She says thanks to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to stock her store with supplies to weave mats.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 33 years old, married to Barnabas and blessed with three children, aged 12, 9, and 7 years respectively.  She runs a grocery stall, a business she has been doing for the past five years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, and beans for sale. The profit she earns would be ploughed back into her business. 


Her dream is to see her business expand, educate her children, and lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits, vegetables, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Om-Ghsan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Ghsan which consists of 4 women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER.
Ahwod is the president of this group and she is the second woman from right screen in the photo. She is 24-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife and has a small house. She requires a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a construction supplies to renew her house. She hopes to buy appliances of her house and open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for renewing her house

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson  is a 34 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be social and talktaive man. He operates a farm where he sells cabbages. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents from environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business and lack of electricity in his home area. He will use the Kes 5,800 loan to purchase a solar lantern for lightning in his house which will be used by his five family members. His business goal is to improve his farming practice within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. Johnson received two previous loan with SMEP DTM which he was able to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Al-Wfaq Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-wfaq who consists of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen, and they took out a loan of 200,000 YER. Jamila is 40 years old, married and has six children (she is the woman who holds handbag in the photo). She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She studied till primary school. She is a housewife and has a house which she would like to buy construction supplies. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy windows for her house. She hopes to furnish her house also and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married with five children and four of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of selling soft drinks like passion juice, soda and mineral water. She has applied for a loan of 1000000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sacks of passion fruits, a refrigerator, and boxes of mineral water and crates of soda. She has been in this business for four years and sells to all categories of people but on retail.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of employ two girls to assist in supplying juice, to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses includes school feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruits, boxes of mineral water and crates of soda

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La socia es la señora Carmen, ella continua con su negocio de venta de golosinas, bebidas y sándwiches en su tienda escolar, pero también está incursionando en el negocio de manualidades, en la elaboración de adornos y accesorios para la próxima campaña navideña, actividad que alterna a la de su tienda escolar, para incrementar sus ingresos económicos ya que en diciembre concluye el año escolar. Carmen en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar telas, cintas decorativas, accesorios de plástico y todo lo referente a adornos navideños para la elaboración de sus manualidades, y por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a hacer crecer y fortalecer esta nueva actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Carmen is continuing with her business selling candies, drinks, and sandwiches in her school shop, but she is also expanding into the business of handicrafts: making decorations and accessories for the next Christmas season. She alternates this activity with her school shop to increase her earnings, since the school year ends in December.

With this opportunity, Carmen is applying for this loan to buy fabrics, decorative tape, plastic accessories and everything concerning Christmas decorations to make her handicrafts. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to grow and strengthen this new activity. She promises to make her payments on time. She belongs to the communal bank "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations and accessories.

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco est le membre et le président du groupe Dukore. Le nom du groupe signifie «Travaillons».Il a 37 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 4 ans à 11 ans, deux de ses enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 6ième primaire.

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour acheter des champs utiliser pour agrandir l’étendu de leur agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un grand commerçant  de riz et  être grand agriculteur de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the Dukore group. This group's name means 'Let's work'. Jean Bosco is 37 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of four and 11. Two of his children are in school. Jean Bosco himself finished six years of elementary school.

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he says that the prior loans have really helped his business and that he anticipates no difficulties with repayment. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and  pay laborers.

Jean Bosco's strategy for growing his business is to request further loans in order to enlarge his fields and bolster his agricultural business. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to become a prominent rice farmer and seller in his region. He plans to use his profits to pay for his children's school fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the cost of labor for his rice farm.

loans.name: Business Fine Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Business Fine” group. They are small scale businessmen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve on their standard of living.
 
The leader of this group is Mustapha. Mustapha is 33-years-old and was born in Bo city, in southern Sierra Leone. Currently, he is residing in Koidu together with his wife and three children. Mustapha's wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For eight years now, Mustapha has been selling electronics. He has applied for this loan in order to be able to buy more electronic goods to add to his current inventory, which is meant for sale.
 
Also included at the right hand side of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more electronic goods to add to his current inventory, which is meant for sale

loans.name: Tounsidazanga 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATA est la représentante  du groupe TOUNSIDAZANGA II. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 09personnes  en charge.

Mme est restauratrice depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de gounghin et pissy. Ses clients sont les amis et voisinage.

Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’haricot, 02sacs de riz, 03bidons d’huile de 20l, 01sac de charbon et une charrette de bois de chauffe pour sa cuisine.

Mme veut épargner et améliorer son restaurant. Elle ambitionne aider à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. AISSATA is the representative of the group TOUNSIDAZANGA II. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of seven children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 14. Three go to school. She has nine persons to support.

Ms. AISSATA has been a restauranteur for ten years. She gets her supplies from the Gounghin et Pissy market. Her customers are friends and neighbors.

She wants to purchase a sack of beans, 2 sacks of rice, 3 containers of oil at 20 liters each, a sack of charcoal, and a cartload of firewood in order to cook her dishes.

She wants to save money and to improve her restaurant. Her ambition is to help cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase beans rice, oil, charcoal, and firewood for her restaurant

loans.name: Kalekye

texts.en:
Kalekye is a 48 year-old married woman. She has 8 children between the ages of 6 and 25. She describes herself to be outgoing woman. 

She operates a retail store selling charcoal, and has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a residential area  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a disturbance from the city council on cutting trees for charcoal. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase charcoal for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standard of her family with the profit she anticipates making. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 32-years-old and is married to a farmer. Viateur himself has been a maize farmer for 16 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy more fertilizers during maize production, as he needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase his production. Viateur wishes to invest in his business with profits gained from farming, so that in the future he can acquire machinery like tractors, which will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo shown was taken recently, at the previous maize plantation. Viateur says that the last season went well.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. This photo was taken recently at the previous maize plantation and Emmanuel says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is repeat client who has already accessed a Kiva agricultural loan. She is now applying for a loan of 500,000 shillings UGX to pay her son's third-term school fees. With the loan, her son will be able to go to school with fully paid fees, and avoid disruptions of his schooling, since it is the last term of the year.  

Fatuma will use proceeds from her grocery soap to repay the loan. She is so committed to her children's education that she does not want anything to disrupt them, so she is taking this loan. She is very hard working.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with one child, who is in school. She cares for additional family members in her home (grandparents).  

Since 2010, Helen has had a business selling charcoal, which she sells on a wholesale basis to other dealers.  She has two other sources of income; she supplies oil and does poultry farming. Helen works 7 days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of Shs. 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sacks of charcoal for sale. Her major challenge in business is seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to increase her stock of oil and expand her poultry farming premises. 

Helen owns her home, and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are for fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: LINLINGNON est un groupement composé de vingt neuf personnes, dont les membres habitent le même village et exercent pratiquement les mêmes activités. La représentante du groupement, Etiennette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 54 ans et est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés.  Etiennette vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs différents besoins. Il y a une vingtaine d'année que Etiennette exerce comme activité, la transformation de manioc et de noix de palme en farine de manioc et en huile de palme. Etiennette vend ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Etiennette s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Etiennette sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement LINLINGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
LINLINGNON is a group of 29 persons whose members live in the same village. They basically have the same work. The group's representative, Etiennette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Among her children, some are in school. She lives with her children and ensures that their different needs are met. 

For about twenty years, Etiennette has had a business processing cassava into cassava flour and palm nuts into palm oil. She sells her products at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and with the aim of increasing her working capital, Etiennette is requesting, along with the other members of the group LINLINGNON, a third loan, which will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and cassava

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with five children, all of whom are in school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 3 years. She works 6 days a week.  

She has requested for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings  from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to resell. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses, and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the famiy.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Esther   Nyokabi

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old, married with two children in school. She sells clothes in a competitive environment to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for six years, and has employed two people to assist her. 

She testifies that through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to operate her business well with the loans that she had previously acquired. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Esther is requesting for a loan of 100,000 KES to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Бахтиеру 40 лет. Он разведен и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами более 9 лет занимается услугами такси. Благодаря хорошему персоналу у него достаточно клиентов, но его доход не позволяет ему обеспечить свою семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами.  Его дети с годами все требуют больше блага, дополнительные уроки, компьютер, интернет требует массу денег.     Бахтиер должен развивать свой бизнес и преувеличивать доход. Для этого он должен отремонтировать машину  для привлечения клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  10000  сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bahtier is 40 years old. He is divorced and has 4 children in his care. In order to provide his family with all necessities of life, Bahtier has been offering taxi services for over 9 years. Thanks to his agreeable personality, he has plenty of clients, but his income is still insufficient to properly take care of his family. With age, Bahtier's children acquire additional needs, and their extracurricular tutoring, computers and internet access require significant amounts of money.

Bahtier needs to develop his business and increase his income. To this end, he must repair his car to attract additional customers, and so he is requesting a loan of 10000 somoni. Bahtier is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils (plates, bowls) and some clothing to sell

loans.name: Begirl

texts.en:
Begirl is 31 years old, and lives in Airport. She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 10. 

For the past three years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She has had some problems during the rainy season. 

She borrowed money from her friend to started her business, and she learned about selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El Sr. Anastacio  es originario de  Parras, Coahuila; emigró al estado de Nuevo León muy joven en busca de mejores oportunidades y se estbableció en el Municipio de Santa Catarina, N.L. donde empezó a trabajar en una panadería como ayudante, posteriormente aprendió el oficio de Panadero y con mucho sacrificio estableció una panadería muy chica.  Luego compró una bicileta y comenzó a vender pan por la principales calles de su colonia, y asi fue como el negocio comenzó a crecer poco a poco. 
Un tiempo despues que la panadería quedó establecida, se la dejó a su hija mayor y estableció un local para vender frutas y verduras, que junto a su esposa lo atienden.  El Sr. Anastacio compra frutas y  verduras que estan aun en buenas condiciones pero que centros comerciales retiran de la venta y la vende a bajo costo a personas de bajos recursos.  Anastacio se siente contento ayudando a una gran cantidad de personas en su colonia. Hoy dia solicita un crédito para instalar bases de madera donde las frutas y la verduras puedan ser selecionadas de manera fácil y rápida, pensando en un mejor servicio para su clientela.
texts.en: Anastacio comes from the city of Parras, in the state of Coahuila. He emigrated to the state of Nuevo León at a young age, in search of better opportunities, and put down roots in the municipality of Santa Catarina. He started working in a bakery as an apprentice, and then became a baker himself. He made a lot of sacrifices in order to set up a tiny bakery of his own. He then bought a bicycle and started to sell bread in the streets, helping his business grow. Some time after his bakery became well-established, he left it to his older son and set up a small fruit and vegetable shop with his wife. Anastacio buys fruits and vegetables that are still edible but that are discarded by supermarkets, and sells them at low prices to people with very low income. Anastacio is very happy to be able to help so many people in his town. He asks for this loan to buy wooden stands on which to place the produce so as to help customers choose and buy it easily and quickly, thus bringing them better service.

loans.use: to buy wooden stands on which to place the produce so that his shop becomes self-service.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl de 36 años, esta casado con Teofila de 32 años y tienen 03 queridos hijos, juntos habitan en su propia casa que obtuvieron gracias a su trabajo. Raúl  y su esposa se dedican en los trabajos del campo; con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Raúl siembra cacao, café y piña; ya que estos son los frutos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta los centros de acopio de su localidad, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su crédito número 04, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy contento. Con el préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará estiércol, para poder tener una buena producción de frutos naturales.
texts.en: Raúl is 36 and is married to Teofila, who is 32.  They have 3 beloved children, with whom they live in their own home that they obtained thanks to their work.  Raúl and his wife make a living by working in the field.  With a lot of effort, he has made their lands very productive.  He knows that every product he obtains will be of quality.  Raúl grows cacao, coffee, and pineapple, since these are the fruits that have the most demand in the market.  What he likes most about his job is protecting his crops from the plagues that can affect them, which would reduce his profits.  He has done this work for 11 years, and he thinks the most difficult part about it is transporting his crops to to where he sells them.  In the future, he hopes to gather the necessary money to buy new lands.  This is his fourth credit, and he feels that this credit will help him a lot with developing his business.  His communal bank is very responsible, and he is very happy with it.  With this loan of 1,000 PEN, he will buy manure so he can have a good production of natural fruit.

loans.use: to buy manure for natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Yenawa 1 Group

texts.fr: YENAWA 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Rosaline Mondoukpè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Bernard. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et à leur charge. Rosaline Mondoukpè et son mari et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Rosaline Mondoukpè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Rosaline Mondoukpè mène comme activité la vente de riz, des mèches et des vêtements de façon secondaire à son domicile. Rosaline Mondoukpè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Rosaline Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Rosaline Mondoukpè sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe YENAWA 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YENAWA 1 is a group of three persons whose members are friends belonging to the same tontine. The group's representative, Rosaline Mondoukpè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 45 years old and married to an electrician named Bernard. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school and in their care. She and her husband jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Rosaline Mondoukpè did not attend school. For nearly fifteen years, she has had a business selling rice out of her home. She sells hair extensions and clothing on the side. She works at her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Rosaline Mondoukpè is requesting, along with the other members of the group YENAWA 1, a fourth loan, which will be used to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, clothing, and rice to sell from home

loans.name: Agossi Albertine

texts.fr: Albertine est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et à deux enfants dont l'aîné est déjà scolarisé. Le plus âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 03 mois. Couturière de formation, elle vend des tissus et de la mercerie depuis 06 ans à domicile. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande des ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son revenu et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Albertine is 31 years old and married, and she has two children, of whom the oldest is already in school. The oldest children is 4 years old, and the youngest is 3 months old. A dressmaker by training, she has been selling cloth and sewing supplies for six years out of her home. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her sales and satisfying customers demands, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to maximize her income and to help cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth of various types to sell from home

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus suegros ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de ocho horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche corriendo muchos riesgos y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El  crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que desea comprar batería  y llantas ya que es la única fuente de trabajo con la que cuenta  para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Leonardo es mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más seguridad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Leonardo is married and has two children who are school-aged.  They live in two rooms in his in-law's house.  The home is located in the northern part of the city of La Paz.

Leonardo currently works as a driver for more than 8 hours a day, up until the late hours of the night.  This occupation carries a lot of risks, but he needs the earnings to cover the expenses for his family's food, education and basic services.

Leonardo needs a loan to do maintenance work on his vehicle.  He wants to buy a battery and tires, because this is the only source of income he has to support his family.

Leonardo's dream is to increase his income so that he could acquire a house through an anticrético (lease arrangement).  This would enable him to provide more security for his family, and improve their quality of life.

This is the first time that Leonardo has worked with IMPRO together with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and a battery for his vehicle

loans.name: Bellas Artes Group

texts.es:
Marisol es una joven integrante del grupo Bellas Artes, tiene 28 años, y se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y ropa usada en mercados rodantes. Es casada y tiene una pequeña hija de 3 años y medio. Ella decidió comenzar con su negocio ya que a su esposo le detectaron cáncer desde hace 6 meses y desde entonces se encuentra incapacitado; Marisol trabaja de jueves a martes en los mercados vendiendo ropa y toda la semana ofrece los zapatos por catalogo y el miércoles hace aseo en una casa para obtener mas ingresos, ya que se tiene que hacer cargo de todos los gastos para sacar a delante a su familia. El crédito lo utilizo para surtir una paca de ropa para venderla en el mercado y pedidos de zapatos para comenzar tandas entre sus clientes.
Marisol nos cuenta que sus compañeras son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables.
texts.en: Marisol is a young member of the Bellas Artes group.  She is 28 and makes a living selling shoes by catalog and used clothing at traveling markets. She is married and has a young daughter, who is 3 1/2.  She decided to start her business when her husband was diagnosed with cancer 6 months ago and has since been incapacitated.  Marisol works from Thursdays to Tuesdays in the markets selling clothing and offers shoes all week long through catalogs.  On Wednesdays, she cleans a house to make more income.  She has to be in charge of all of their expenses to take good care of her family.  She used the loan to buy a pack of clothing to sell at the market and to fill shoe orders.  Marisol tells us that her fellow group members are very hard working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy a pack of clothing and to fill shoe orders.

loans.name: Mariette

texts.en:
Mariette is 24 years old. She is single. She has been a farmer for the past 5 years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The photo was taken recently at another maize plantation and Mariette says that the last season went well. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Pierre Celestin

texts.en:
Pierre Celestin is 36 years old. He is married and his wife is self employed. He has been a maize farmer for 14 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at another maize plantation. Pierre Celestin says that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 37 years old, and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and has six children between the ages of 3 and 18, all whom are in school.  Four of her children live at home.  

Rebecca stopped her education at 1st grade, and for the past 20 years she been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She started this business with help from her father, and learned this business from her father. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onion, pepper, rice, charcoal, and salt for her business.  She likes her business because it helps her to save.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, pepper, rice, charcoal and salt for her business.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious lives in Buchanan. She is married, and has four children between the ages of 17 and 26, two of which are in school. 

For the past 20 years, she has been selling used shoes in the market. She started this business with a little money that she received from her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to resell.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino, de 42 años de edad, es un hombre muy optimista; habita en la casa que compró gracias a su trabajo, con su esposa Rayda de 38 años y sus 04 hijos. Rufino, se dedica a sus sembríos de cacao, café y piña; para poder sostener a su familia. Esta actividad viene trabajando 21 años; siendo cada vez más fructífera sus cultivos lo único dificultoso es que las plagas afecten su buena producción para la obtención de cosechas; en tiempos de cogida siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. En este negocio, su planta más favorita es la hoja de coca ya que recibe buenas ganancias.
Con los ahorros obtenidos de cada año ampliará su lote de terreno con la finalidad de sembrar más productos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su crédito número 08, por el cual se compromete a cumplir su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal por la confianza depositada.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo piensa invertir en la compra  sacos de abonos, con la finalidad de dar un buen mantenimiento a sus plantas.
texts.en: Rufino is 42 and is a very optimistic man.  He lives in a house that he bought thanks to his work with his wife, Rayda, who is 38, and their 4 children.  Rufino makes a living growing cacao, coffee, and pineapple to support his family.  He has done this work for 21 years.  HIs crops are more fruitful every year.  The only difficulty are the plagues that affect his crop production.  At harvest time, he always has the help of day laborers.  In this business, his favorite plant is the coca leaf, which earns good profits.  With the savings he obtains each year, he will expand his land with the goal of harvesting more products to be improve his income.  This is his eighth credit, and he promises to comply with the payment schedule.  He is also thankful to his communal bank for the confidence it has in him.  With these 3,000 PEN, he is planning on investing in sacks of fertilizer with the goal of maintaining his plants well.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Qory Orcco-Pucyura Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal QORY ORCCO - PUCYURA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Pucyura  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.

La socia Gladys , la socia tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, la socia lleva años en este su negocio administrándolo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son pinturas,calaminas,cemento,tubos entre otros, la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado en su negocio desde las 08:0am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como pinturas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, agricultura, ganadería, venta de granos secos, panadería, crianza de animales menores, venta de verduras.

Las personas que salen con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen en las fotos adjuntas son socias que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo una de ellas es la socia Gladys quien sale en la foto con su negocio.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Orcco – Pucyura” which is located in the District of Pucyura in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her hardware business. She has managed this business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Gladys sells paints, corrugated iron, cement, tubing, and other supplies. She works at her business Monday through Saturday from 8:00 A.M. to approximately 9:00 P.M.

Gladys is a responsible and industrious individual who works so that she can move her family forward. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as paints.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling clothes, farming, raising livestock, selling dried grains, managing a bakery, raising small animals, and selling vegetables. Those individuals in the photo who have their faces covered are not part of the Communal Bank. The members who appear in the smaller attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the group meeting because of their work. One of these members is Sra. Gladys, who had her photo taken at her business. She is grateful for the loan that she has received and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as paints.

loans.name: Majohn

texts.en:
Majohn is 39 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have two children, ages 6 and 14. Both of them are attending school and live at home. 

For the past twenty years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. 

She plans to be a big business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sifatoy

texts.ru: Сифатой  целеустремленный человек, она замужем и  имеет двоих детей. Дети еще нетрудоспособные, старшему 15 лет, а младшему 12 лет. Она начала  заниматься скотоводством и земледелием с детства. В основном она  выращивается  пшеницу, картофель, и другие сельхоз продукты. В настоящее время она выращивает 4 голов КРС. Уже более 10 -и лет она занимается этим бизнесом. В ведении бизнеса ей помогает муж. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для покупки скота. На полученный доход от реализации скота она  намерена расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sifatoy is a purposeful person, she is married and has two children. The kids are still unable to work, the oldest one is 15 years old, the youngest one 12 years old. 

Sifatoy started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in her childhood. She mainly grows wheat, potatoes and other agricultural products. She currently raises four heads of cattle. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. Her husband helps her in running the business. 

Sifatoy requests a loan in the amount of 1,100 US dollars for the purchase of cattle. She intends to use the income received from selling the cattle to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dulce Aroma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DULCE AROMA” iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cinthia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: chiflera, comerciante de pantalones, costura y venta de ropa, costura de chamarras, comerciante y venta de blusas, cosmetología, artesanía en tejido, almacén de licores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cinthia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropas, ella da a conocer que esta actividad la inicio por iniciativa propia, viendo la necesidad que tenía su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en las áreas de salud y crédito.
texts.en: The Dulce Aroma ('Sweet Smell') communal bank is starting its first cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, as part of the focus centre of Villa Exaltación. It has eight members and is headed by a board; Cinthia is the treasurer. The members have different types of businesses: selling snacks, selling trousers, sewing and selling clothes, making jackets, selling blouses, cosmetics, weaving artisanal cloth, selling spirits. The money these small entrepreneurs borrow benefits all of them. Cinthia says it is the first time she works with Pro Mujer, and that a friend, who is a member, invited her. Cinthia has a shop where she sells clothes. She started this business on her own initiative, trying to get her family out of its state of poverty. She will use the loan to buy more clothes from wholesalers and then sell them in her shop. Her business helps her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her partner and their two sons. When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she finds the courses on health and credit opportunities very helpful.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, de 59 años de edad, vive solo en su propia casa que compró gracias a sus esfuerzos y lo construyó a base de madera. Félix, durante 32 años se ha dedicado a cultivo de café y siempre trata de mejorar en cuanto a la calidad de su producto. En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros, con la finalidad de obtener mayor rendimiento en su faena laboral. 
Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio ubicado a una hora y media de su comunidad; su trabajo empieza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta horas de la tarde, ya que siempre esta al cuidado de los insectos que aquejan los frutos de sus plantas. Félix, con el dinero del crédito comprará fertilizantes y abono orgánico para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas. Este es su crédito número 09, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Félix, who is 59 years old, lives alone in his own house, which he bought through his own hard work and built from wood. Félix has cultivated coffee for 32 years and he is always trying to improve the quality of his product. During the harvest and weeding seasons, he needs help from day laborers, with the goal of getting a better yield on his hard work. 

He sells his product at collection centers that are located an hour and a half from his town. He starts work in the very early hours of the morning and works until the afternoon. He is always looking out for the insects that affect the fruit of his plants. Félix will use the money from the loan to buy fertilizers and manure to help maintain his plants. This is his 9th loan, and he pledges to continue repaying according to his repayment schedule. He also feels that he will be able to go far with his communal bank because everyone is committed to the good management of the group. With the PEN 3,000 (Peruvian Nuevos Soles), he will buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gans

texts.es:
Gans de 19 años de edad, convive con Elitza de 18 años; habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina que su padre le dio por herencia. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Gans, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en los centros de acopio; a pesar de ser joven tiene mucho conocimiento sobre los cultivos y de muy buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a buenos precios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la buena remuneración que le brindan los acopiadores después de tanto esfuerzo; sin embargo su dificultad es no poder combatir con las plagas que interrumpen su buena producción, ya que esto puede afectar sus ingresos, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad.
 Gans necesita el crédito para comprar sacos de abono y así mejorar sus tierras y posteriormente cosechar frutos de buena calidad y en abundancia. Este es su crédito número 02, se siente muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Gans is 19 years old. He lives with Elitza, 18 years old. They live in their own house made from rustic wood and a tin roof, materials which he inherited from his father. The fields that Gans worked so hard to get are the main source of income for his whole family. His products are very sought after in the agricultural collection centers. Despite being very young, he is very knowledgeable about his crop and it is of very good quality, so he sells his product for a good price.

What he likes most about his job is the price that the buyers give him after so much hard work. However, his greatest difficulty is not being able to combat the pests that prevent good production, since this can affect his earnings. He has been doing this work for 6 years.

Gans needs the loan to buy sacks of manure so he can improve his land and then harvest good-quality and abundant fruits. This is his second loan. He feels very happy knowing that he will have financial support, since this will make him feel secure in buying what he needs. He is ready to make his agreed-upon payments punctually. With the PEN 1,000.00 (Peruvian Nuevos Soles), he will buy sacks of manure to fertilize his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure for  his coffee plants.

loans.name: Risolatmo

texts.ru: Рисолатмо очень целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 72 года. Она вдова и ее дети уже совершеннолетние.  Рисолатмо   решила помочь детям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Risolatmo is a very purposeful and hardworking woman. She is 72 years old. She is a widow and her children are already adults. 

Risolatmo decided to help her children for the good of the family. With this aim she participated in the course "Bring it on", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received a certificate. She would like to set up a business of buying and selling cattle, as she has experience in this type of business. 

Risolatmo requests a loan of the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock, in order to set up a new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to set up a new business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 36 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 16 years. He will use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest profits from his farming in his business so that he can acquire machines like tractors in the future that will enhance his farming capacity. The photo was taken recently at the maize plantation and shows that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs.

loans.name: Cecilia Esther

texts.es:
Cecilia comenzó arrendando un local al sur de la ciudad, luego consiguió la casa y el local para tener su panaderia. Su familia tenia como negocio hace años atras una panadería, y fue ese el otro motivo de comenzar con tal negoci.  En la actualidad tiene la ayuda de unos de sus hijos para elaborar la masa del pan y empiezan las labores a las 21:00pm hasta la 1:00am luego a las 6:00am empieza las ventas hasta las 10:00am. 

Cecilia es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de 28, 23 y 20 años. Con el préstamo va a comprar harina, huevos, levaduras en la panadería. Unas de sus metas es mejorar su vivienda y construir cuartos de arriendo para el futuro.
texts.en:
Cecilia began by renting a facility south of the city and later she set up a place in her home for her bakery. Her family had a bakery years ago and this was another reason that she opened a business like this. Currently she has the help of some of her children to make the bread dough and they begin their work at 9:00PM working until 1:00AM. Later at 6:00AM the sales begin and go on until 10:00AM.

Cecilia is a single mother. She has 3 children who are 28, 23 and 20 years old. With the loan she is going to buy flour, eggs, and yeast for the bakery. One of her goals is to improve her house adding rooms to rent for the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and yeast for her home based bakery

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda and is married with three children, who are all in school. She rents a house for a home and has access to piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Grace has run a restaurant for seven years. She sells cooked food on a retail basis in a market. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 700000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more raw food for the restaurant like bunches of bananas, beef, Irish potatoes, cassava and rice. Grace said the reason she decided to work with MCDT SACCO is that the interest rate is low. 

The major challenges Grace has in her business are mainly thieves and seasonality. Grace’s business goals and aspirations are to open up new branches within the market and to own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, Irish potatoes, cassava and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es casada y tiene cuatro hijos vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de comida rápida por las noches y hasta altas horas ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. También cuenta con los ingresos de la venta de joyas de oro que hace por el día de forma ambulante para aumentar sus ingresos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más joyas para posteriormente venderlas ya que es uno de sus ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Mercedes es aumentar sus ingresos y poder construir su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mercedes is married and has four children. She lives in her own home, occupying three small rooms with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located  in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. 

Currently, she sells fast food in the evenings and until late at night, as she must cover her family's expenses for food, education and payment of basic services.

She also has income from the sale of gold jewelry, which she does during the day as a street vendor, in order to add to her income.

She needs the loan for the purchase of more jewelry for subsequent sale, as this is one of the incomes she has for supporting her family.

Mercedes' dream is to increase her income and to be able to do work on her house, in order to provide more comfort for her family and improve their quality of life.

It is the second time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 27 años soltero que vive en la parroquia "Rosa Zárate" de la ciudad de "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

José a pesar de únicamente haber cursado la educación secundaria se desempeña como mecánico de vehículos, aprendiendo este oficio con el pasar de los años que a la fecha ya son 10 que tiene con su taller propio. Él desea fortalecer su negocio renovando sus herramientas y comprando ciertos repuestos que son mayormente demandados al momento de reparar los vehículos de sus clientes de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio con lo que cree que tendrá mayor clientela y a mediano plazo aumentará sus ingresos.

Para lograr este objetivo José desea obtener un préstamo, la falta de oportunidades de financiamiento han sido un gran obstáculo para este joven por lo que hoy, al ser su primer credito José se siente optimista.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, single, and lives in the Rosa Zárate parish in the city of Santo Domingo, which is one of the youngest cities in the country. It is located in the area where the mountainous region and costal region of Ecuador meet. It is an area that is privileged, not only because of its ethnic richness, but also because of the unusual landscapes that can be found in this beautiful city. Santo Domingo de los Colorados now belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was recently formed. The most important annual fair in Santo Domingo is celebrated with an influx of visitors, commerce, and cultural interchange. There is also a large fair in the Cattleman’s Association buildings, where they show and compete woth the best examples of the different breeds and crosses from the haciendas of the region. 

José, despite having only completed secondary education, works as a car mechanic. He learned this trade through the years and has had his own shop for 10 years. He wants to strengthen his business by buying new tools and also certain replacement parts that are always needed when repairing his client’s vehicles. In this way, he will be able to provide better service, which he thinks will help him get more clients and also improve his income.

In order to achieve his goal, José would like to obtain a loan. The lack of opportunities for financing have been a big obstacle for this young man. Now, with what would be his first loan, José feels optimistic.

loans.use: to buy new tools and to buy replacement car parts for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hotdogs, hamburgers and also beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nadyr

texts.es:
Nadyr es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padrinos ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada en una institución privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe ayudar con los pagos de servicios básicos y alimentación.
El  crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo de secretaría y también en sus estudios de enfermería.
El sueño de Nadir, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Nadyr is single and has no children. She lives in the home of her godparents, occupying just one room. The home is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. 

Currently she earns income working as an employee in a private institution for more than eight hours a day. This because she must help with the payment of basic services and with food expenses. 

She needs the loan in order to purchase a laptop computer, as it will be a great help to her in her work as a secretary and in her nursing studies.

Nadyr's dream is to improve her income and to be able to live on her own, so that she can have more comfort and improve her quality of life.

It is the first time she is working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer that will help her in her work and in her studies.

loans.name: Flor Yamile

texts.es: La Sra. Flor  tiene 25 años,  es soltera con 1 hijos que  tiene la edad de un año, ella se dedica al comercio de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la localidad de Rio Seco,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Flor va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una picadora de huesos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere vender hueso blanco y rojo para la elaboración de sopas, la Sra. Flor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la localidad,  pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de una congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Flor is 25 years old. She is single and has one son, who is one year old. She sells meat in her butcher shop, which is located in the town of Rio Seco. This loan is her first with the institution. Flor will use the loan to buy a bone cutter. Her reason for requesting the loan is that she wants to sell white and red bone for making soups. Flor faces challenges in her business, such as competition, because there are several butcher shops in the area. However, she has many clients because of the friendliness with which she treats them. She will also use the funds to buy a large freezer. Her hope for her business is to have a business that is stable and profitable. In this way, she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a bone cutter.

loans.name: Conscience Group

texts.en:
Nyange is the leader of the community bank named “Conscience.”  This group is composed of 10 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Nyange sells salted and smoked fish in the central market of Kenya in Lubumbashi. She has been in business since 1986, and she has solid experience in this field. Her beginning capital was $100. Currently, through her sales, Nyange makes about $120 per week. She plans to use the next loan to purchase some bags of salted and smoked fish to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having twelve times received and properly repaid loans. She dreams of one day becoming a fish provider in her area. Nyange is 57 years old, married and the mother of two children whose ages are 15 and 41. One of the two attends school.

loans.use: to purchase bags of salted and smoked fish to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 39 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children, ages 13 to 17, that are in school and all of them live at home. For the past 20 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She makes a lot of profit, because she sells quality used clothes and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children.  All the three are in school.  Jane’s business is selling second-hand clothes in a shop on retail basis.  She has been in the business for two years; her other source of income is selling charcoal at home. She works six days a week.  Jennifer has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of clothes.  Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma tiene 35 años, está achampañada  hace 20 años con el señor Hector de 41 años de edad, la pareja tiene 3 hijos, por quienes se esfuerzan para poder darles un mejor estilo de vida.
La señora Irma tiene este negocio desde hace 2 años , se dedica a la decoración para eso cuenta con todos elementos necesarios, también cuenta con globo loco y cama elástica, para acontecimientos infantiles,  además vende puerta metálica con marco, puerta de aluminio y otros accesorios, para llevar adelante su negocio le ayuda su hija la mayor que maneja todo el negocio.                                    
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de un globo loco, vidrios y otros detalles que utiliza y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que siempre está muy cargada de pedidos.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is 35 years old.  She and her partner of 20 years, 41-year old señor Hector, have 3 children.  They make every effort to give their children a better quality of life.
Señora Irma has had her business for 2 years.  She makes her living decorating for parties, and so she has all the necessary elements.  She also has an inflatable bouncer and a trampoline for children's parties.  In addition, she sells metal doors with frames, aluminum doors and other accessories.  Her oldest daughter helps her to keep the business successful; she manages the business.                                  
Señora Irma is requesting the loan to purchase an inflatable bouncer, glass and other items that she uses to be able to meet her customers needs, as she always has a lot of requests.

loans.use: to purchase an inflatable bouncer and glass.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna de 35 años, vive en su propia casa junto  de su esposo Leoncio de 35 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Reyna es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su casa familiar; se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura donde en sus tierras siembra cultivos de café; esta labor viene realizando hace 13 años y siempre lo hace con mucho esmero,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró su terreno para seguir cultivando.
Las cosechas los llevan a los centros de acopio situados a una hora y media de su localidad, donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos. 
Reyna necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, tiene planeado realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas comprando abono para cuidar sus  plantas de café; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos y a sus hijos. Este es su crédito número 04, por ello espera del apoyo de los financistas para poder concretar sus planes  de trabajo y por ende se compromete a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable que da ejemplo a sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono organico, para esparcir entre sus plantas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 35 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband, Leoncio, who is 35 years old and her four dear children, to whom she wants to give a good education so that in the near future they will be men with good prospects. Reyna is a woman who works hard. She does her best every day to give all she can to the members of her family household. 

She works in agriculture where she grows coffee on their land. She has been doing this work for 13 years and always does it with much care, and thanks to the fruit produced by the plants, she bought the land to continue farming. The harvest is taken to the collection centers that are located an hour and half from their area where she receives higher prices for the grain.

Reyna needs the support of the financial institution to continue with her work. She’s planned to maintain her plants buying fertilizer to care for her coffee plants which is why she came to the loan association through the MFP institution who makes it easier for low-income people to get ahead. For the good of her work, she hopes to have the same results in order for her crops and her children to get ahead. This is her fourth loan and she is hoping for the support of the lenders in order to be able to carry out her work plans and thereupon she promises to make her payments in a timely way.

She is a trustworthy member of her communal bank who sets an example for the other members. With the 2,000 soles she will buy organic fertilizer to spread upon her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to spread upon her coffee plants

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo Efraín de 26 años y tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad donde compraron su propia casa a base de madera. Sonia, es una mujer laboriosa; ella y su esposo se dedican a la siembra y cosecha de plantas de café; siempre se esmeran por darle el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y gracias a ello siempre obtienen una buena cosecha; estos lo llevan a comercializar donde los  compradores quienes remuneran buenas ganancias  por la calidad de su producto agrícola. En los tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción  de su producto final y fruto a su esfuerzo cotidiano está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos. Sonia con el crédito que obtuvo comprará abono natural para que sus plantas de café tengan buenos frutos en su temporada. Este es su crédito número 02, por el cual asegura cumplir puntualmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura en que tendrá mucho éxito en su banco comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en: Sonia is 27 years old. She lives with her husband, Efraín, who is 26 years old. They have two school-aged children. They live together in the town where they bought their own house, which is made of wood. Sonia is a very hard-working person. She and her husband plant and harvest coffee. They always put a lot of effort into the best care for their plantations, and thanks to this they always have a good harvest. They take their harvest to sell to buyers who give them a good price for the quality of their product. During the harvest period, they need the help of day laborers, so that they can bring in the final product. The fruit of their daily hard labor is that they earn a good income. Sonia will use the loan she obtained to buy manure so that her coffee plants will have good fruits at harvest time. This is her second loan, and she pledges to make her repayments punctually. She also predicts that she will have a lot of success with her communal bank. With the PEN 1,000.00 (Peruvian Nuevos Soles), she will buy manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,la socia se dedica a este negocio 9 años y le va muy bien ya que es una mujer emprendedora y trbajaora y gracias a su trabajo ella puede sacra s sus hijos adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para que compre autopartes como faros de carro al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her business selling auto parts for cars. She has been in this business for nine years, and it is going very well, as she is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Thanks to her work, she is able to raise her children. 

Her dream is to expand her auto parts business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy auto parts such as car headlights, at wholesale.   

The borrower is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy auto parts such as car headlights, at wholesale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 22  and married.  She has a 2-year-old child who is in school, and she lives in Kakata. 

Marie ended her education in  the 10th  grade. She has been selling palm oil, cooking oil, rice, pepper, vita (a juice drink), salt and many other items for  the past five years in the general market. She started in this business with a small amount of money that she received from her saving club.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more cooking oil, palm oil, rice and vita to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, palm oil, rice and vita (a juice drink) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ratike

texts.en:
Ratike is a 47-year-old woman. She describes herself as social and charismatic. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as low customer purchasing power. 

Ratike will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food for selling. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food for selling.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married with 2 dependents. Lilia is 45 years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lilia has owned and operated a gardening business to earn a living for two years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from the business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2006, Lilia joined GDMPC. In the future, Lilia wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador vive en su propia casa que obtuvo gracias al empeño en su trabajo. La labor que realiza Fidel es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de café; Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra desde muy pequeño y desde hace 05 años compro su propia parcela desde entonces viene trabajando en sus propias tierras. 
Fidel en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesita apoyo, es por ello que contrata jornaleros para culminar su labor con mayor rapidez. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas son productivas, obteniendo buenas ganancias por las ventas de las mismas. Menciona que en los tiempos de lluvia es donde las plagas aquejan los frutos de sus plantas y estas hacen que su buena producción se lleguen a dañar; es por ello que siempre cuenta con el apoyo de los financieros, porque gracias al crédito logra mantenerla fértiles sus plantas de café. Este es su crédito número 05, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe de las actividades que realizan los demás socios.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo de 2,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono.
texts.en:
Fidel, 27, is a very hard-working person who lives in his own home that he obtained thanks to the effort he put into his job. Fidel makes his living working the land where he grows coffee plants. His parents showed him how to plough the land at a young age, and some five years ago Fidel bought his own plot of land which he has been working ever since then.

When it is time to harvest and weed, Fidel needs assistance which is why he hires day laborers in order to finish his work at a faster rate.
