He feels very involved in his work, because it is thanks to his efforts on a daily basis that today he can enjoys seeing that his plants are producing, and obtaining good profits from their sale.

He mentions that when it rains heavily, plagues afflict the fruits on his plants and mean that his good produce is damaged. This is why he always relies on the support of financiers, because it is thanks to the loan that he manages to keep his coffee plants fertile. 

This is Fidel's 5th loan and he is committed to meeting all repayments in a timely fashion given that he would like to have access to another loan in the future. In his communal bank, Fidel is a member who actively participates in the activities performed by the other members. With the loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles that he has obtained, he will invest the money in the purchase of fertilizers and manure.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Suah

texts.en: Suah is 28 years old.  She ended her education in the 9th grade and she lives with her friend in Kakata. She has two children, aged 5 months and 4 years, and one attends school.  For the past four years she has been selling biscuits, sardines, candy, bath soap and washing soap in the community. She received help from her friend to start the business, she makes profit when she sells and with the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her child.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more sardines, biscuits, candy and bath soap for the business. Her plan for the future is to further her education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, biscuits, candy and bath soap to sell

loans.name: Benediction Baco Group

texts.en:
Marceline, who is 43 years old and married, is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Bénédiction”, which consists of nine members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. Their common goal is to develop their businesses.

Marceline started her business in 2005. She has been running a restaurant located northwest of the city of Lubumbashi. With hard work and determination, she has succeeded in making it thrive thanks to good management and accumulated profits. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received eight different loans and has repaid them properly. 

Marceline intends to use the next loan to buy fish, meat, etc. for her restaurant with the aim of increasing profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of about $65. Her ambition for the future is to open a big restaurant in her environment.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, etc. for her restaurant in order to generate more profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Divinagracia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic re-loading. Divinagracia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her business selling dry goods.

Divinagracia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is a married and a mother of 6 dependents. She is 57 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Angelita owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income, which is around 8,680 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 3 years. Angelita requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Angelita is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Angelita wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 61 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Vicenta de 66 años y sus 05 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Paulino se ha dedicado durante 40 años a la agricultura y esta labor es su principal sustento que tiene toda su familia;  sus productos son muy solicitados en los centros de acopio; ubicadas a una hora de su localidad, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar las plantas de café, es de buena calidad.
 Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cosechar los frutos ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos; sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados y le quitan mucha energía. 
Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Este es su crédito número 07; sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy campechano y jovial.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono orgánico para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Paulino, who is 61 years old, is a happy and hard-working man.  He lives in his own home with his 66-year old wife, Vicenta, and their five dear children.  They want to give their children a better quality of life.  Paulino has made his living in agriculture for 40 years.  It is his family's principal source of income.  Paulino's produce is in high demand in the warehouses, which are located about an hour from his town.  His notoriety comes form his coffee harvests, which are very good quality. 
What Paulino likes most about his work are the harvests because he feels that the months of hard work pay off in the quality of his produce.  Nevertheless, he feels that the most difficult part of his work is transporting the sacks of crop, which are very heavy and take a lot of his energy. 
With the requested loan, Paulino will purchase sacks of compost to fertilize his lands and make them productive again.  This is his 7th loan.  Paulino knows that the money from the loan will be quite beneficial to his work.  Paulino is a very straightforward and cheerful member of his communal bank. 
With the 2,000 nuevos soles ($775 USD), Paulino will purchase sacks of compost to improve his lands.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de joyas,ella vende collares,aretes y pulseras0 y tambien sigue siendo promotora de una mepresa de comida,la socia en el negocio de venta de joyas tiene 7 años y le va muy bien ya que con los dos negocios puede sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la joyas ya que ella ahora solo vende en forma independiente llevando a sus amigas o instituciones.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pulseras,collares y aretes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is still working in her business selling jewelry. She sells necklaces, earrings and bracelets, and also continues to be a sales representative for a food company.

She has been in the jewelry business for seven years, and it is going very well, as with the two businesses she is able to raise her children.

Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the jewelry, as now she sells independently, bringing her merchandise to friends and institutions. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy bracelets, necklaces and earrings. 

She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is age 59. She is married and has two children. She has been a farmer for the past 30 years. She will use this Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. She wishes to invest profits from her farming in her business so that she can acquire machines like tractors in the future that will enhance her farming capacity. The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows that the last season went well. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs in the production of maize.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37, married and lives in Kakata, with her husband and three children, aged 6 through 21, who all attend school.

She has been involved in her business for the past six years.  She sells soft drinks, mineral water, bath soap, cooking oil, rice and pepper. She learn to sell from her mother, and she started in the business with initial capital from her husband.  She makes a profit when she sells, with the profit she buys more goods to extend her business and she is able to expand it with the help of her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, mineral water, bath soap, pepper and rice for the business.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, mineral water, bath soap, pepper and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bethel

texts.en:
Bethel is 44 years old and married with three children.

Bethel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Bethel has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Bethel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to improve the service in the business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es casada y tiene cuatro hijos viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer propietario por más de ocho horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que desea tenerlo en buen estado por que es su única fuente de trabajo.
El sueño de Sofía, es mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sofía is married and has four children. They live in their own house, occupying three rooms with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Alto Llojeta area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, she earns income as her husband has works as an owner/driver for more than eight hours a day, and until late at night. This is because he must cover their family's expenses for food, education and payment of basic services.

She needs the loan for maintaining their vehicle, as she wishes to keep it in good condition as it is their only source of work. 

Sofía's dream is to improve her income and to do work on her house, in order to provide her family with more comfort and improve their quality of life. 

This is the second time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To maintain their taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
This is Kristina.  She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Kristina hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Ester is married and has 4 children. Ester has raised pigs for a living for 6 years and she earns PHP 10,000 a month. In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC. Esther is requesting a loan of PHP 12,500 which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon comes from the Aru Islands, specifically from the village of Dobo. This is an area in eastern Indonesia, which is in the archipelago with the islands connected by small boats. Because Simon comes from the islands, he wants to be a ship technician. He is currently studying at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara in the Teknika program. However, Simon is worried that he will be unable to complete his studies due to the economic conditions of his underprivileged family. His parents are separated. His father is dead and his mother does not have any special skills for work. Right now, his brother who works at a store, finances Simon's education. Simon hopes to get a loan from Kiva so that he can take care of the problem of the cost of tuition. Simon hopes the lenders will help him realize his dream of working as a ship tekniksi, being a professional and making his mother happy.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Dionafe

texts.en:
This is Dionafe, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dionafe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Dionafe hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will all finish college through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es viudo y tiene un hijo el cual ya es independiente, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y recibe renta de jubilación, ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su casa ya que las paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas.
El sueño de Orlando es construir su casa para poder acoger a su hijo.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Orlando is a widower and has one son who is already independent. He lives in his own home, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently he works as an employee at a private company and receives a retirement pension, as he must cover his expenses for food and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan to do repairs to his house, as the walls are in very poor condition. 

Orlando's dream is to do further construction on his house, so that he can take in his son.  

It is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To do repairs to his home.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Dioleta, 40, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Esteban, a sewer, and she is a mother to her children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dioleta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Dioleta hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will all finish college through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is married with 4 kids. She is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. Conchita is a farmer and she grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years and every month she earns PHP 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Conchita joined GDMPC just this year. In the future, Conchita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
At 58, Teresita manages a business buying and selling vegetables with glutinous rice snacks and a piggery business around their village in Mallig and nearby villages. Her husband works as a farm laborer to add to their daily income. She has four children, all of them now adults. Three are married and her eldest is still single. 

Teresita uses a bicycle to do her selling. She is able to reach her customers easily with the help of her bicycle. Teresita has been doing the business for 20 years already. Last time, she borrowed PHP 8,000 and now is requesting another loan of PHP 15,000 to buy various vegetables and glutinous rice for her daily vending business. She will also buy sacks of feed for her eight head of pigs. 

Income generated from the business will be invested in her business expansion.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and glutinous rice to sell

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Myagmarsuren is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a Mongolian yurt in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband, Dorlig, is a driver for a private company. Her children, Tsendayush and Tuyatsetseg, are secondary school students. In 2009, Mrs. Myagmarsuren started growing organic vegetables such as organic potatoes, carrots, watermelon, etc. with her family on a one hectare piece of land. The family grows organic vegetables from May to July. Starting in June, she sells the organic vegetables at the market until autumn. During this season the organic vegetables are relatively cheap, but starting in November, the price increases. Therefore, she is planning to buy more organic vegetables than she produces and sell them to customers. She is a hardworking and honest person. She is asking for 800,000 MNT to purchase more organic vegetables to sell in the off season.

loans.use: To purchase more organic vegetables to sell in the off season

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a widow with 3 children. Clara is 63 years old and resides in Canibungan Daku, Clarin. Clara owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Clara joined GDMPC. In the future, Clara wants to build a house and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Yadira Yamileth

texts.es: Yadira tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene una hija y vive con ella en el municipio de Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Hace 10 años que Yadira decidió establecer su propio negocio para obtener ingresos del hogar, donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser: harina, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, manteca, refrescos, lácteos, etc. ella solicito a ODEF este préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir mas el negocio de productos de la canasta básica familiar y obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su hija. Con el negocio surtido va brindar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es crecer como microempresaria y generar ganancias para ahorrar y darle el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Yadira is 28 years old. She is a single mother with one daughter, and lives with her in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. 

Ten years ago, Yadira decided to set up her own business, in order to obtain household income. Here she sells basic household products such as flour, rice, beans, sugar, salt, lard, soft drinks, dairy products, etc. 

She has applied to ODEF for this loan of 10,000 lempiras, to further stock her business with basic household products, and earn the necessary income to support her daughter.   

With a well-stocked store, she is going to offer better customer service. Her goal is to grow as a small businessperson, and generate income so that she can save and provide her daughter with an education.

loans.use: To stock her business with food products, such as staple grains, dairy products, soft drinks, lard, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmardorj is 40 years old and lives with his three children in a ger in Hovd province, in Mongolia. Two of his children go to secondary school, and one of them is a college student. His wife has seasonal work. She works at a wool processing factory from April until December and also works in the food industry from December until March. Her position is part time, so she helps with husband's business in her free time. 

Mr. Myagmardorj has been running a organic vegetable retailing business since 2011. During his free time, he runs a taxi service, which he started in 2004 with his own car. This year he planted organic vegetables in a 2-hectare garden. He sells his business's products at wholesale prices in the spring and autumn. During winter and springtime, organic vegetable prices will increase, therefore, he needs to build a vegetable storage pit to store vegetables. He is a hard-working and modest person who says ''my goal is to construct my own house, so I'm collecting construction materials. It will be finished next year.''  He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to build an organic vegetable storage pit.

loans.use: To build a organic vegetable storage pit

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help in educating her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gemma hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will all finish college through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Sindu

texts.en: Sindu is 20 years old and a student who comes from Klaten. His father works as a teacher in an elementary school in Klaten. Klaten is a small city in the Center of Java Island in Indonesia. Sindu has just finished his education in a vocational school, the technical department in Klaten, so it is easier for him to continue his education in the Maritime Academy. But he didn't want to burden his parents with his educational fees for the Maritime Academy in Cilacap. He heard from his friend that he could ask for a loan to pay for his educational fees for that Academy and he is really grateful to YSBS and Kiva for helping him to get the loan. The loan really helps Sindu's parents too, because it will be easier for Sindu to continue his education.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Mrs. Batsuh, who is 52 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a ger in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar. Her son works in the Zaamar gold mine, and her daughter stays at home. In 2008, she started a plastic, can, and glass recycling business; before that, she made and sold leather jackets. Her husband helps with her business, which is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. Mrs. Batsuh is building a house with the profits from her business. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase insulation for her new house and more recycling materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase insulation for her new house and more recycling materials for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has 4 children. Grace is 37 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Grace owns and operates a farm, and she plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP from doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2011, Grace joined GDMPC. In the future, Grace wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy some additional supplies that are needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Loreta hopes her business grows, and she dreams to have her own house through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay the raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Martha Jakeline

texts.es:
Martha tiene 25 años, está casada con Jaime de 35 años quien trabaja como operador de maquinaria, tiene 3 hijos de 11, 10 y 7 años edad. Viven al sur de la ciudad de Quito capital de la República del Ecuador, específicamente en el barrio de Chimbacalle un barrio muy emblemático de Quito principalmente por ser la morada de la única Estación de trenes de la capital la cual se convertirá en un museo ferroviario que a la par con los museos de su alrededor se ha convertido en uno de los lugares turísticos más visitados del país. Sumado a este atractivo, en general, el sector sur de la ciudad de Quito en los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente tanto urbana y económicamente, es así que inversionistas han apostado para sembrar sus ideas en varios puntos clave de este sector.
En Chimbacalle creció Martha en una familia de escasos recursos económicos quienes le dieron la oportunidad de terminar la primaria. Se casó muy joven y gracias a la enseñanza de una amiga, decidió generar recursos a través de la elaboración de “espumilla” un postre típico ecuatoriano que es el preferido de niños y adultos. Inició este negocio hace 8 años y le dedica al menos 3 horas al día, pues además de sus quehaceres domésticos, ofrece productos cosméticos que le generan una ganancia adicional. Con el crédito otorgado Martha espera producir más “espumilla” diaria y además comprar productos para incrementar el stock y de esta forma generar los ingresos necesarios para lograr una economía estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 25 years old.  She is married to 35-year old Jaime, who is a machine operator.  They have three children who are 11, 10 and 7 years old.  They live in the south of Quito, the capital of the Republic of Ecuador.  More specifically, they live in the Chimbacalle neighborhood, which is emblematic of Quito primarily for being the home of the Capital's only train station. It is going to be converted into a railway museum which, on par with neighboring museums, has become one of the most visited tourist attractions in the country.  In addition this attraction, in the last few years, the southern area of Quito has developed remarkably, both urban-wise and financially.  Investors have bet on planting their ideas in various key points of this sector.  
Martha grew up in Chimbacalle in a low-income family.  She was able to finish primary school.  She got married very young, and thanks to what a friend taught her, she decided to earn some money by making “espumilla,” an Ecuadorian dessert (similar to a meringue) loved by children and adults alike.  She started the business 8 years ago and spends about 3 hours a day on it.  In addition to her household chores, she also sells cosmetics, which gives her an additional income.  With the loan, Martha hopes to make more daily “espumilla” and to purchase products to increase her cosmetics stock so that she can earn the income she needs to provide her family with stable finances.

loans.use: to increase her production of "espumilla" (a meringue-like treat) and to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Luisa Piedad

texts.es:
Luisa comenzó con un cajón vendiendo en el centro de la ciudad papelería y notas de venta. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. Consiguió tener un local en la parte delantera de su casa ya que  con la  ayuda de su hija que es su mano derecha en el negocio trabaja en el  horario de 8:30am  a 22:00pm realizan anillados, plastificados, impresiones, recargas y cyber.

Unas de sus dificultades es el espacio físico del local. Luisa tiene 4 hijos pero todos son adultos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en el negocio por eso con el préstamo va a comprar papelería, suministros de oficina  . Unas de sus metas es dejar estable el negocio para sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Luisa began with a crate selling paper and order forms in the downtown of the city.  Little by little her income improved.  She managed to put in a store in the front part of her house.  With the help of her daughter, who is her right hand in the business, she works from 8:30 a.m. until 10 p.m.  They do binding, laminating, printing, phone cards, and computing.

One of her difficulties is the physical space in her place.  Luisa has four children but all are adults.  She has many hopes for her business.  This is why she's going to buy paper and office supplies.  One of her goals is to leave the business stable for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy paper and office supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Germania Patricia

texts.es:
Germania es una persona amable, de muy buen caracter que trata con cualquier persona, le gusta su trabajo y desea tener éxito en su vida y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Germania vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Germania se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, negocio que empezó hace un año con iniciativa propia, en este negocio actualmente le va muy bien ya que sustenta los gastos de su hogar y de sus estudios, Germania necesita realizar un crédito para invertir en la construcción de un galpón de pollos más grande y comprar crías de pollos blancos ya que son más cotizados en su medio y de esta manera sus ingresos se incrementar´na considerablemente y logrará en un tiempo mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Germania sueña en comprarse un terreno para poder críar más animalitos.
texts.en:
Germania is a nice person with very good character who can get along well with anyone. She likes her work and she wants to be successful and improve her family’s quality of life. Germania lives with her parents in the city of Ibarra. 

Germania raises and sells chickens. She started her business a year ago through her own initiative. Currently, her business is going very well since she can keep up with her household and educational expenses. Germania needs a loan to invest in the construction of a larger chicken coop. She also wants to purchase white chickens since they are more sought-after. This will increase her profits considerably and with time, she will improve her quality of life. 

Germania dreams about purchasing a plot of land for herself where she can raise more animals.

loans.use: build a larger chicken coop and purchase white chickens

loans.name: Marlina Stephany

texts.es:
Marlina, vive en casa propia con su esposo y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de perfumes desde hace dos años comenzó el negocio y hasta hoy ha sido estable.

Estasolicitado un crédito para capital de trabajo lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes y pago de pedidos de perfumes, este crédito le ayudara a mejorar el inventario y variar los productos, adquiriendo la mercaderia a mejor valor por pagar al contado.

Su sueño es tener un negocio propio en el mercado, pues esto le dara una mejor estabilidad y ganar mas clientes ademas generar más ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Marlina lives in her own home with her husband and has two children. She works selling perfume. She began the business two years ago and it has been steady. 

She has asked for a loan for working capital to invest in the purchase of perfume and to pay for the orders of perfumes. The loan will help her improve the inventory and to vary the products, acquiring merchandise at a good price by paying cash.

Her dream is to have her own business at the market, as this will give her more stability and more clients and also generate more income for the house.

loans.use: to buy perfume paying cash to get good prices to improve her inventory and vary her products for her business

loans.name: Ondina

texts.es: Ondina de 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Ondina tiene su propio negocio de venta de comida y helados, el negocio tiene un año de haberlo establecido en su casa donde ofrece a sus clientes almuerzos y cenas, refrescos y helados para postre. Ha invertido varios préstamos en el negocio para mantenerlo estable, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo y es por 23,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar insumos para la elaboración de comida como ser: carnes, verduras, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, refrescos y helados. Su objetivo es aumentar las ventas y lograr tener un fondo de ahorro y darles el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ondina, age 28, is married and has two children.  She lives in the Arizona municipality in Atlántida.

Ondina has her own business selling food and ice cream.  She established her business in her house one year ago.  She sells her customers lunches and dinners, soft drinks, and ice cream for dessert.

She has invested various loans in the business in order to keep it stable.  She is currently requesting her fourth cycle, which is for 23,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy supplies to make the food.  She will buy things like meat, vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, soft drinks, and ice cream.

Her goal is to increase sales, to manage to have funds saved, and to give her daughters an education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, condiments, rice, beans, flour, and  lard to make food, and soft drinks and ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy household furniture, mixers, irons, rice cookers, dish racks for her business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Planting and harvesting vegetables to sell and raising and fattening pigs are Rizalina's businesses to make income for a living. She plants string beans, eggplant and bitter gourd, harvests them and personally sells those harvested crops in the market. Currently, two heads of pig are also being raised by Rizalina as an additional source of income in times of emergencies. 

She plans to borrow 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) as added capital to roll in the business to keep it growing. She will use the loan in buying fertilizer and various vegetable seeds like eggplant and bitter gourd. Rizalina also wants to improve her hog raising by buying additional pigs and hog feed for the livestock feeding maintenance. Her hope is to improve her income for the education of her three younger children.  

As for Rizalina's motto in life, "health is wealth." Her utmost dream is not to become wealthy someday but to keep her family away from illnesses, which is already a treasure for her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, various vegetable seeds like eggplant and bitter gourd, pigs and hog feed.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María es una persona emprendedora, muy feliz, trabajadora de mente positiva y que busca el bienestar de sus hijos. María vive con su esposo y sus ocho hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

María trabaja con sus hijos en la confección de bordados en manteles, centros de mesa, toallas; negocio que le representa buenos ingresos lo cual es importante para su familia ya que es una fuente económica única en su familia, por tal motivo María necesita que su negocio siga en marcha y solicita un crédito el cual va a ser invertido en la compra de rollos de tela e hilos de distintos colores para confeccionar bordados en manteles para comedor.

María sueña que su producto sea de exportación y que su negocio siga creciendo constantemente para que sus ingresos ayuden a que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising, very happy, and hardworking person who has a positive attitude and watches out for the well-being of her children.  María lives with her husband and her eight children in the city of Ibarra.

María works with her children doing embroidery on tablecloths, runners, and towels.  The business brings her good income, which is important for her family because she's the only source of income.  This is why María needs her business to keep going.

She's requesting a loan to invest in buying rolls of fabric and thread in various colors to embroider dining room tablecloths.

María dreams of exporting her product and for her business to continue growing constantly so her income helps her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and different colors of thread to embroider tablecloths

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos, tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive con la esposa y dos de sus hijos en Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. El se ha dedicado a la construcción de casas, pero siempre le ha gustado la ganadería y hace 5 años decidió dedicarse a este negocio, donde compra y vende el ganando, de variada raza como vacuno, equino, lecheras y otros. En su comunidad es rentable este negocio ya que los clientes las compran para cría, para destazo y para producción de leche. El préstamo que solicita es por 23,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más ganado para la reventa. Este préstamo le ayudara a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. Su meta es convertirse en productor de ganado de clase y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old. He is married, with four children, and lives with his wife and two of his children in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. He has been working in house construction, but has always liked livestock-raising. So five years ago he decided to devote himself to this business, where he buys and sells livestock of varied kinds, such as beef cattle, milk cows and horses.

In his community, this business is profitable, as customers buy them to raise, for butchering and for milk production. 

The loan he is requesting is for 23,000 lempiras, with which he is going to buy more cattle for resale. This loan will help him to earn greater income for his family. His goal is to become a producer of high-quality cattle, and this way earn greater income.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con una hija y dos nietos en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Aproximadamente dos años que doña Cristina se ha dedicado a atender su propio negocio, donde vende ropa de segunda mano clasificada para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella ha mantenido estable el negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, el que solicita actualmente es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF, con el cual va comprar fardos de ropa usada clasificada para surtir el negocio como ser: pantalones, camisas, blusas, pantalones cortos y otros. Su meta tener una tienda grande y poder darles a sus hijos un patrimonio mejor.
texts.en:
Cristina is 56 years old and has two children.  She lives with a daughter and two grandchildren in the Azacualpa municipality in Santa Bárbara.

Cristina has been tending her own business for approximately two years.  She sells second hand clothes for men, women, and children.  She has kept the business stable through the investment of various loans.

The loan she is now requesting for 15,000 lempiras is her fourth cycle with ODEF.  She will use it to buy two bundles of used clothes to stock her business with pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, and others.

Her goal is to have a large store and to be able to give her children a better legacy.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest by opening a home based fruit stand to earn extra income

loans.name: Andres Erasmo

texts.es: Don Andrés, tiene 56 años de edad, casado, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Por mucho tiempo se dedico a realizar trabajos agrícolas y por necesidad de obtener más ingresos para el hogar, decidió establecer una pulpería en este negocio vende granos básicos, huevos, lácteos, harina, papel higiénico, condimentos, productos enlatados, pastas, refrescos, etc. el negocio tiene tres años de funcionar y tiene buena clientela. El está solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para surtir más el negocio de productos alimenticios, con el fin de aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo y llegar a tener un supermercado para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Andres, 56, is married and lives with his wife in the municipality of Azacualpa, in the department of Santa Bárbara.  He worked as a farmer for a long time, but due to the need to generate more income for his household he decided to set up a grocery store business.  In his store he sells staple grains, eggs, dairy products, flour, toilet paper, condiments, canned goods, pastas, drinks, etc.  His business has been running for 3 years, and he has a good customer base.  He is requesting a loan for 7,000 Honduran lempiras to stock up his store with food products so that he can increase his sales.  His goal is to continue to grow and eventually have a supermarket so that he can help his family financially.

loans.use: to stock up his store with groceries such as: rice, sugar, flour, beans, butter, dairy products, drinks, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Odontuya

texts.en:
S.Odontuya is 55 years old and lives with her two children in a yurt in Hovd province, Mongolia. She has a medium standard of living and has been working at TUBO LLC since 2007. As well, she and her son have been selling handmade bread and fancy cakes in the local market since 1996. She says, "I must continue with this business to earn money because the income from this business makes up most of my family's income."

A very free and kindly person, Odontuya is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT to pay a student fee.

loans.use: to pay a student fee.

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
This is Noraida, a 65-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines who is married to Mama and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Noraida oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Noraida is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Noraida dreams of giving her family a good life through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 32 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea de la ciudad de Gracias, Lempira. El tiene 16 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende  en el mercado local al por mayor. El solicita 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar mano de obra en el cultivo y cosecha de maíz y frijoles. Este préstamo es el segundo que ha solicitado y espera sacar buenas cosechas y buenas utilidades. Sus metas son ampliar la producción para poder continuar estudiando hasta sacar una licenciatura y que sus hijos también terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old. He has two children, and lives in a village near the city of Gracias, Lempira. He has been farming for 16 years. He grows corn and beans. He sells this output at wholesale in the local market. 

He is applying for 20,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor in growing and harvesting corn and beans.  

This loan is the second he has requested, and he hopes to get good harvests and good profits. His goals are to expand output so that he can continue going to school until he receives a bachelor's degree, and for his children to also complete their education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.es: Doña Engracia, tiene 55 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 5 años que doña Engracia se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa interior para damas y caballeros, calzado, calcetas, blusas, camisetas etc. este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local que alquilo, y está ubicado en punto estratégico donde hay afluencia de clientes. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, comprara más ropa interior, blusas, calcetas y zapatos. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos la administren como su patrimonio.
texts.en: Engracia, 55, is a single mother of 2.  She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa in the department of Santa Barbara. For 5 years, Engracia has been selling merchandise such as undergarments for men and women, shoes, socks, blouses, T-shirts, etc.  She set up this business in a storefront that she rents which is located in a strategic point where there is a constant flow of customers.  She is requesting a loan for 21,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in merchandise to stock her business.  She will buy more underwear, blouses, socks and shoes.  Her goal is to eventually have a big store that she can pass down to her children.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Santano

texts.es: Doña María de 60 años es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo y una hija en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella es muy emprendedora, tiene su negocio desde hace 20 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como arroz, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, churros, refrescos, y también vende sandalias y algunos útiles escolares. y como otros ingresos también cuenta con la producción y venta de productos lácteos como queso y mantequilla o crema. El préstamo que está solicitando por 5,000 Lempiras lo va invertir en la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, papel higiénico y refrescos. Con esta inversión va incrementar sus ventas porque va tener más surtido de productos nuevos. Su meta es incrementar los ingresos para ayudar a su hija con algunos gastos de la universidad.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and married. She has two children, and lives with her husband and a daughter in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida. 

She is very enterprsing, and has had her store for 20 years. Here she sells basic household necessities, such as rice, lard, beans, sugar, corn, churros (treat made with fried dough) and soft drinks. She also sells sandals and some school supplies. 

The loan of 5,000 lempiras she is requesting, she is going to use to purchase corn, beans, rice, flour, lard, toilet paper and soft drinks. 

With this investment, she is going to increase her sales, because she is going to have a greater supply of new products.

Her goal is to increase her income, in order to help her daughter with some university expenses.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, flour, lard, toilet paper and soft drinks for stocking her store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor  Roberto tiene 59 años, con hijos ya independientes, sigue con su actividad que es la administración de un baño público de su propiedad, el Sr.  Roberto vive en casa propia y su negocio   se encuentra en  el mismo domicilio es trabajador   ya que cuenta  con varios negocios el préstamo lo invertirá en la refacción de algunos ambientes de su domicilio el está muy feliz por el apoyo brindado ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien.
texts.en: Roberto, 59, is continuing to work in his business.  He runs a public bathroom which is on his property. His children are already independent.  Roberto lives in his own home, and his business is located in his home.  He is hardworking, and has several businesses.  He will use this loan to make some repairs to his house.  He is very happy with the support being provided, because it went very well with his previous loan.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his house

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda tiene 31 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 10, 7  años y una bebe de 4 meses,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de Chasquipampa en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hilda is 31 years old, married with three children who are 10 years old, 7 years old, and a baby of 4 months. She works selling stationery supplies, writing materials, books, etc.

She sells a variety of products according to the season. Her bookstore-bazaar is located in the area of Chasquipampa in a very busy place in the southern area. She lives in the family home. She is asking for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise with the purchase of school supplies for her bookstore-bazaar which is going very well and has good sales because of the location. She is a person that meets her payments, is trustworthy and hardworking, and is grateful with the institution for the provided support.

loans.use: to buy school supplies in order to stock up on merchandise for her stationery store

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда замужем. У нее трое сыновей.  Двое получают высшее образование, а младший учится в школе.  Надежда имеет собственный бизнес.

Надежда занимается выездной торговлей на протяжении 15 лет. Она торгует носками, нижним бельем, тапочками и т.д. У Надежды хорошие взаимоотношения с окружающими, поэтому проблем с торговлей нет.  У нее есть цель развивать бизнес и увеличивать доход, что бы обеспечивать семью.

Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку товара к осенне-зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Nadezhda is married and has three children. Two are in college, and the youngest is in primary school.  Nadezhda has her own business: she has been doing traveling sales for 15 years. She sells socks, underwear, slippers, etc. Nadezhda gets along well with people, so selling comes easily to her. Her goal is to grow her business and increase her income to provide for her family. Nadezhda is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 grivnas to buy merchandise for the fall-winter season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the fall-winter season

loans.name: Prodencio

texts.en: Prodencio, 53 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Lapasan, Clarin, with three children. He is earning a living from his auto repair shop. He started it almost 25 years ago and he earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. To improve his business, he borrowed 15,000 PHP from GDMPC (which he just joined last 2006) to obtain accessories and tires. Prodencio’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es: María, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su madre, sobrina, esposo e hijo. María tiene 5 años de haber decidido vender mercadería como camisetas, cosméticos, champú, cremas,  jeans, pantalones cortos, y ropa interior. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ella ha sido cliente de ODEF con varios prestamos, con el actual de 15,000 lempiras son 10 ciclos y han sido para mantener activo su negocio y obtener los ingresos para la manutención de su familia. El préstamo lo usara para surtir de ropa, cosméticos y joyas con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es seguir con el negocio para mejorar su casa y darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 32, married, and has a son. She lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida, with her mother, niece, husband and son. 

It is five years since María decided to sell merchandise such as T-shirts, cosmetics, shampoo, creams, jeans, shorts and underwear. 

She sells door-to-door and through orders. She has been a client of ODEF for several loans. With the current one for 15,000 lempiras it makes ten loans. 

These have been to keep her business going and to obtain the income for supporting her family. 

She will use the loan to stock up on clothing, cosmetics and jewelry, with the aim of increasing her sales and her income. 

Her goal is stay in business, in order to improve her home and provide her son with an education.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Margarita

texts.es:
Yessenia empezó vendiendo bebidas para aumentar sus ingresos en la parte delantera de su casa.Escogió esta actividad porque no había por el sector donde vive el negocio de venta de bebidas.

Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos por eso ahora su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 7:00am hasta las 18:00pm en donde vende bebidas, dulces, papeleria etc.

Yessenia es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 17 años y 8 años y estudian en escuela y colegio fiscal. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su necgoio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo bebias y papeleria. Unas de sus metas es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Yessenia started selling drinks from the front part of her house to improve her income.  She chose this type of business because there was no place that sells drinks in the area where she lives.

She has slowly been improving her income and carries out her work alone from 7:00am to 6:00pm selling drinks, sweets, stationary etc. 

Yessenia is a single mother and has two children of 17 and 8 years old who are studying at primary and high school. She has many dreams for her business and for this reason she wants to use the loan to but drinks and stationary. One of her goals is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks and stationary.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
"Patience pays," says Veronica. "Without it, you would not bear fruits to harvest someday," she adds. Her dream is to save for her children's education in college, for she believes that education is the only resource she can give them that cannot be stolen by anyone.    

Veronica, 35 years old, is married with three school-age children. She is managing a general store in her village somewhere in Mallig. She rolled approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) into the business four years ago. Each month, Veronica's income ranges from 10,000 PHP to 20,000 PHP, including her husband's monthly earnings from his charcoal-making activity. 

Now Veronica is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan as additional capital to roll into her store and use to buy stock of groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, baked breads, candies and many more. Veronica also wants to buy hog feed, rice and rice bran as added products to offer in the store in order to further increase her income for the future welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, baked breads, candies, hog feed, rice and rice bran.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a responsible housewife who aims to become successful someday. She is 31 years old and was blessed with two children. 

For lack of job opportunities, she engages in the hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She aimed to strengthen the business and generate sufficient income to satisfy the family's needs and save for the future of their children.  

She planned to acquire more piglets to raise for fattening, but she has not enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 40,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes this financial assistance will be a great help for her to work out her plan, and she is hoping that someday, she will make the business grow and profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, who is 43 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses. 
 
Evangeline operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then resell them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy by her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: San Cristobal - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN CRISTOBAL – 26 está  compuesto por nueve integrantes seis mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Adelia tiene 29 años, es casada con un hijito de cuatro años de edad vive por la zona de San Cristóbal,   La Sra. Adelia,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su sexta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Adelia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos para surtir su negocio como abarrotes y refrescos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Adelia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Adelia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Bank of San Cristobal-26 is comprised of nine members, six are female and three are male. The president of the bank is Adelia she is 29 years old and is married with a 4-year-old child. She lives in the area of San Cristóbal. Adelia owns a store in the area where she lives selling a variety of customer staples. 

This loan is the sixth from the institution. Adelia is going to use the loan to purchase a variety of products such as groceries and soft drinks for her business. With these goods she will provide a variety of products to her customers. The reason she is requesting a loan is to continue to grow her business. 

Adelia is going to use the loan to continue to buy products and improve her income. Her dream for her business is to have a bigger store and therefore provide better service to her customers. 

Adelia is a hard working person and she is happy for the opportunity given to her and her group members. Many of the members sole breadwinners of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as groceries and soft drinks for the business

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino de 25 años de edad, convive con Margarita de 25 años y fruto de ese amor, tienen a su pequeño hijo Luis; viven en su propia casa, construido habase de material rustico. Sabino, asegura que el producto de café se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, no solo para él, sino para el resto de los campesinos, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones. Cada año va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la calidad de su producto.
En tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros, con la finalidad de culminar de manera ágil su trabajo. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio a 1 hora de su comunidad. Con el dinero del crédito comprará fertilizantes naturales para la buena producción de sus plantas de café. Este es su crédito número 02, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo más lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformes por el buen manejo de su grupo.
Con el préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles, hará la compra de abono natural para el buen mantenimiento y buena producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sabino is 25 years old and lives with Margarita who is also 25 years old. From the fruit of their love they have a small child, Luis. They live in their own home made of rustic materials. 

Sabino ensured that over the past few years that the coffee product has grown to a good business, not only for him, but also for the rest of the farmers. He maximizes the benefits of his plantations. Every year he has more of a business presence in his town so he tries to improve the quality of his product. In times of harvesting and weeding he needs help from laborers, with the purpose to expedite his work. He sells his product in the collection center, 1 hour from his community. 

With the money from the loan he will buy natural fertilizers for the production of his coffee plants. This is his second loan, for which he promises to maintain his payment schedule. He will continue to advance with this community bank because people are happy with his efforts. With the loan of 1000 soles, he will buy natural fertilizers for the maintenance and improved production of his crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория не замужем. У нее есть сын Алексей. Виктория имеет свой  бизнес.

Виктория занимается продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке города на протяжении  7 лет.  Торговое место у нее собственное, есть постоянные покупатели. Виктория дружелюбная, ответственная и трудолюбивая.

Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 12000 гривен на закупку осенней детской одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль, и тем самым улучшить быт ее семьи.
texts.en: Viktoria is single, and has a son, Aleksei. Viktoria has her own business; she has been selling children's clothing at the town's central market for 7 years. She has her own retail outlet and has regular customers. Viktoria is friendly, responsible, and hardworking. She has asked for a loan in the amount of 12,000 hrivnas to buy children's fall clothing. The loan will help to increase her income, and improve her family's standard of living, too.

loans.use: to buy children's fall clothing

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is 49 years old and single. She is from Molicay, Ozamis City. She has been raising bananas for five years and earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Edwina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion, 38 years old, is now a widow for two years. Her husband died in 2010 due to hypertension. She is a mother of two children, both in their elementary grades. Her income in the business goes towards the welfare of her children. 

As a single parent, Visitacion works hard to succeed in the businesses she manages. She runs a store where she invested PHP 50,000 as current revolving capital. Activities that made Visitacion busy most of the time are the simple buying and selling of corn during harvest season using the PHP 20,000 initial capital.

She wants to borrow PHP 30,000 that will be used as additional capital in her store. She will buy stock of different grocery items like noodles, canned goods, soda, powdered juice, bread, and many more items. Some of the loan will also be invested in corn to buy and sell to get a bigger income. As she said, the bigger the capital, the bigger the income.

Someday, when her business revolving fund is stable, she wants to develop a grocery store in their place.  Her corn buying and selling will improve further to become competitive with other traders that are present in their place.

loans.use: to buy different grocery items like noodles, canned goods, soda, powdered juice, breads, and many more items.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, who is 39 years old and a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Her husband is Felix, a businessman.  She has one child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange.  A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue; these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000.  She will be using the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gemma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is 25 years old, married, and a hardworking woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband. She does not have any children. Her husband is running a welding shop and she wants to invest some amount into his business, as he needs some machinery for his shop. 

Since 2010, she herself has been working as a social worker and an efficient tailor and is interested in increasing her tailoring business.

For that, as a member of a six-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new tailoring machine and clothing material for her business. 

She prays for her husband's healthy and long life. She is very thankful to Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and clothing material for her business.

loans.name: 34-Emprendimiento-34 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 34-EMPRENDIMIENTO-34 está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ana tiene 30 años, es casada tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución es cliente antigua, la Sra. Ana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Bank 34, is comprised of 9 members, 8 women and one man. The president of the bank is Ana, a 30 year old married woman with 4 school age children. She has a food stand in the same area where she lives. This is her third loan with the group and she has a credit history. Ana will use this loan to buy bulk purchase of rice, pasta, and potatoes to make meals. This way she will offer a variety of meals to her customers. The reasons she is requesting the loan is to continue to improve her business. 

Ana is using the loan to continue buying more goods and improve her income. Her dream for her business is to have a restaurant and provide better service to her customers. 

Ana is a hard working person and is happy for the opportunity given to her and her team members who in many cases are the sole breadwinners of their family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale rice, pasta, and potatoes.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Cananvalle Group

texts.es:
Triunfadoras Cananvalle es una sociedad de tres personas emprendedoras que tienen un mismo objetivo que es el de ayudar a sus familias a mejorar su calidad de vida, de esta sociedad la presidenta es Miryan la señorita del medio en la fotografía; Miryan es una persona trabajadora y le gusta salir adelante.

Este grupo se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas y pollos, este negocio lo tienen mucho tiempo y poco a poco las compañeras se han unido para tener un buen capital de trabajo y que sus utilidades sean mayores, al momento necesitan invertir en la construcción de galpones solo para gallinas que van a empollar huevos y para la compra de balanceado para sus gallinas y pollos.

Estas tres personas emprendedoras sueñan en un futuro construir más galpones y comprar más crías para que su negocio genere más ingresos.
texts.en:
“Triunfadoras Cananvalle” is a group of three enterprising individuals. They have the same goal of helping their families achieve a better quality of life. The group president is Miryan, the young woman who is in the middle of the photograph. Miryan is a hardworking person who likes to get ahead.

This group raises and sells hens and chickens. The business takes up much of their time, and gradually the partners have joined together to build up a large amount of working capital and generate better profits. At the moment, they need to build coops where the hens can lay their eggs. They will also buy balanced feed for the hens and chickens.

In the future, these three enterprising individuals plan to build more chicken coops and buy more birds to raise so that their business can generate more income.

loans.use: to build a henhouse and buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married, with five children.   She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Conchita has raised corn for a living for six years, and every month she earns PHP 5,600 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Conchita been a member of GDMPC since 2008. 

In the future, Conchita hopes to have her children complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 50 years old and a hardworking and independent woman.   She lives in Punjab Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and two daughters. Her two daughters and one son are studying.  Her husband is an auto mechanic, but his income is too low to meet the basic expenses of his family. 

So since 2006 Sajida, by stitching clothes, has helped her husband to meet the household's and children's education expenses. And now she is interested in continuing to grow her business by purchasing a new tailoring machine and tailoring materials like thread and clothing.  For that, as a member of a four-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.
