She is very hopeful that the loan amount will bring out a positive change in their life.  Note: In the picture Sajida is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine and some tailoring materials.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila, 37, is married with four children who are all currently studying: one in college, one in high school and two in grade school. She is working hard to get bigger income for their education. 

She has managed a general store for the past year. She invested PHP10,000 initial capital in the business. Luckily, she is earning PHP6,000 net income monthly in the store and her husband earns a salary from the construction site where he works.

To keep her business improving for her family's growing needs, Laila is requesting the amount of PHP10,000 to buy stock of merchandise to sell such as shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, creamer, seasonings, breads, and many more.  

Her principle in life is, "Keep yourself patient at all times and you will reap a good fruit someday."

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, conditioner, coffee, sugar, creamer, seasonings, breads, and many more.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman is a married man who has three sons and three daughters. He lives in Tiribe, a small town in the coastal region of Kenya. For the last three years, Athman has been operating a motorcycle taxi, serving the community. It is a business he loves though he narrates that it is a risky business--especially operating on dark alleys.

In addition to this business, Athman has a retail shop run by his wife. They work well together; they normally share ideas. Athman is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 10,000 to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. In addition to this, he will also purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and rice for his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and bales of flour, sugar, and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: MARGARITO ES UN HOMBRE DE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA SEPARADO Y VIVE SOLO CON SU HIJA QUE ACTUALMENTE ESTA ESTUDIANDO. EL TRABAJA COMO VIGILANTE EN UN AUDITORIO DE LA CIUDAD. Y APOYA A SU HIJA CON SUS ESTUDIOS. MARGARITO HA VISTO LA NECESIDAD DE REMODELAR EN SU CASA LAS PUERTAS Y VENTAS QUE TIENE, YA QUE CONSIDERA DE SUMA IMPORTANCIA MANTENER LA SEGURIDAD DE SU FAMILIA Y EL BIENESTAR DE SU HOGAR. POR ESTA RAZON EL SOLICITA UN PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL LLEVARA ACABO LA COMPRA DE LOS MATERIALES NECESARIOS PARA INSTALAR NUEVAS PUERTAS Y VENTANAS EN SU CASA.
texts.en:
Margarito is 50 years old. He is separated, and lives alone with his daughter, who is currently going to school. He works as a guard at an auditorium in the city, and helps his daughter with her studies. 

Margarito has seen the need to renovate his home by replacing doors and windows, as he considers it be of the highest importance that he maintain his family's safety, and the well-being of their household. 

For this reason, he is applying for a loan with which he will carry out the purchase of the necessary materials to install new doors and windows in his home.

loans.use: To replace doors and windows.

loans.name: Marve

texts.en:
Marve has been a simple farmer for eight years in Mallig, Isabela in the Philippines. He is 37, and is married with three children who are all school aged. 

He raises three fattening pigs and one pig for breeding purpose. He also manages a rice and corn farm of almost two hectares to financially support his family's daily living. From the livestock business, he is earning the average income of PHP12,000 in three-four months. 

Marve is now requesting his second loan amounting to PHP30,000 as added capital in his farming and livestock business. He will buy sacks of hog feed to sufficiently sustain his livestock. His hope is to continue improving his livestock business for the future college education of his children.   

Marve also operates a furniture shop business where he invested his first availed loan.

loans.use: to buy hog feed for livestock business maintenance.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married mother of four children who are attending a local primary school. She works every day to be able to fill the role of a mother for her family.

She opened a store in her house, selling cereals, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit.  There is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more cereals, such as dry maize, beans, and rice.

loans.use: to buy more cereals, such as dry maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is aged 23 years and married, with one son who is too young for school.  Sor lives in a thatched roof house in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia.  

To support the family, she has farmed rice and raised pigs and supplemented the family’s income by growing various kinds of vegetables for selling. The current business earns her about KHR 80,000 per day to meet family's needs.

Sor is new with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she and her group member are asking for a loan of KHR 200,000 and KHR 500,000, respectively. 

As the leader, Sor will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to gain more income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising livestock. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор очень веселая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет  3 детей. Детям 18, 22 и 28 лет. Ее муж работает преподавателем и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Гулбахор  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 4800 сомони для покупки 2 теленка, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a very happy and cheerful woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children — 18, 22, and 28. Her husband is a teacher and receives a small salary, which is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities if life. Gulbahor decided to help her husband for the family's benefit. With this in mind, she took a course called "Succeed" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received her graduation certificate. She wants to start a business selling livestock, since she has experience in this type of business. She plans to use the income to provide her children with a quality education and food. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 4800 somons to buy two calves to start her businsess. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves for starting a new business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Более 5 лет она работает учительницей в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Она давно мечтала организовать свой бизнес, но не имела достаточного средства. С целью реализовать свою мечту она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  сухофруктов. Она планирует продавать свой товар на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 26 and married with one child. She's been working as a middle school teacher for over 5 years -- a job that does not pay well.
Shahnoza has wanted to start a business for a long time but didn't have the means to. To make her dream come true, she took the Business Woman Get Ahead class and received a certificate. Shahnoza wants to start a dried fruit trading business. She plans to sell dried fruit at a local market.
Shahnoza has requested a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy dried fruit to start her new business. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit to start a new business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 49 years old, married, and has 12 children. Among them, 11 were in school therefore Robert is working very hard in farming to support the necessities of his family. He manages a livestock business where he is consistently raising three fattening pigs for sale and one breeding hog for ten years now. Using his own money, Robert started the business. 

He is requesting now the amount of PHP15,000 to buy two pigs as replacements to his sold fattening pigs and to buy hog feed. His hope is that after four months he will have a bigger income in the business. To provide for their daily living and school allowances of the children, Robert and wife also buy and sell recycled materials. Coupled with hard work, patience and determination, Robert continues in reaching his dream and that is to provide complete education to his children for a better life.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and hog feed.

loans.name: Hasib

texts.en:
Hasib, 27 years old, lives in Kosovo. He is married and has three children, whose ages range from 3 months old to 5 years old. Hasib is currently employed as a security guard and also works in the traditional agricultural business of caring for and tending to sheep. Hasib has 30 sheep and he sells the lamb in the local market. Hasib is requesting a loan to pay for plastic pipes to set water in the stable for the sheep and to irrigate his vegetables. This loan will improve the conditions of both his stable and his vegetable production.

Hasib's goal is to increase his number of sheep in hopes of offering a better life to his family and to ensure quality education for his children. He very much appreciates this help!

loans.use: to buy plastic pipes to bring water into the stable and to irrigate his vegetables

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a tricycle rentals business in the Philippines for 4 years. Nerissa has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase motor oil, gasoline, and other motor parts. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase motor oil, gasoline and motor parts.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong resides in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province in Cambodia. She is 26 years old and married. She has one son, who is still too young for school. Rice farming on a four-hectare farmland is the main source of her family’s income, which she has been doing for two years. Kong’s husband also contributes some income by making palm juice to support the family. Together, they can earn around 20,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after paying for their daily expenses.

Kong has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while the other member is just in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her household expenses. Now, she is leading her group of two to request a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for laborers in plowing the field. She hopes to grow her rice quickly and healthfully so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Grace has been in this business for two years.  She sells a variety of items, such as soap, shampoo, sugar, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo, Jr.

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Guillermo Jr. works hard to support he family.

He has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and he also earns additional income from rice retail.  Guillermo Jr. is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant business.

Guillermo Jr. has been sustaining his business activities through his past nine loans from NWTF. He hopes that hard work will help him attain his dream of saving money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for his business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DURABANK, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bertha tiene 41 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de lavado de autos, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja en su negocio de lunes a domingo ,la socia se encarga de administrar su negocio el cual está abierto desde las 07:00am hasta las 06:00pm aproximadamente, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos de limpieza como silicona y detergentes .

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Durabank” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Bertha divides her time between her daily activities and her business of washing cars. She has been in this business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Bertha works at her business Monday through Sunday, which is open from 7:00 A.M. to approximately 6:00 P.M. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in order to help her family move forward.

Bertha is requesting a loan so that she can buy auto cleaning products, such as silicone and detergents. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy auto cleaning products, such as silicone and detergents.

loans.name: Benungu

texts.en:
Benungu is from the town of Tiribe. He drives a motorcycle taxi. He is married with two children and has worked operating a motorcycle taxi for 3 years. He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the winter he has a lot of challenges since he has fewer passengers given the cold weather. His dream is to accumulate enough money to open a big retail shop.


He is asking for this loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo raises pigs, two for fattening and one for breeding. He is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy a sufficient supply of hog feed to maintain his business needs. The income from this piggery business is used by Eduardo for his family's necessities at home and his child's school allowances. 

Eduardo is now 51 years old. He is married and has a child who is now in college. Together with his family, he lives happily in a village in Mallig, Isabela.  His hope is to give his family a better living someday. His determination and faith in God pushes him to work in an extraordinary way to attain it.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  She is single and manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lolita operates a food stall.  In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than the raw food.  Lolita's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Lolita is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita hopes that her nieces and nephews will finish their studies and dreams to have more customers that will patronize her food stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

Ingredients

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marianita has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns more income from raising livestock.

Marianita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en:
Mwahanje is 48 years of age.   He lives with his wife and seven children in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Mombasa, Kenya. For the past 3 years he has worked selling vegetables and fruits from his home, where he has a small extension. He sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions, cabbages, kales, carrots and other products. His wife is also involved in food vending, selling dumplings.

Mwahanje has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which he will use to buy more vegetables and fruits to supply his business and have higher sales. With this investment he will ensure availability of products to continue selling, as well as to cover his household expenses. In the future, Mwahanje would like to save to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Catherine works very hard to provide for them.

Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more products for her general store business.

Catherine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, milk, soap, etc.  In the future, she would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
For ten years, from his piggery business Rodrigo has able to support his family's everyday living. He is a small farmer in Mallig, married and has five children -- two are married and living separately and three are still studying. 

Rodrigo requested the amount of PHP10,000 to be used as added capital in maintaining his piggery business.  With it he will buy an additional pig and hog feed.  The income being generated from said business will be utilized to pay the tuition fees for his children and to improve their general living condition. 

Rodrigo hopes to keep the growth of his business and he is dedicated to it for his beloved family.

loans.use: buy hog feed and a pig for fattening

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 53-year-old married mother of three children, two daughters and one son -- one of them is still in school while the other two have their own employment. Farming rice and raising pigs are the main sources of the family’s income, which Yoeurn and her husband have been in for thirty-one years to support the family. Their current business earns them about 14,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for their paddy field.

This is the second microloan for Yoeurn’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The first loan has helped Yoerun to better support her household with  supplies and also expand her rice field. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan with VisionFund for 2,000,000 KHR each, Yoeurn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor to plow the field. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully in order to sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farmland
